chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质在N-末端区域包含一个泛素样结构域，三个跨膜片段和一个C-末端3-氧代-5-α类固醇4-脱氢酶结构域。该蛋白属于类固醇5-α还原酶家族。该基因突变导致室性心动过速，儿茶酚胺多态性，3。[由RefSeq提供，2017年4月] <>

name: SUMO4
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene is a member of the SUMO gene family. This family of genes encode small ubiquitin-related modifiers that are attached to proteins and control the target proteins' subcellular localization, stability, or activity. The protein described in this record is located in the cytoplasm and specifically modifies IKBA, leading to negative regulation of NF-kappa-B-dependent transcription of the IL12B gene. A specific polymorphism in this SUMO gene, which leads to the M55V substitution, has been associated with type I diabetes. The RefSeq contains this polymorphism. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Ubiquitin-like protein which can be covalently attached to target lysines as a monomer. Does not seem to be involved in protein degradation and may modulate protein subcellular localization, stability or activity. Upon oxidative stress, conjugates to various anti-oxidant enzymes, chaperones, and stress defense proteins. May also conjugate to NFKBIA, TFAP2A and FOS, negatively regulating their transcriptional activity, and to NR3C1, positively regulating its transcriptional activity. Covalent attachment to its substrates requires prior activation by the E1 complex SAE1-SAE2 and linkage to the E2 enzyme UBE2I.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因是SUMO基因家族的成员。该基因家族编码与泛蛋白相关的小泛素相关调节因子，它们与蛋白质相连并控制靶蛋白的亚细胞定位，稳定性或活性。本记录中描述的蛋白质位于细胞质中，特异性修饰IKBA，导致IL12B基因的NF-κB依赖性转录的负调节。该SUMO基因中的特定多态性导致M55V取代，与I型糖尿病有关。 RefSeq包含这种多态性。 [由RefSeq，2008年7月提供]来自UniProt：可以共价连接至靶标赖氨酸的泛素样蛋白作为单体。似乎不参与蛋白质降解，并可能调节蛋白质的亚细胞定位，稳定性或活性。在氧化应激时，与各种抗氧化酶，分子伴侣和应激防御蛋白结合。也可以与NFKBIA，TFAP2A和FOS结合，负调节它们的转录活性，并与NR3C1结合，从而正向调节其转录活性。共价连接至其底物需要事先通过E1复合体SAE1-SAE2活化并连接至E2酶UBE2I。<> <>

name: TBX1
eng: The TBX1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called T-box 1.  Genes in the T-box family play important roles in the formation of tissues and organs during embryonic development.  To carry out these roles, proteins produced from these genes bind to specific areas of DNA.  The proteins attach to critical regions near genes and help control the activity of those genes. T-box proteins are called transcription factors on the basis of this action.The T-box 1 protein appears  to be necessary for the normal development of muscles and bones of the face and neck, large arteries that carry blood out of the heart, structures in the ear, and glands such as the thymus and parathyroid.  Although the T-box 1 protein acts as a transcription factor, researchers have not determined which genes are regulated by this protein.<> <>
chi: TBX1基因提供制造称为T-box 1的蛋白质的说明.T-box家族中的基因在胚胎发育期间在组织和器官形成中起重要作用。为了发挥这些作用，由这些基因产生的蛋白质与DNA的特定区域结合。这些蛋白质附着于基因附近的关键区域，并有助于控制这些基因的活性。在这种作用的基础上，T-box蛋白被称为转录因子.T-box 1蛋白似乎是正常发育面部和颈部肌肉和骨骼，从心脏携带血液的大动脉，结构在耳朵和腺体如胸腺和甲状旁腺。尽管T-box 1蛋白作为转录因子起作用，但研究人员尚未确定哪种基因受该蛋白调控。“>”

name: TBC1D4
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene is a member of the Tre-2/BUB2/CDC16 domain family. The protein encoded by this gene is a Rab-GTPase-activating protein, and contains two phopshotyrosine-binding domains (PTB1 and PTB2), a calmodulin-binding domain (CBD), a Rab-GTPase domain, and multiple AKT phosphomotifs. This protein is thought to play an important role in glucose homeostasis by regulating the insulin-dependent trafficking of the glucose transporter 4 (GLUT4), important for removing glucose from the bloodstream into skeletal muscle and fat tissues. Reduced expression of this gene results in an increase in GLUT4 levels at the plasma membrane, suggesting that this protein is important in intracellular retention of GLUT4 under basal conditions. When exposed to insulin, this protein is phosphorylated, dissociates from GLUT4 vesicles, resulting in increased GLUT4 at the cell surface, and enhanced glucose transport. Phosphorylation of this protein by AKT is required for proper translocation of GLUT4 to the cell surface. Individuals homozygous for a mutation in this gene are at higher risk for type 2 diabetes and have higher levels of circulating glucose and insulin levels after glucose ingestion. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2015]From UniProt:May act as a GTPase-activating protein for RAB2A, RAB8A, RAB10 and RAB14. Isoform 2 promotes insulin-induced glucose transporter SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation at the plasma membrane, thus increasing glucose uptake.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因是Tre-2 / BUB2 / CDC16结构域家族的成员。该基因编码的蛋白是Rab-GTPase活化蛋白，含有两个酪氨酸结合结构域（PTB1和PTB2），一个钙调蛋白结合结构域（CBD），一个Rab-GTPase结构域和多个AKT磷酸化蛋白。这种蛋白质被认为通过调节葡萄糖转运蛋白4（GLUT4）的胰岛素依赖性运输在葡萄糖稳态中起重要作用，这对于从血流中去除葡萄糖进入骨骼肌和脂肪组织非常重要。该基因的表达降低导致质膜上的GLUT4水平增加，表明该蛋白质在基础条件下在细胞内保留GLUT4中是重要的。当暴露于胰岛素时，该蛋白质被磷酸化，与GLUT4囊泡分离，导致细胞表面GLUT4增加，并增强葡萄糖转运。通过AKT磷酸化这种蛋白质是将GLUT4正确转运至细胞表面所必需的。该基因中突变纯合的个体患2型糖尿病的风险较高，并且在摄入葡萄糖后具有较高水平的循环葡萄糖和胰岛素水平。选择性剪接产生编码不同同种型的多种转录物变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2015年8月]来自UniProt：可能充当RAB2A，RAB8A，RAB10和RAB14的GTPase激活蛋白。亚型2促进胰岛素诱导的葡萄糖转运蛋白SLC2A4 / GLUT4在质膜处易位，从而增加葡萄糖摄取。<> <>

name: SORT1
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a member of the VPS10-related sortilin family of proteins. The encoded preproprotein is proteolytically processed by furin to generate the mature receptor. This receptor plays a role in the trafficking of different proteins to either the cell surface, or subcellular compartments such as lysosomes and endosomes. Expression levels of this gene may influence the risk of myocardial infarction in human patients. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2015]From UniProt:Functions as a sorting receptor in the Golgi compartment and as a clearance receptor on the cell surface. Required for protein transport from the Golgi apparatus to the lysosomes by a pathway that is independent of the mannose-6-phosphate receptor (M6PR). Also required for protein transport from the Golgi apparatus to the endosomes. Promotes neuronal apoptosis by mediating endocytosis of the proapoptotic precursor forms of BDNF (proBDNF) and NGFB (proNGFB). Also acts as a receptor for neurotensin. May promote mineralization of the extracellular matrix during osteogenic differentiation by scavenging extracellular LPL. Probably required in adipocytes for the formation of specialized storage vesicles containing the glucose transporter SLC2A4/GLUT4 (GLUT4 storage vesicles, or GSVs). These vesicles provide a stable pool of SLC2A4 and confer increased responsiveness to insulin. May also mediate transport from the endoplasmic reticulum to the Golgi.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码VPS10相关分拣蛋白家族的成员。编码的前原蛋白通过弗林蛋白酶进行蛋白水解处理以产生成熟的受体。该受体在将不同蛋白质运输至细胞表面或亚细胞区室如溶酶体和内体中发挥作用。该基因的表达水平可能影响人类患者心肌梗塞的风险。选择性剪接产生多种转录本变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2015年10月]来自UniProt：作为高尔基体中的分选受体以及作为细胞表面的清除受体。通过独立于甘露糖-6-磷酸受体（M6PR）的途径将蛋白从高尔基体转运至溶酶体所需的。蛋白质从高尔基体转运到核内体也是必需的。通过介导促凋亡前体形式的BDNF（proBDNF）和NGFB（proNGFB）的胞吞作用来促进神经元细胞凋亡。也作为神经降压素的受体。可通过清除细胞外LPL促进成骨分化期间细胞外基质的矿化。可能需要在脂肪细胞中形成含有葡萄糖转运蛋白SLC2A4 / GLUT4（GLUT4储存囊泡或GSV）的专用储存囊泡。这些囊泡提供了一个稳定的SLC2A4池并赋予对胰岛素增加的反应性。也可能介导从内质网到高尔基体的运输。<> <>

name: SNTA1
eng: From NCBI Gene:Syntrophins are cytoplasmic peripheral membrane scaffold proteins that are components of the dystrophin-associated protein complex. This gene is a member of the syntrophin gene family and encodes the most common syntrophin isoform found in cardiac tissues. The N-terminal PDZ domain of this syntrophin protein interacts with the C-terminus of the pore-forming alpha subunit (SCN5A) of the cardiac sodium channel Nav1.5. This protein also associates cardiac sodium channels with the nitric oxide synthase-PMCA4b (plasma membrane Ca-ATPase subtype 4b) complex in cardiomyocytes. This gene is a susceptibility locus for Long-QT syndrome (LQT) - an inherited disorder associated with sudden cardiac death from arrhythmia - and sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). This protein also associates with dystrophin and dystrophin-related proteins at the neuromuscular junction and alters intracellular calcium ion levels in muscle tissue. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2013]From UniProt:Adapter protein that binds to and probably organizes the subcellular localization of a variety of membrane proteins. May link various receptors to the actin cytoskeleton and the extracellular matrix via the dystrophin glycoprotein complex. Plays an important role in synapse formation and in the organization of UTRN and acetylcholine receptors at the neuromuscular synapse. Binds to phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：Syntrophins是细胞质外周膜支架蛋白，其是肌营养不良蛋白相关蛋白复合物的组分。该基因是syntrophin基因家族的成员，编码在心脏组织中发现的最常见的syntrophin同种型。该syntrophin蛋白的N端PDZ结构域与心钠通道Nav1.5的孔形成α亚基（SCN5A）的C端相互作用。该蛋白还将心脏钠通道与心肌细胞中的一氧化氮合酶-PMCA4b（质膜Ca-ATP酶亚型4b）复合物相关联。该基因是长QT综合征（LQT）（一种与心律失常导致的心源性猝死相关的遗传性疾病）和婴儿猝死综合征（SIDS）的易感基因位点。该蛋白质还与肌营养不良蛋白和肌营养不良蛋白相关联，并改变肌肉组织中的细胞内钙离子水平。 [由RefSeq，2013年1月提供]从UniProt：适配蛋白结合并可能组织各种膜蛋白的亚细胞定位。可通过肌营养不良蛋白糖蛋白复合物将各种受体连接至肌动蛋白细胞骨架和细胞外基质。在突触形成和神经肌肉突触中UTRN和乙酰胆碱受体的组织中发挥重要作用。绑定到磷脂酰肌醇4,5-二磷酸酯。<> <>

name: SOS2
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a regulatory protein that is involved in the positive regulation of ras proteins. Mutations in this gene are associated with Noonan Syndrome-9. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2016]From UniProt:Promotes the exchange of Ras-bound GDP by GTP.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码参与ras蛋白正调控的调控蛋白。该基因突变与Noonan综合征-9相关。 [由RefSeq提供，2016年7月]来自UniProt：促进GTP交换Ras-bound GDP。<> <>

name: SOS1
eng: The SOS1 gene provides instructions for making a protein that is involved in controlling (regulating) the activation of the RAS/MAPK signaling pathway, which helps control several important cell functions. Specifically, the pathway regulates the growth and division of cells (proliferation), the process by which cells mature to carry out specific functions (differentiation), cell movement (migration), and the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis). Within the RAS/MAPK signaling pathway, the SOS1 protein regulates a protein, called Ras, that stimulates cells to grow and divide. This regulation tightly controls the growth of cells and tissues, and is especially important for proper embryonic development.<> <>
chi: SOS1基因提供了制造参与控制（调节）RAS / MAPK信号传导途径活化的蛋白质的指导，其有助于控制几种重要的细胞功能。具体而言，该途径调节细胞（增殖）的生长和分裂，细胞成熟以执行特定功能（分化），细胞移动（迁移）和细胞自我毁坏（细胞凋亡）的过程。在RAS / MAPK信号传导途径中，SOS1蛋白调节称为Ras的蛋白质，其刺激细胞生长和分裂。该规定严格控制细胞和组织的生长，并且对于正确的胚胎发育尤其重要。“>”>

name: SMPD1
eng: The SMPD1 gene provides instructions for making an enzyme called acid sphingomyelinase. This enzyme is found in lysosomes, which are small compartments in the cell that digest and recycle molecules. Acid sphingomyelinase is responsible for the conversion of a fat (lipid) called sphingomyelin into another type of lipid called ceramide. Sphingomyelin also binds (attaches) to a fat called cholesterol and helps to form other lipids that play roles in various cell processes. The formations of these lipids is critical for the normal structure and function of cells and tissues.<> <>
chi: SMPD1基因提供了制造称为酸性鞘磷脂酶的酶的说明。这种酶在溶酶体中发现，溶酶体是细胞中消化和回收分子的小隔间。酸鞘磷脂酶负责将称为鞘磷脂的脂质（脂质）转化为另一种称为神经酰胺的脂质。鞘磷脂还结合（附着）到称为胆固醇的脂肪，并有助于形成在各种细胞过程中起作用的其他脂质。这些脂质的形成对于细胞和组织的正常结构和功能是至关重要的

name: SMAD9
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the SMAD family, which transduces signals from TGF-beta family members. The encoded protein is activated by bone morphogenetic proteins and interacts with SMAD4. Two transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene.[provided by RefSeq, Jan 2010]From UniProt:Transcriptional modulator activated by BMP (bone morphogenetic proteins) type 1 receptor kinase. SMAD9 is a receptor-regulated SMAD (R-SMAD).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质是SMAD家族的成员，其转导来自TGF-β家族成员的信号。编码的蛋白质被骨形态发生蛋白激活并与SMAD4相互作用。已发现编码不同亚型的两种转录本变体[由RefSeq，2010年1月提供] From UniProt：由BMP（骨形态发生蛋白）1型受体激酶激活的转录调节剂。 SMAD9是受体调节的SMAD（R-SMAD）。<> <>

name: SMAD3
eng: The SMAD3 gene provides instructions for making a protein involved in transmitting chemical signals from the cell surface to the nucleus. This signaling pathway, called the transforming growth factor-beta (TGF-β) pathway, allows the environment outside the cell to affect cell function, including how the cell produces other proteins. The signaling process begins when a TGF-β protein attaches (binds) to a receptor on the cell surface, which activates a group of related SMAD proteins (including the SMAD3 protein). These SMAD proteins combine to form a protein complex, which then moves to the cell nucleus. In the nucleus, the SMAD protein complex binds to specific areas of DNA to control the activity of particular genes. Through the TGF-β signaling pathway, the SMAD3 protein also influences many aspects of cellular processes, including cell growth and division (proliferation), cell movement (migration), and controlled cell death (apoptosis).<> <>
chi: SMAD3基因提供了制造涉及将化学信号从细胞表面传递到细胞核的蛋白质的说明。该信号通路称为转化生长因子-β（TGF-β）通路，它允许细胞外的环境影响细胞功能，包括细胞如何产生其他蛋白质。当TGF-β蛋白附着（结合）细胞表面上的受体时，信号过程开始，其激活一组相关的SMAD蛋白（包括SMAD3蛋白）。这些SMAD蛋白结合形成蛋白质复合物，然后移动到细胞核。在细胞核中，SMAD蛋白复合物与DNA的特定区域结合以控制特定基因的活性。通过TGF-β信号传导途径，SMAD3蛋白也影响细胞过程的许多方面，包括细胞生长和分裂（增殖），细胞运动（迁移）和受控细胞死亡（凋亡）。

name: SLC2A2
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes an integral plasma membrane glycoprotein of the liver, islet beta cells, intestine, and kidney epithelium. The encoded protein mediates facilitated bidirectional glucose transport. Because of its low affinity for glucose, it has been suggested as a glucose sensor. Mutations in this gene are associated with susceptibility to diseases, including Fanconi-Bickel syndrome and noninsulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (NIDDM). Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants of this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2013]From UniProt:Facilitative glucose transporter. This isoform likely mediates the bidirectional transfer of glucose across the plasma membrane of hepatocytes and is responsible for uptake of glucose by the beta cells; may comprise part of the glucose-sensing mechanism of the beta cell. May also participate with the Na(+)/glucose cotransporter in the transcellular transport of glucose in the small intestine and kidney.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码肝脏的完整质膜糖蛋白，胰岛β细胞，肠和肾脏上皮细胞。编码的蛋白质介导促进的双向葡萄糖转运。由于其对葡萄糖的亲和力低，因此已被认为是葡萄糖传感器。该基因突变与疾病易感性有关，包括Fanconi-Bickel综合征和非胰岛素依赖型糖尿病（NIDDM）。选择性剪接产生该基因的多个转录物变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2013年7月]来自UniProt：促进葡萄糖转运蛋白。该亚型可能介导葡萄糖通过肝细胞质膜的双向转移，并且负责β细胞摄取葡萄糖;可以包括β细胞的部分葡萄糖感应机制。也可以参与Na（+）/葡萄糖协同转运蛋白在小肠和肾脏中的葡萄糖跨细胞转运。<> <>

name: SLC12A3
eng: The SLC12A3 gene provides instructions for making a protein known as NCC. This protein is a sodium chloride co-transporter, which means that it moves charged atoms (ions) of sodium (Na<sup>+</sup>) and chlorine (Cl<sup>-</sup>) across cell membranes.The NCC protein is essential for normal kidney function. It is part of the mechanism by which kidneys reabsorb salt (sodium chloride or NaCl) from the urine back into the bloodstream. The retention of salt affects the body's fluid levels and helps maintain blood pressure.<> <>
chi: SLC12A3基因提供了制造被称为NCC的蛋白质的说明。这种蛋白质是一种氯化钠辅助转运蛋白，这意味着它可以跨越细胞膜移动钠（Na +）和氯（Cl  - ）的电荷原子（离子）。 NCC蛋白对正常肾功能是必不可少的。它是肾脏从尿液中重新吸收盐分（氯化钠或氯化钠）返回血液的机制的一部分。盐的滞留会影响人体的液体水平并有助于保持血压。<> <>

name: SLC12A1
eng: The SLC12A1 gene provides instructions for making a protein known as NKCC2. This protein is a Na<sup>+</sup>/K<sup>+</sup>/2Cl<sup>-</sup> cotransporter, which means that it moves charged atoms (ions) of sodium (Na<sup>+</sup>), potassium (K<sup>+</sup>), and chlorine (Cl<sup>-</sup>) into cells.The NKCC2 protein is essential for normal kidney function. The NKCC2 protein works with other transport proteins to regulate the movement of ions into and out of kidney cells. Together, these proteins provide the mechanism by which kidneys reabsorb salt (sodium chloride or NaCl) from the urine back into the bloodstream. The retention of salt affects the body's fluid levels and helps maintain blood pressure.<> <>
chi: SLC12A1基因提供了制造被称为NKCC2的蛋白质的说明。这种蛋白质是Na + / K + + / Cl-Co-共转运蛋白，这意味着它移动钠的带电原子（离子）（Na <+） +），钾（K +）和氯（Cl  - ）进入细胞。NKCC2蛋白是正常肾功能所必需的。 NKCC2蛋白与其他转运蛋白一起工作来调节离子进出肾​​细胞的运动。这些蛋白质一起提供了肾脏从尿液中重吸收盐（氯化钠或氯化钠）回到血液中的机制。盐的滞留会影响人体的液体水平并有助于保持血压。<> <>

name: SLC2A10
eng: The SLC2A10 gene provides instructions for making a protein called GLUT10. GLUT10 is classified as a glucose transporter; this type of protein moves the simple sugar glucose across cell membranes and helps maintain proper levels of glucose within cells. However, GLUT10 has some structural differences from other glucose transporters, and its role in the movement of glucose or other substances is unclear.The level of GLUT10 appears to be involved in the regulation of a process called the transforming growth factor-beta (TGF-β) signaling pathway. This pathway is involved in cell growth and division (proliferation) and the process by which cells mature to carry out special functions (differentiation). The TGF-β signaling pathway is also involved in bone and blood vessel development and the formation of the extracellular matrix, an intricate lattice of proteins and other molecules that forms in the spaces between cells and defines the structure and properties of connective tissues. Connective tissue provides strength and flexibility to structures throughout the body, including blood vessels, skin, joints, and the gastrointestinal tract.Studies indicate that GLUT10 may also be involved in the functioning of mitochondria, the energy-producing centers within cells.<> <>
chi: SLC2A10基因提供了制作GLUT10蛋白质的说明。 GLUT10被归类为葡萄糖转运蛋白;这种类型的蛋白质将简单的糖分转移到细胞膜上，并有助于维持细胞内适当的葡萄糖水平。然而，GLUT10与其他葡萄糖转运蛋白具有一些结构差异，并且它在葡萄糖或其它物质运动中的作用尚不清楚。GLUT10的水平似乎涉及称为转化生长因子-β（TGF- β）信号传导途径。该途径涉及细胞生长和分裂（增殖）以及细胞成熟以发挥特殊功能（分化）的过程。 TGF-β信号通路还涉及骨和血管发育以及细胞外基质的形成，细胞外基质是蛋白质和其他分子的复杂晶格，其形成于细胞之间的空间并限定结缔组织的结构和性质。结缔组织为整个身体结构（包括血管，皮肤，关节和胃肠道）提供强度和柔韧性。研究表明GLUT10也可能参与细胞内能量产生中心线粒体的功能。<> << >

name: SHOC2
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a protein that consists almost entirely of leucine-rich repeats, a domain implicated in protein-protein interactions. The protein may function as a scaffold linking RAS to downstream signal transducers in the RAS/ERK MAP kinase signaling cascade. Mutations in this gene have been associated with Noonan-like syndrome with loose anagen hair. [provided by RefSeq, May 2010]From UniProt:Regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 1 (PP1c) that acts as a M-Ras/MRAS effector and participates in MAPK pathway activation. Upon M-Ras/MRAS activation, targets PP1c to specifically dephosphorylate the 'Ser-259' inhibitory site of RAF1 kinase and stimulate RAF1 activity at specialized signaling complexes.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码一种几乎完全由富含亮氨酸重复序列组成的蛋白质，这是一个涉及蛋白质 - 蛋白质相互作用的结构域。该蛋白可以作为连接RAS与RAS / ERK MAP激酶信号级联中下游信号转导的支架。这个基因突变与Noonan样综合征与松散的毛发生长发有关。 [由RefSeq，2010年5月提供] From UniProt：蛋白磷酸酶1（PP1c）的调节亚基，充当M-Ras / MRAS效应子并参与MAPK途径激活。在M-Ras / MRAS激活后，靶向PP1c以特异性去磷酸化RAF1激酶的'Ser-259'抑制位点并刺激特定信号复合物处的RAF1活性。<> <>

name: SDHD
eng: The SDHD gene provides instructions for making one of four subunits of the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) enzyme. The SDH enzyme plays a critical role in mitochondria, which are structures inside cells that convert the energy from food into a form that cells can use. The SDHD protein helps anchor the SDH enzyme in the mitochondrial membrane.Within mitochondria, the SDH enzyme links two important pathways in energy conversion: the citric acid cycle (or Krebs cycle) and oxidative phosphorylation. As part of the citric acid cycle, the SDH enzyme converts a compound called succinate to another compound called fumarate. Negatively charged particles called electrons are released during this reaction. The electrons are transferred through the SDH subunits, including the SDHD protein, to the oxidative phosphorylation pathway. In oxidative phosphorylation, the electrons create an electrical charge that provides energy for the production of adenosine triphosphate (ATP), the cell's main energy source.Succinate, the compound on which the SDH enzyme acts, is an oxygen sensor in the cell and can help turn on specific pathways that stimulate cells to grow in a low-oxygen environment (hypoxia). In particular, succinate stabilizes a protein called hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF)  by preventing a reaction that would allow HIF to be broken down. HIF controls several important genes involved in cell division and the formation of new blood vessels in a hypoxic environment.The SDHD gene is a tumor suppressor, which means it prevents cells from growing and dividing in an uncontrolled way.<> <>
chi: SDHD基因提供了制造琥珀酸脱氢酶（SDH）酶的四个亚基之一的说明。 SDH酶在线粒体中起着关键作用，线粒体是细胞内的结构，将食物的能量转化为细胞可以使用的形式。 SDHD蛋白有助于将SDH酶锚定在线粒体膜上。在线粒体内，SDH酶将两种能量转换的重要途径联系在一起：柠檬酸循环（或三羧酸循环）和氧化磷酸化。作为柠檬酸循环的一部分，SDH酶将称为琥珀酸盐的化合物转化成另一种称为富马酸盐的化合物。在此反应过程中释放带负电的粒子称为电子。电子通过SDH亚基（包括SDHD蛋白）转移到氧化磷酸化途径。在氧化磷酸化中，电子产生电荷，为产生三磷酸腺苷（ATP）（细胞的主要能量来源）提供能量。琥珀酸盐，SDH酶作用的化合物是细胞中的氧传感器，可以帮助开启刺激细胞在低氧环境下生长的特定途径（缺氧）。具体而言，琥珀酸盐通过阻止允许HIF分解的反应来稳定称为缺氧诱导因子（HIF）的蛋白质。 HIF控制参与细胞分裂和在缺氧环境中形成新血管的几种重要基因。SDHD基因是肿瘤抑制剂，这意味着它阻止细胞生长并以不受控制的方式分裂。<> <>

name: SDHA
eng: The SDHA gene provides instructions for making one of four parts (subunits) of the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) enzyme. The SDH enzyme plays a critical role in mitochondria, which are structures inside cells that convert the energy from food into a form that cells can use.Within mitochondria, the SDH enzyme links two important pathways in energy conversion: the citric acid cycle (or Krebs cycle) and oxidative phosphorylation. As part of the citric acid cycle, the SDH enzyme converts a compound called succinate to another compound called fumarate. Negatively charged particles called electrons are released during this reaction. The SDHA protein is the active subunit of the enzyme that performs the conversion of succinate, and it also helps transfer electrons to the oxidative phosphorylation pathway. In oxidative phosphorylation, the electrons help create an electrical charge that provides energy for the production of adenosine triphosphate (ATP), the cell's main energy source.Succinate, the compound on which the SDH enzyme acts, is an oxygen sensor in the cell and can help turn on specific pathways that stimulate cells to grow in a low-oxygen environment (hypoxia). In particular, succinate stabilizes a protein called hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF) by preventing a reaction that would allow HIF to be broken down. HIF controls several important genes involved in cell division and the formation of new blood vessels in a hypoxic environment.The SDHA gene is a tumor suppressor gene, which means it prevents cells from growing and dividing in an uncontrolled way.<> <>
chi: SDHA基因提供了制备琥珀酸脱氢酶（SDH）酶的四个部分（亚基）之一的说明。 SDH酶在线粒体中起着关键作用，线粒体是细胞内的结构，将细胞内的能量转化为细胞可以使用的形式。在线粒体中，SDH酶将能量转化的两个重要途径联系起来：柠檬酸循环（或Krebs周期）和氧化磷酸化。作为柠檬酸循环的一部分，SDH酶将称为琥珀酸盐的化合物转化成另一种称为富马酸盐的化合物。在此反应过程中释放带负电的粒子称为电子。 SDHA蛋白是执行琥珀酸转化的酶的活性亚基，并且还有助于将电子转移至氧化磷酸化途径。在氧化磷酸化中，电子有助于产生电荷，为产生三磷酸腺苷（ATP）（细胞的主要能量来源）提供能量。琥珀酸盐，SDH酶作用的化合物是细胞中的氧传感器，可以帮助开启刺激细胞在低氧环境中生长的特定途径（缺氧）。具体而言，琥珀酸盐通过阻止允许HIF分解的反应来稳定称为缺氧诱导因子（HIF）的蛋白质。 HIF控制参与细胞分裂和在缺氧环境中形成新血管的几种重要基因.SDHA基因是肿瘤抑制基因，这意味着它阻止细胞生长并以不受控制的方式分裂。<> <>

name: SDCCAG8
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a centrosome associated protein. This protein may be involved in organizing the centrosome during interphase and mitosis. Mutations in this gene are associated with retinal-renal ciliopathy. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2010]From UniProt:Plays a role in the establishment of cell polarity and epithelial lumen formation (By similarity). May play a role in ciliogenesis.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码中心体相关蛋白。这种蛋白质可能参与组织中间体和有丝分裂期间的中心体。该基因中的突变与视网膜 - 肾纤毛病有关。 [由RefSeq，2010年10月提供]来自UniProt：在建立细胞极性和上皮细胞腔形成方面发挥作用（通过相似性）。可能在纤维发生中起作用。<> <>

name: SDHB
eng: The SDHB gene provides instructions for making one of four subunits of the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) enzyme. The SDH enzyme plays a critical role in mitochondria, which are structures inside cells that convert the energy from food into a form that cells can use.Within mitochondria, the SDH enzyme links two important pathways in energy conversion: the citric acid cycle (or Krebs cycle) and oxidative phosphorylation. As part of the citric acid cycle, the SDH enzyme converts a compound called succinate to another compound called fumarate. Negatively charged particles called electrons are released during this reaction. The SDHB protein provides an attachment site for electrons as they are transferred to the oxidative phosphorylation pathway. In oxidative phosphorylation, the electrons help create an electrical charge that provides energy for the production of adenosine triphosphate (ATP), the cell's main energy source.Succinate, the compound on which the SDH enzyme acts, is an oxygen sensor in the cell and can help turn on specific pathways that stimulate cells to grow in a low-oxygen environment (hypoxia). In particular, succinate stabilizes a protein called hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF)  by preventing a reaction that would allow HIF to be broken down. HIF controls several important genes involved in cell division and the formation of new blood vessels in a hypoxic environment.The SDHB gene is a tumor suppressor, which means it prevents cells from growing and dividing in an uncontrolled way.<> <>
chi: SDHB基因提供了制造琥珀酸脱氢酶（SDH）酶的四个亚基之一的说明。 SDH酶在线粒体中起着关键作用，线粒体是细胞内的结构，将细胞内的能量转化为细胞可以使用的形式。在线粒体中，SDH酶将能量转化的两个重要途径联系起来：柠檬酸循环（或Krebs周期）和氧化磷酸化。作为柠檬酸循环的一部分，SDH酶将称为琥珀酸盐的化合物转化成另一种称为富马酸盐的化合物。在此反应过程中释放带负电的粒子称为电子。 SDHB蛋白为电子转移至氧化磷酸化途径提供了附着位点。在氧化磷酸化中，电子有助于产生电荷，为产生三磷酸腺苷（ATP）（细胞的主要能量来源）提供能量。琥珀酸盐，SDH酶作用的化合物是细胞中的氧传感器，可以帮助开启刺激细胞在低氧环境中生长的特定途径（缺氧）。具体而言，琥珀酸盐通过阻止允许HIF分解的反应来稳定称为缺氧诱导因子（HIF）的蛋白质。 HIF控制参与细胞分裂和在缺氧环境中形成新血管的几种重要基因。SDHB基因是肿瘤抑制剂，这意味着它阻止细胞生长并以不受控制的方式分裂。<> <>

name: SCNN1B
eng: The SCNN1B gene provides instructions for making one piece, the beta subunit, of a protein complex called the epithelial sodium channel (ENaC). The channel is composed of alpha, beta, and gamma subunits, each of which is produced from a different gene. These channels are found at the surface of certain cells called epithelial cells in many tissues of the body, including the kidneys, lungs, colon, and sweat glands. The ENaC channel transports sodium into cells.In the kidney, ENaC channels open in response to signals that sodium levels in the blood are too low, which allows sodium to flow into cells. From the kidney cells, this sodium is returned to the bloodstream (a process called reabsorption) rather than being removed from the body in urine. In addition to regulating the amount of sodium in the body, the flow of sodium ions helps control the movement of water in tissues. For example, ENaC channels in lung cells help regulate the amount of fluid in the lungs.<> <>
chi: SCNN1B基因提供了制造称为上皮钠通道（ENaC）的蛋白质复合物的一个片段β亚基的说明。该通道由α，β和γ亚基组成，每个亚基由不同的基因产生。这些通道位于身体许多组织中称为上皮细胞的某些细胞表面，包括肾脏，肺，结肠和汗腺。 ENaC通道将钠输送到细胞中。在肾脏中，ENaC通道响应于血液中钠含量过低的信号而打开，这允许钠流入细胞。从肾细胞中，这种钠返回到血流（称为重吸收过程），而不是从尿液中排出体外。除了调节体内钠的含量之外，钠离子的流动有助于控制组织中的水分流动。例如，肺细胞中的ENaC通道有助于调节肺内液体的量。<> <>

name: SCNN1A
eng: The SCNN1A gene provides instructions for making one piece, the alpha subunit, of a protein complex called the epithelial sodium channel (ENaC). The channel is composed of alpha, beta, and gamma subunits, each of which is produced from a different gene. These channels are found at the surface of certain cells called epithelial cells in many tissues of the body, including the kidneys, lungs, and sweat glands. The ENaC channel transports sodium into cells.In the kidney, ENaC channels take sodium into cells in response to signals that sodium levels in the body are too low. From the kidney cells, this sodium is returned to the bloodstream rather than being removed from the body (a process called reabsorption). In addition to regulating the amount of sodium in the body, the flow of sodium ions helps control the movement of water in tissues. For example, ENaC channels in lung cells help regulate the amount of fluid in the lungs.<> <>
chi: SCNN1A基因提供了制造称为上皮钠通道（ENaC）的蛋白质复合物的一个片段α亚基的说明。该通道由α，β和γ亚基组成，每个亚基由不同的基因产生。这些通道位于身体许多组织中称为上皮细胞的某些细胞表面，包括肾脏，肺和汗腺。 ENaC通道将钠转运入细胞。在肾脏中，ENaC通道将钠摄入细胞，以响应体内钠水平过低的信号。从肾细胞中，这种钠返回到血液而不是从体内去除（称为重吸收过程）。除了调节体内钠的含量之外，钠离子的流动有助于控制组织中的水分流动。例如，肺细胞中的ENaC通道有助于调节肺内液体的量。<> <>

name: SCNN1G
eng: The SCNN1G gene provides instructions for making one piece, the gamma subunit, of a protein complex called the epithelial sodium channel (ENaC). The channel is composed of alpha, beta, and gamma subunits, each of which is produced from a different gene. These channels are found at the surface of certain cells called epithelial cells in many tissues of the body, including the kidneys, lungs, and sweat glands. The ENaC channel transports sodium into cells.In the kidney, ENaC channels open in response to signals that sodium levels in the blood are too low, which allows sodium to flow into cells. From the kidney cells, this sodium is returned to the bloodstream (a process called reabsorption) rather than being removed from the body in urine. In addition to regulating the amount of sodium in the body, the flow of sodium ions helps control the movement of water in tissues. For example, ENaC channels in lung cells help regulate the amount of fluid in the lungs.<> <>
chi: SCNN1G基因提供了制造称为上皮钠通道（ENaC）的蛋白质复合物的一个片段γ亚基的说明。该通道由α，β和γ亚基组成，每个亚基由不同的基因产生。这些通道位于身体许多组织中称为上皮细胞的某些细胞表面，包括肾脏，肺和汗腺。 ENaC通道将钠输送到细胞中。在肾脏中，ENaC通道响应于血液中钠含量过低的信号而打开，这允许钠流入细胞。从肾细胞中，这种钠返回到血流（称为重吸收过程），而不是从尿液中排出体外。除了调节体内钠的含量之外，钠离子的流动有助于控制组织中的水分流动。例如，肺细胞中的ENaC通道有助于调节肺内液体的量。<> <>

name: SCN5A
eng: The SCN5A gene belongs to a family of genes that provide instructions for making sodium channels. These channels open and close at specific times to control the flow of positively charged sodium atoms (sodium ions) into cells. The sodium channels containing proteins produced from the SCN5A gene are abundant in heart (cardiac) muscle cells and play key roles in these cells' ability to generate and transmit electrical signals. These channels play a major role in signaling the start of each heartbeat, coordinating the contractions of the upper and lower chambers of the heart, and maintaining a normal heart rhythm.<> <>
chi: SCN5A基因所属的家族提供制造钠通道的模板。这些通道在特定时间打开和关闭，以控制带正电的钠离子流入细胞。SCN5A基因对应蛋白质的钠通道在心肌细胞中丰富，并且在这些细胞产生和传输电信号的能力中起关键作用。这些通道在发出每个心跳的开始信号，协调心脏上下心室的收缩以及保持正常的心脏节律方面发挥重要作用。

name: SCN4B
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is one of several sodium channel beta subunits. These subunits interact with voltage-gated alpha subunits to change sodium channel kinetics. The encoded transmembrane protein forms interchain disulfide bonds with SCN2A. Defects in this gene are a cause of long QT syndrome type 10 (LQT10). Three protein-coding and one non-coding transcript variant have been found for this gene.[provided by RefSeq, Mar 2009]From UniProt:Modulates channel gating kinetics. Causes negative shifts in the voltage dependence of activation of certain alpha sodium channels, but does not affect the voltage dependence of inactivation. Modulates the suceptibility of the sodium channel to inhibition by toxic peptides from spider, scorpion, wasp and sea anemone venom.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质是几种钠通道β亚基之一。这些亚基与电压门控α亚基相互作用以改变钠通道动力学。编码的跨膜蛋白与SCN2A形成链间二硫键。该基因中的缺陷是导致长QT综合征10型（LQT10）的原因。已发现该基因有三种蛋白编码和一种非编码转录变体[由RefSeq提供，2009年3月]来自UniProt：调节通道门控动力学。引起某些α钠通道激活的电压依赖性的负移，但不影响失活的电压依赖性。调节钠通道对来自蜘蛛，蝎子，黄蜂和海葵毒液的毒性肽的抑制的易感性。<> <>

name: SCN3B
eng: From NCBI Gene:Voltage-gated sodium channels are transmembrane glycoprotein complexes composed of a large alpha subunit and one or more regulatory beta subunits. They are responsible for the generation and propagation of action potentials in neurons and muscle. This gene encodes one member of the sodium channel beta subunit gene family, and influences the inactivation kinetics of the sodium channel. Two alternatively spliced variants, encoding the same protein, have been identified. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Modulates channel gating kinetics. Causes unique persistent sodium currents. Inactivates the sodium channel opening more slowly than the subunit beta-1. Its association with NFASC may target the sodium channels to the nodes of Ranvier of developing axons and retain these channels at the nodes in mature myelinated axons.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：电压门控钠通道是跨膜糖蛋白复合物，由大α亚基和一个或多个调控β亚基组成。它们负责神经元和肌肉中动作电位的产生和传播。该基因编码钠通道β亚基基因家族的一个成员，并影响钠通道的失活动力学。已经鉴定了编码相同蛋白质的两个可变剪接变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2008年7月]来自UniProt：调节通道门控动力学。导致独特​​的持续钠电流。钠通道开放比亚基β-1更慢地失活。其与NFASC的关联可能将钠通道靶向发育轴突的Ranvier节点并将这些通道保留在成熟髓鞘化轴突的节点处。<> <>

name: SCN2B
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is the beta 2 subunit of the type II voltage-gated sodium channel. The encoded protein is involved in cell-cell adhesion and cell migration. Defects in this gene can be a cause of Brugada Syndrome, atrial fibrillation, or sudden infant death syndrome. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2015]From UniProt:Crucial in the assembly, expression, and functional modulation of the heterotrimeric complex of the sodium channel. The subunit beta-2 causes an increase in the plasma membrane surface area and in its folding into microvilli. Interacts with TNR may play a crucial role in clustering and regulation of activity of sodium channels at nodes of Ranvier.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质是II型电压门控钠通道的β2亚基。编码的蛋白质参与细胞粘附和细胞迁移。该基因的缺陷可能是Brugada综合征，心房纤颤或婴儿猝死综合征的原因。 [由RefSeq提供，2015年7月]来自UniProt：关于钠通道异三聚体复合物的组装，表达和功能调节的关键。亚基β-2导致质膜表面积增加并且折叠成微绒毛。与TNR的相互作用可能在Ranvier节点处钠通道活性的聚集和调节中起关键作用。<> <>

name: SCN1B
eng: From NCBI Gene:Voltage-gated sodium channels are heteromeric proteins that function in the generation and propagation of action potentials in muscle and neuronal cells. They are composed of one alpha and two beta subunits, where the alpha subunit provides channel activity and the beta-1 subunit modulates the kinetics of channel inactivation. This gene encodes a sodium channel beta-1 subunit. Mutations in this gene result in generalized epilepsy with febrile seizures plus, Brugada syndrome 5, and defects in cardiac conduction. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene.[provided by RefSeq, Oct 2009]From UniProt:Crucial in the assembly, expression, and functional modulation of the heterotrimeric complex of the sodium channel. The subunit beta-1 can modulate multiple alpha subunit isoforms from brain, skeletal muscle, and heart. Its association with NFASC may target the sodium channels to the nodes of Ranvier of developing axons and retain these channels at the nodes in mature myelinated axons.Isoform 2: Cell adhesion molecule that plays a critical role in neuronal migration and pathfinding during brain development. Stimulates neurite outgrowth.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：电压门控钠通道是异源蛋白质，其在肌肉和神经元细胞中动作电位的产生和增殖中起作用。它们由一个α和两个β亚基组成，其中α亚基提供通道活性并且β-1亚基调节通道失活的动力学。该基因编码钠通道β-1亚基。该基因的突变导致广泛性癫痫伴热性惊厥加Brugada综合征5以及心脏传导缺陷。已发现编码不同同种型的多种转录本变体[由RefSeq，Oct 2009提供] From UniProt：关于钠通道异源三聚体复合物的组装，表达和功能调节的关键。亚基β-1可调节来自脑，骨骼肌和心脏的多种α亚基同种型。其与NFASC的关联可能将钠通道靶向发育轴突的Ranvier节点，并将这些通道保留在成熟髓鞘化轴突的节点上。Isoform 2：在脑发育过程中在神经元迁移和寻路过程中起关键作用的细胞粘附分子。刺激神经突生长。<> <>

name: SCARB1
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is a plasma membrane receptor for high density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL). The encoded protein mediates cholesterol transfer to and from HDL. In addition, this protein is a receptor for hepatitis C virus glycoprotein E2. Two transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene.[provided by RefSeq, Mar 2011]From UniProt:(Microbial infection) Acts as a receptor for hepatitis C virus in hepatocytes and appears to facilitate its cell entry (PubMed:12356718, PubMed:12913001, PubMed:18000990). Binding between SCARB1 and the hepatitis C virus glycoprotein E2 is independent of the genotype of the viral isolate (PubMed:12356718). Mediates uptake of M.fortuitum, E.coli and S.aureus (PubMed:16020694).Receptor for different ligands such as phospholipids, cholesterol ester, lipoproteins, phosphatidylserine and apoptotic cells (PubMed:12016218, PubMed:12519372, PubMed:21226579). Receptor for HDL, mediating selective uptake of cholesteryl ether and HDL-dependent cholesterol efflux (PubMed:26965621). Also facilitates the flux of free and esterified cholesterol between the cell surface and apoB-containing lipoproteins and modified lipoproteins, although less efficiently than HDL. May be involved in the phagocytosis of apoptotic cells, via its phosphatidylserine binding activity (PubMed:12016218).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质是高密度脂蛋白胆固醇（HDL）的质膜受体。编码的蛋白介导胆固醇向HDL转移和从HDL转移。另外，这种蛋白质是丙型肝炎病毒糖蛋白E2的受体。已发现编码不同亚型的转录本变异体[由RefSeq，2011年3月提供]来自UniProt：（微生物感染）作为丙型肝炎病毒在肝细胞中的受体并似乎促进其细胞进入（PubMed：12356718， PubMed：12913001，PubMed：18000990）。 SCARB1与丙型肝炎病毒糖蛋白E2之间的结合独立于病毒分离株的基因型（PubMed：12356718）。介导不同配体例如磷脂，胆固醇酯，脂蛋白，磷脂酰丝氨酸和凋亡细胞的受体（PubMed：12016218，PubMed：12519372，PubMed：21226579） 。 HDL受体，介导胆固醇醚的选择性摄取和HDL依赖性胆固醇流出（PubMed：26965621）。也促进细胞表面和含apoB的脂蛋白和修饰脂蛋白之间游离和酯化胆固醇的通量，虽然效率低于HDL。可能通过其磷脂酰丝氨酸结合活性参与凋亡细胞的吞噬作用（PubMed：12016218）。

name: SCN10A
eng: The SCN10A gene belongs to a family of genes that provide instructions for making sodium channels. These channels, which transport positively charged sodium atoms (sodium ions) into cells, play a key role in a cell's ability to generate and transmit electrical signals.The SCN10A gene provides instructions for making one part (the alpha subunit) of a sodium channel called NaV1.8. NaV1.8 sodium channels are found in nerve cells called nociceptors that transmit pain signals. Nociceptors are part of the peripheral nervous system, which connects the brain and spinal cord to cells that detect sensations such as touch, smell, and pain. Nociceptors are primarily involved in transmitting pain signals. The centers of nociceptors, known as the cell bodies, are located in a part of the spinal cord called the dorsal root ganglion. Fibers called axons extend from the cell bodies, reaching throughout the body to receive sensory information. In addition to nociceptors, NaV1.8 sodium channels have also been found in heart muscle cells where, by controlling the flow of sodium ions, they likely play a role in maintaining a normal heart rhythm.<> <>
chi: SCN10A基因属于提供制造钠通道说明的基因家族。这些将正电荷钠原子（钠离子）转运入细胞的通道在细胞产生和传输电信号的能力中起着关键作用.SCN10A基因提供了使被称为钠通道的一个部分（α亚基） Nav1.8的。 NaV1.8钠通道存在于称为伤害感受器的神经细胞中，其传递疼痛信号。伤害感受器是外周神经系统的一部分，它将大脑和脊髓与检测触觉，嗅觉和疼痛等感觉的细胞连接起来。伤害感受器主要参与传递疼痛信号。伤害感受器的中心，称为细胞体，位于称为背根神经节的脊髓的一部分。称为轴突的纤维从细胞体延伸，到达整个身体以接收感官信息。除了伤害感受器之外，在心脏肌细胞中还发现NaV1.8钠通道，其中通过控制钠离子的流动，它们可能在维持正常心脏节律中起作用。<> <>

name: RYR2
eng: The RYR2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called ryanodine receptor 2. This protein is part of a family of ryanodine receptors, which form channels that transport positively charged calcium atoms (calcium ions) within cells.Channels made with the ryanodine receptor 2 protein are found in heart (cardiac) muscle cells called myocytes. These channels are embedded in the outer membrane of a cell structure called the sarcoplasmic reticulum, which acts as a storage center for calcium ions. The RYR2 channel controls the flow of calcium ions out of the sarcoplasmic reticulum.For the heart to beat normally, the cardiac muscle must tense (contract) and relax in a coordinated way. This cycle of muscle contraction and relaxation results from the precise control of calcium ions within myocytes. In response to certain signals, the RYR2 channel releases calcium ions from the sarcoplasmic reticulum into the surrounding cell fluid (the cytoplasm). The resulting increase in calcium ion concentration triggers the cardiac muscle to contract, which pumps blood out of the heart. Calcium ions are then transported back into the sarcoplasmic reticulum, and the cardiac muscle relaxes.  In this way, the release and reuptake of calcium ions in myocytes produces a regular heart rhythm.<> <>
chi: RYR2基因提供了制造称为ryanodine受体2的蛋白质的模板。该蛋白质是ryanodine受体家族的一员，形成可在细胞内转运钙离子的通道。在心肌细胞中发现由ryanodine受体2蛋白质构成的通道。这些通道嵌入细胞结构的外膜中，该细胞结构称为肌质网，充当钙离子的储存中心。 RYR2通道控制钙离子流出肌质网。对于心脏正常搏动，心肌必须以协调的方式收缩并放松。肌肉收缩和放松的循环由精确控制心肌细胞内的钙离子引起。响应某些信号，RYR2通道将钙离子从肌质网释放到周围的细胞质中。由此导致的钙离子浓度增加引发心肌收缩，从而将血液泵出心脏。钙离子然后被运回肌浆网，并且使心肌松弛。这样，心肌细胞中钙离子的释放和再摄取就会产生规律的心律。

name: SAR1B
eng: The SAR1B gene provides instructions for making a protein found in enterocytes, which are cells that line the intestine and absorb nutrients.  Within enterocytes, the SAR1B protein aids in the transport of molecules called chylomicrons.  As food is digested after a meal, chylomicrons are formed to carry fat and cholesterol from the intestine into the bloodstream.  Chylomicrons are also necessary for the absorption of certain fat-soluble vitamins, such as vitamin E and vitamin D.Chylomicrons are made up mostly of various types of fats (lipids); they also contain some proteins, mainly a protein called apolipoprotein B-48 that is produced only in the intestine.  Because chylomicrons are made up of lipids and proteins, they are known as lipoproteins.  Chylomicrons are released from enterocytes into the bloodstream so the body can use the lipids and fat-soluble vitamins they carry.  Sufficient levels of fats, cholesterol, and vitamins are necessary for normal growth and development.<> <>
chi: SAR1B基因提供了制造在肠细胞中发现的蛋白质的说明，所述肠细胞是排列肠并吸收营养素的细胞。在肠内细胞中，SAR1B蛋白有助于运输称为乳糜微粒的分子。随着食物在饭后消化，乳糜微粒形成从肠道携带脂肪和胆固醇进入血液。乳糜微粒对于吸收某些脂溶性维生素如维生素E和维生素D也是必需的。乳糜微粒主要由各种类型的脂肪（脂质）组成;它们还含有一些蛋白质，主要是仅在肠中产生的称为载脂蛋白B-48的蛋白质。由于乳糜微粒由脂质和蛋白质组成，因此被称为脂蛋白。乳糜微粒从肠细胞释放到血液中，因此身体可以使用它们携带的脂质和脂溶性维生素。正常生长和发育需要足够的脂肪，胆固醇和维生素。“>”>

name: RFX6
eng: From NCBI Gene:The nuclear protein encoded by this gene is a member of the regulatory factor X (RFX) family of transcription factors. Studies in mice suggest that this gene is specifically required for the differentiation of islet cells for the production of insulin, but not for the differentiation of pancreatic polypeptide-producing cells. It regulates the transcription factors involved in beta-cell maturation and function, thus, restricting the expression of the beta-cell differentiation and specification genes. Mutations in this gene are associated with Mitchell-Riley syndrome, which is characterized by neonatal diabetes with pancreatic hypoplasia, duodenal and jejunal atresia, and gall bladder agenesis.[provided by RefSeq, Sep 2010]From UniProt:Transcription factor required to direct islet cell differentiation during endocrine pancreas development. Specifically required for the differentiation of 4 of the 5 islet cell types and for the production of insulin (PubMed:20148032, PubMed:25497100). Not required for pancreatic PP (polypeptide-producing) cells differentiation. Acts downstream of NEUROG3 and regulates the transcription factors involved in beta-cell maturation and function, thereby restricting the expression of the beta-cell differentiation and specification genes, and thus the beta-cell fate choice. Activates transcription by forming a heterodimer with RFX3 and binding to the X-box in the promoter of target genes (PubMed:20148032). Involved in glucose-stimulated insulin secretion by promoting insulin and L-type calcium channel gene transcription (PubMed:25497100).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的核蛋白是转录因子调节因子X（RFX）家族的成员。对小鼠的研究表明，该基因对胰岛细胞的分化特别需要用于胰岛素的产生，但不用于胰多肽产生细胞的分化。它调节涉及β细胞成熟和功能的转录因子，从而限制β细胞分化和特定基因的表达。该基因突变与Mitchell-Riley综合征相关，其特征为新生儿糖尿病伴胰腺发育不全，十二指肠和空肠闭锁以及胆囊发育不全。[由RefSeq，2010年9月提供] From UniProt：转录因子需要指导胰岛细胞在内分泌胰腺发育过程中的分化。为了区分5种胰岛细胞类型中的4种和用于胰岛素产生而特别需要（PubMed：20148032，PubMed：25497100）。对于胰腺PP（多肽产生）细胞分化不是必需的。作用于NEUROG3下游并调节参与β-细胞成熟和功能的转录因子，从而限制β-细胞分化和特定基因的表达，并由此限制β-细胞命运选择。通过与RFX3形成异源二聚体并与靶基因启动子中的X框结合来激活转录（PubMed：20148032）。通过促进胰岛素和L型钙通道基因转录参与葡萄糖刺激的胰岛素分泌（PubMed：25497100）。<> <>

name: RIT1
eng: The RIT1 gene provides instructions for making a protein that helps cells survive during periods of cellular stress, such as unusually high energy demands. As part of a signaling pathway known as the RAS/MAPK pathway, the RIT1 protein relays signals from outside the cell to the cell's nucleus. These signals instruct the cell to grow and divide (proliferate) or to mature and take on specialized functions (differentiate). The RIT1 protein is a GTPase, which means it converts a molecule called GTP into another molecule called GDP. To transmit signals during periods of cellular stress, the RIT1 protein is turned on by attaching (binding) to a molecule of GTP. The RIT1 protein is turned off (inactivated) when it converts the GTP to GDP. When the protein is bound to GDP, it does not relay signals to the cell's nucleus.The RIT1 gene belongs to a class of genes known as oncogenes. When mutated, oncogenes have the potential to cause normal cells to become cancerous. The RIT1 gene is in the Ras family of oncogenes, which also includes three other genes: KRAS, HRAS, and NRAS. These proteins play important roles in cell division, cell differentiation, and the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis).<> <>
chi: RIT1基因提供了制造蛋白质的说明，该蛋白质可帮助细胞在细胞应激期间存活，例如异常高的能量需求。作为被称为RAS / MAPK途径的信号传导途径的一部分，RIT1蛋白将信号从细胞外传递到细胞的细胞核。这些信号指导细胞生长和分裂（增殖）或成熟，并承担专门功能（区分）。 RIT1蛋白是一种GTP酶，它意味着它将称为GTP的分子转化为另一种称为GDP的分子。为了在细胞应激期间传递信号，通过附着（结合）GTP分子来启动RIT1蛋白。 RIT1蛋白在将GTP转换为GDP时被关闭（失活）。当蛋白质与GDP结合时，它不会将信号传递给细胞核.RIT1基因属于一类称为致癌基因的基因。当突变时，癌基因有可能导致正常细胞癌变。 RIT1基因位于Ras癌基因家族中，其中还包括三种其他基因：KRAS，HRAS和NRAS。这些蛋白质在细胞分裂，细胞分化和细胞的自我破坏（凋亡）中发挥重要作用

name: RET
eng: The RET gene provides instructions for producing a protein that is involved in signaling within cells.  This protein appears to be essential for the normal development of several kinds of  nerve cells, including nerves in the intestine (enteric neurons) and the portion of the nervous system that controls involuntary body functions such as heart rate (the autonomic nervous system).  The RET protein is also necessary for normal kidney development and the production of sperm (spermatogenesis).The RET protein spans the cell membrane, so that one end of the protein remains inside the cell and the other end projects from the outer surface of the cell. This positioning of the protein allows it to interact with specific factors outside the cell and to receive signals that help the cell respond to its environment. When molecules that stimulate growth and development (growth factors) attach to the RET protein, a complex cascade of chemical reactions inside the cell is triggered.  These reactions instruct the cell to undergo certain changes, such as dividing or maturing to take on specialized functions.<> <>
chi: RET基因提供了产生参与细胞内信号传导的蛋白质的说明。这种蛋白质对于几种神经细胞的正常发育似乎是必不可少的，包括肠道神经元（肠神经元）和控制无意识身体功能的部分神经系统，如心率（自主神经系统）。 RET蛋白对于正常肾发育和精子生成（精子发生）也是必需的.ET蛋白跨越细胞膜，使得蛋白的一端保留在细胞内部，另一端从细胞外表面突出。蛋白质的这种定位使其能够与细胞外的特定因子相互作用，并接收有助于细胞对其环境作出反应的信号。当刺激生长和发育的分子（生长因子）附着到RET蛋白上时，会触发细胞内部的一系列复杂的化学反应。这些反应指示细胞发生某些变化，例如分化或成熟以发挥特殊功能。<> <>

name: RBM20
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a protein that binds RNA and regulates splicing. Mutations in this gene have been associated with familial dilated cardiomyopathy. [provided by RefSeq, Apr 2014]From UniProt:RNA-binding protein that acts as a regulator of mRNA splicing of a subset of genes involved in cardiac development. Regulates splicing of TTN (Titin).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码结合RNA并调节剪接的蛋白质。该基因突变与家族性扩张型心肌病有关。 [由RefSeq，2014年4月提供]来自UniProt：作为参与心脏发育的基因子集的mRNA剪接调节剂的RNA结合蛋白。调节TTN（Titin）的拼接。<> <>

name: RAF1
eng: The RAF1 gene provides instructions for making a protein that is part of a signaling pathway called the RAS/MAPK pathway, which transmits chemical signals from outside the cell to the cell's nucleus. RAS/MAPK signaling helps control the growth and division (proliferation) of cells, the process by which cells mature to carry out specific functions (differentiation), cell movement (migration), and the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis).The RAF1 gene belongs to a class of genes known as oncogenes. When mutated, oncogenes have the potential to cause normal cells to become cancerous.<> <>
chi: RAF1基因提供了制造蛋白质的说明，所述蛋白质是称为RAS / MAPK途径的信号传导途径的一部分，该途径将来自细胞外的化学信号传递至细胞的细胞核。 RAS / MAPK信号通路有助于控制细胞的生长和分裂（增殖），这是细胞成熟发挥特定功能（分化），细胞运动（迁移）和细胞自我毁灭（凋亡）的过程。RAF1基因属于一类称为致癌基因的基因。当发生突变时，癌基因有可能导致正常细胞发生癌变。<> <>

name: PTPN11
eng: The PTPN11 gene provides instructions for making a protein called SHP-2. This protein helps regulate the RAS/MAPK signaling pathway. This pathway is involved in several important cell functions, including the growth and division of cells (proliferation), the process by which cells mature to carry out specific functions (differentiation), cell movement (migration), and the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis). During embryonic development, the SHP-2 protein is critical in the development of the heart, blood cells, bones, and several other tissues.The PTPN11 gene belongs to a class of genes known as oncogenes. When mutated, oncogenes have the potential to cause normal cells to become cancerous.<> <>
chi: PTPN11基因提供了制造称为SHP-2的蛋白质的说明。这种蛋白质有助于调节RAS / MAPK信号通路。该途径涉及几种重要的细胞功能，包括细胞的生长和分裂（增殖），细胞成熟以执行特定功能（分化），细胞移动（迁移）以及细胞自我毁坏的过程（细胞凋亡）。在胚胎发育过程中，SHP-2蛋白在心脏，血细胞，骨骼和其他几种组织的发育中起关键作用.PTPN11基因属于一类称为致癌基因的基因。当发生突变时，癌基因有可能导致正常细胞发生癌变。<> <>

name: PSEN1
eng: The PSEN1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called presenilin 1. This protein is one part (subunit) of a complex called gamma- (γ-) secretase. Presenilin 1 carries out the major function of the complex, which is to cut apart (cleave) other proteins into smaller pieces called peptides. This process is called proteolysis, and presenilin 1 is described as the proteolytic subunit of γ-secretase.The γ-secretase complex is located in the membrane that surrounds cells, where it cleaves many different proteins that span the cell membrane (transmembrane proteins). This cleavage is an important step in several chemical signaling pathways that transmit signals from outside the cell into the nucleus. One of these pathways, known as Notch signaling, is essential for the normal maturation and division of hair follicle cells and other types of skin cells.  Notch signaling is also involved in normal immune system function.The γ-secretase complex  may be best known for its role in processing amyloid precursor protein (APP), which is made in the brain and other tissues. γ-secretase cuts APP into smaller peptides, including soluble amyloid precursor protein (sAPP) and several versions of amyloid-beta (β) peptide. Evidence suggests that sAPP has growth-promoting properties and may play a role in the formation of nerve cells (neurons) in the brain both before and after birth. Other functions of sAPP and amyloid-β peptide are under investigation.<> <>
chi: PSEN1基因提供了制造称为早老素1的蛋白质的说明。该蛋白质是称为γ-（γ-）分泌酶复合物的一部分（亚基）。早老素1执行复合物的主要功能，即将其他蛋白质切割（切割）为称为肽的较小片段。这个过程被称为蛋白水解，早老蛋白1被描述为γ-分泌酶的蛋白水解亚基。γ-分泌酶复合物位于细胞周围的膜中，它在细胞膜上裂解许多跨越细胞膜的不同蛋白质（跨膜蛋白）。这种分裂是几种化学信号传导途径中的一个重要步骤，将信号从细胞外传输到细胞核。被称为Notch信号传导的这些途径之一对于毛囊细胞和其他类型皮肤细胞的正常成熟和分裂是必不可少的。 Notch信号也涉及正常的免疫系统功能。γ-分泌酶复合物可能以其在加工淀粉样前体蛋白（APP）中的作用而闻名，该APP在脑和其他组织中产生。 γ-分泌酶将APP切割成更小的肽，包括可溶性淀粉样前体蛋白（sAPP）和几种版本的淀粉样β（β）肽。有证据表明，sAPP具有促进生长的特性，并可能在出生前后在大脑中形成神经细胞（神经元）中发挥作用。正在研究sAPP和淀粉样β肽的其他功能。“>”>

name: PRKG1
eng: From NCBI Gene:Mammals have three different isoforms of cyclic GMP-dependent protein kinase (Ialpha, Ibeta, and II). These PRKG isoforms act as key mediators of the nitric oxide/cGMP signaling pathway and are important components of many signal transduction processes in diverse cell types. This PRKG1 gene on human chromosome 10 encodes the soluble Ialpha and Ibeta isoforms of PRKG by alternative transcript splicing. A separate gene on human chromosome 4, PRKG2, encodes the membrane-bound PRKG isoform II. The PRKG1 proteins play a central role in regulating cardiovascular and neuronal functions in addition to relaxing smooth muscle tone, preventing platelet aggregation, and modulating cell growth. This gene is most strongly expressed in all types of smooth muscle, platelets, cerebellar Purkinje cells, hippocampal neurons, and the lateral amygdala. Isoforms Ialpha and Ibeta have identical cGMP-binding and catalytic domains but differ in their leucine/isoleucine zipper and autoinhibitory sequences and therefore differ in their dimerization substrates and kinase enzyme activity. [provided by RefSeq, Sep 2011]From UniProt:Serine/threonine protein kinase that acts as key mediator of the nitric oxide (NO)/cGMP signaling pathway. GMP binding activates PRKG1, which phosphorylates serines and threonines on many cellular proteins. Numerous protein targets for PRKG1 phosphorylation are implicated in modulating cellular calcium, but the contribution of each of these targets may vary substantially among cell types. Proteins that are phosphorylated by PRKG1 regulate platelet activation and adhesion, smooth muscle contraction, cardiac function, gene expression, feedback of the NO-signaling pathway, and other processes involved in several aspects of the CNS like axon guidance, hippocampal and cerebellar learning, circadian rhythm and nociception. Smooth muscle relaxation is mediated through lowering of intracellular free calcium, by desensitization of contractile proteins to calcium, and by decrease in the contractile state of smooth muscle or in platelet activation. Regulates intracellular calcium levels via several pathways: phosphorylates MRVI1/IRAG and inhibits IP3-induced Ca(2+) release from intracellular stores, phosphorylation of KCNMA1 (BKCa) channels decreases intracellular Ca(2+) levels, which leads to increased opening of this channel. PRKG1 phosphorylates the canonical transient receptor potential channel (TRPC) family which inactivates the associated inward calcium current. Another mode of action of NO/cGMP/PKGI signaling involves PKGI-mediated inactivation of the Ras homolog gene family member A (RhoA). Phosphorylation of RHOA by PRKG1 blocks the action of this protein in myriad processes: regulation of RHOA translocation; decreasing contraction; controlling vesicle trafficking, reduction of myosin light chain phosphorylation resulting in vasorelaxation. Activation of PRKG1 by NO signaling alters also gene expression in a number of tissues. In smooth muscle cells, increased cGMP and PRKG1 activity influence expression of smooth muscle-specific contractile proteins, levels of proteins in the NO/cGMP signaling pathway, down-regulation of the matrix proteins osteopontin and thrombospondin-1 to limit smooth muscle cell migration and phenotype. Regulates vasodilator-stimulated phosphoprotein (VASP) functions in platelets and smooth muscle.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：哺乳动物具有三种不同的环状GMP依赖性蛋白激酶同种型（Ialpha，Ibeta和II）。这些PRKG同种型作为一氧化氮/ cGMP信号传导途径的关键介质，并且是不同细胞类型中许多信号转导过程的重要组分。人类10号染色体上的这个PRKG1基因通过替代性转录物剪接编码PRKG的可溶性Iα和Ibeta同种型。人染色体4上的单独基因PRKG2编码膜结合的PRKG亚型II。 PRKG1蛋白在调节心血管和神经元功能以及舒缓平滑肌张力，防止血小板聚集和调节细胞生长方面发挥着重要作用。该基因在所有类型的平滑肌，血小板，小脑浦肯野细胞，海马神经元和外侧杏仁核中表达最强烈。异构体Ialpha和Ibeta具有相同的cGMP-结合和催化结构域，但其亮氨酸/异亮氨酸拉链和自体抑制序列不同，因此其二聚化底物和激酶活性不同。 [由RefSeq提供，2011年9月]来自UniProt：作为一氧化氮（NO）/ cGMP信号通路的关键介质的丝氨酸/苏氨酸蛋白激酶。 GMP结合激活PRKG1，其使许多细胞蛋白上的丝氨酸和苏氨酸磷酸化。 PRKG1磷酸化的许多蛋白质靶标涉及调节细胞钙，但是这些靶标中的每一个对于细胞类型的贡献可能显着不同。被PRKG1磷酸化的蛋白质可调节血小板活化和粘附，平滑肌收缩，心脏功能，基因表达，NO信号通路的反馈，以及涉及CNS几个方面的其他过程，如轴突指导，海马和小脑学习，昼夜节律节奏和伤害感受。平滑肌松弛通过降低细胞内游离钙，通过使收缩蛋白对钙的脱敏作用，以及通过平滑肌的收缩状态或血小板活化的减少而介导。通过几种途径调节细胞内钙水平：磷酸化MRVI1 / IRAG并抑制IP3诱导的细胞内储存的Ca（2+）释放，KCNMA1（BKCa）通道的磷酸化降低细胞内Ca（2+）水平，这导致增加的开放渠道。 PRKG1使经典的瞬时受体电位通道（TRPC）家族磷酸化，从而使相关的内向钙电流失活。 NO / cGMP / PKGI信号传导的另一种作用模式涉及PKGI介导的Ras同源基因家族成员A（RhoA）的失活。 PRKG1对RHOA的磷酸化阻断了这种蛋白质在无数过程中的作用：调节RHOA易位;收缩减少;控制囊泡运输，减少肌球蛋白轻链磷酸化导致血管舒张。通过NO信号激活PRKG1也会改变许多组织中的基因表达。在平滑肌细胞中，增加的cGMP和PRKG1活性影响平滑肌特异性收缩蛋白的表达，NO / cGMP信号传导途径中的蛋白质水平，基质蛋白骨桥蛋白和血小板反应蛋白-1的下调以限制平滑肌细胞迁移和表型。在血小板和平滑肌中调节血管舒张刺激的磷蛋白（VASP）功能<> <>

name: PTF1A
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a protein that is a component of the pancreas transcription factor 1 complex (PTF1) and is known to have a role in mammalian pancreatic development. The protein plays a role in determining whether cells allocated to the pancreatic buds continue towards pancreatic organogenesis or revert back to duodenal fates. The protein is thought to be involved in the maintenance of exocrine pancreas-specific gene expression including elastase 1 and amylase. Mutations in this gene cause cerebellar agenesis and loss of expression is seen in ductal type pancreas cancers. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Transcription factor implicated in the cell fate determination in various organs. Binds to the E-box consensus sequence 5'-CANNTG-3'. Plays a role in early and late pancreas development and differentiation. Important for determining whether cells allocated to the pancreatic buds continue towards pancreatic organogenesis or revert back to duodenal fates. May be involved in the maintenance of exocrine pancreas-specific gene expression including ELA1 and amylase. Required for the formation of pancreatic acinar and ductal cells. Plays an important role in cerebellar development. Directly regulated by FOXN4 and RORC during retinal development, FOXN4-PTF1A pathway plays a central role in directing the differentiation of retinal progenitors towards horizontal and amacrine fates.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码一种蛋白质，该蛋白质是胰腺转录因子1复合物（PTF1）的组成成分，并且已知其在哺乳动物胰腺发育中发挥作用。蛋白质在确定分配给胰芽的细胞是否继续朝向胰腺器官发生或恢复到十二指肠命运中起作用。据认为该蛋白质参与维持外分泌胰腺特异性基因表达，包括弹性蛋白酶1和淀粉酶。导管型胰腺癌可见该基因突变导致小脑发育不全和表达缺失。 [由RefSeq提供，2008年7月]来自UniProt：涉及各种器官细胞命运决定的转录因子。绑定到E-box共有序列5'-CANNTG-3'。在早期和晚期胰腺发育和分化中发挥作用。对于确定分配给胰芽的细胞是否持续朝向胰腺器官发生或恢复至十二指肠命运是重要的。可能参与维持外分泌胰腺特异性基因表达，包括ELA1和淀粉酶。胰腺腺泡和导管细胞形成需要。在小脑发育中发挥重要作用。在视网膜发育期间由FOXN4和RORC直接调节，FOXN4-PTF1A途径在指导视网膜祖细胞分化为水平和无界限的命运中发挥中心作用。<> <>

name: PRKAR1A
eng: The PRKAR1A gene provides instructions for making one part (subunit) of an enzyme called protein kinase A. This enzyme promotes cell growth and division (proliferation). Protein kinase A is made up of four protein subunits, two of which are called regulatory subunits because they control whether this enzyme is turned on or off. The PRKAR1A gene provides instructions for making one of these regulatory subunits, called type 1 alpha. Protein kinase A remains turned off when the regulatory subunits are attached to the other two subunits of the enzyme. In order to turn on protein kinase A, the regulatory subunits must break away from the enzyme.<> <>
chi: PRKAR1A基因提供了制造称为蛋白激酶A的酶的一个部分（亚基）的说明。该酶促进细胞生长和分裂（增殖）。蛋白激酶A由四个蛋白亚基组成，其中两个被称为调节亚基，因为它们控制该酶是否被打开或关闭。 PRKAR1A基因提供了制造这些调节亚基之一的说明，称为1型阿尔法。当调节亚基连接到酶的另两个亚基时，蛋白激酶A保持关闭。为了打开蛋白激酶A，调节亚基必须从酶上分离出来。<> <>

name: PPARG
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a member of the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor (PPAR) subfamily of nuclear receptors. PPARs form heterodimers with retinoid X receptors (RXRs) and these heterodimers regulate transcription of various genes. Three subtypes of PPARs are known: PPAR-alpha, PPAR-delta, and PPAR-gamma. The protein encoded by this gene is PPAR-gamma and is a regulator of adipocyte differentiation. Additionally, PPAR-gamma has been implicated in the pathology of numerous diseases including obesity, diabetes, atherosclerosis and cancer. Alternatively spliced transcript variants that encode different isoforms have been described. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Nuclear receptor that binds peroxisome proliferators such as hypolipidemic drugs and fatty acids. Once activated by a ligand, the nuclear receptor binds to DNA specific PPAR response elements (PPRE) and modulates the transcription of its target genes, such as acyl-CoA oxidase. It therefore controls the peroxisomal beta-oxidation pathway of fatty acids. Key regulator of adipocyte differentiation and glucose homeostasis. ARF6 acts as a key regulator of the tissue-specific adipocyte P2 (aP2) enhancer. Acts as a critical regulator of gut homeostasis by suppressing NF-kappa-B-mediated proinflammatory responses. Plays a role in the regulation of cardiovascular circadian rhythms by regulating the transcription of ARNTL/BMAL1 in the blood vessels.(Microbial infection) Upon treatment with M.tuberculosis or its lipoprotein LpqH, phosphorylation of MAPK p38 and IL-6 production are modulated, probably via this protein.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码过氧化物酶体增殖物激活受体（PPAR）核受体亚家族成员。 PPARs与类视色素X受体（RXR）形成异二聚体，这些异二聚体调节各种基因的转录。已知PPAR的三种亚型：PPAR-α，PPAR-δ和PPAR-γ。由该基因编码的蛋白质是PPAR-γ，是脂肪细胞分化的调节剂。另外，PPAR-γ与许多疾病的病理有关，包括肥胖，糖尿病，动脉粥样硬化和癌症。已经描述了编码不同同种型的剪接转录物变体。 [由RefSeq，2008年7月提供]来自UniProt：结合过氧化物酶体增殖物的核受体，如降脂药和脂肪酸。一旦被配体激活，核受体结合DNA特异性PPAR应答元件（PPRE）并调节其靶基因如酰基-CoA氧化酶的转录。因此它控制脂肪酸的过氧化物酶体β-氧化途径。脂肪细胞分化和葡萄糖稳态的关键调节因子。 ARF6充当组织特异性脂肪细胞P2（aP2）增强子的关键调节剂。通过抑制NF-kappa-B介导的促炎症反应，起到肠道内稳态的关键调节剂的作用。通过调节血管中ARNTL / BMAL1的转录，在调节心血管昼夜节律中发挥作用（微生物感染）在用结核分枝杆菌或其脂蛋白LpqH治疗后，调节MAPK p38和IL-6产生的磷酸化，可能通过这种蛋白质。<> <>

name: PRKACA
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes one of the catalytic subunits of protein kinase A, which exists as a tetrameric holoenzyme with two regulatory subunits and two catalytic subunits, in its inactive form. cAMP causes the dissociation of the inactive holoenzyme into a dimer of regulatory subunits bound to four cAMP and two free monomeric catalytic subunits. Four different regulatory subunits and three catalytic subunits have been identified in humans. cAMP-dependent phosphorylation of proteins by protein kinase A is important to many cellular processes, including differentiation, proliferation, and apoptosis. Constitutive activation of this gene caused either by somatic mutations, or genomic duplications of regions that include this gene, have been associated with hyperplasias and adenomas of the adrenal cortex and are linked to corticotropin-independent Cushing's syndrome. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms. Tissue-specific isoforms that differ at the N-terminus have been described, and these isoforms may differ in the post-translational modifications that occur at the N-terminus of some isoforms. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2015]From UniProt:Phosphorylates a large number of substrates in the cytoplasm and the nucleus. Regulates the abundance of compartmentalized pools of its regulatory subunits through phosphorylation of PJA2 which binds and ubiquitinates these subunits, leading to their subsequent proteolysis. Phosphorylates CDC25B, ABL1, NFKB1, CLDN3, PSMC5/RPT6, PJA2, RYR2, RORA and VASP. RORA is activated by phosphorylation. Required for glucose-mediated adipogenic differentiation increase and osteogenic differentiation inhibition from osteoblasts. Involved in the regulation of platelets in response to thrombin and collagen; maintains circulating platelets in a resting state by phosphorylating proteins in numerous platelet inhibitory pathways when in complex with NF-kappa-B (NFKB1 and NFKB2) and I-kappa-B-alpha (NFKBIA), but thrombin and collagen disrupt these complexes and free active PRKACA stimulates platelets and leads to platelet aggregation by phosphorylating VASP. Prevents the antiproliferative and anti-invasive effects of alpha-difluoromethylornithine in breast cancer cells when activated. RYR2 channel activity is potentiated by phosphorylation in presence of luminal Ca(2+), leading to reduced amplitude and increased frequency of store overload-induced Ca(2+) release (SOICR) characterized by an increased rate of Ca(2+) release and propagation velocity of spontaneous Ca(2+) waves, despite reduced wave amplitude and resting cytosolic Ca(2+). PSMC5/RPT6 activation by phosphorylation stimulates proteasome. Negatively regulates tight junctions (TJs) in ovarian cancer cells via CLDN3 phosphorylation. NFKB1 phosphorylation promotes NF-kappa-B p50-p50 DNA binding. Involved in embryonic development by down-regulating the Hedgehog (Hh) signaling pathway that determines embryo pattern formation and morphogenesis. Prevents meiosis resumption in prophase-arrested oocytes via CDC25B inactivation by phosphorylation. May also regulate rapid eye movement (REM) sleep in the pedunculopontine tegmental (PPT). Phosphorylates APOBEC3G and AICDA. Isoform 2 phosphorylates and activates ABL1 in sperm flagellum to promote spermatozoa capacitation. Phosphorylates HSF1; this phosphorylation promotes HSF1 nuclear localization and transcriptional activity upon heat shock (PubMed:21085490).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码蛋白激酶A的催化亚基之一，其以两种调节亚基和两种催化亚基的无活性形式作为四聚体全酶存在。 cAMP导致无活性全酶分解为与四个cAMP和两个自由单体催化亚基结合的调节亚基的二聚体。已经在人体中鉴定了四种不同的调节亚基和三种催化亚基。蛋白激酶A对蛋白质的cAMP依赖性磷酸化对于许多细胞过程（包括分化，增殖和凋亡）是重要的。由体细胞突变引起的该基因的组成性激活或包含该基因的区域的基因组复制已经与肾上腺皮质增生和腺瘤相关，并且与促肾上腺皮质激素独立的库欣综合征有关。选择性剪接产生编码不同同种型的多种转录物变体。已经描述了在N端不同的组织特异性同种型，并且这些同种型可能在某些同种型的N端发生的翻译后修饰中不同。 [由RefSeq提供，2015年1月]来自UniProt：磷酸化细胞质和细胞核中的大量底物。通过PJA2的磷酸化调节其调节亚基的分隔池的丰度，PJA2结合并遍在蛋白化这些亚基，导致它们随后的蛋白水解。磷酸化CDC25B，ABL1，NFKB1，CLDN3，PSMC5 / RPT6，PJA2，RYR2，RORA和VASP。 RORA被磷酸化激活。葡萄糖介导的脂肪形成分化增加和成骨细胞成骨分化抑制所需。参与调节血小板对凝血酶和胶原的反应;当与NF-kappa-B（NFKB1和NFKB2）和I-kappa-B-α（NFKBIA）复合时，通过在许多血小板抑制途径中磷酸化蛋白质而维持循环血小板处于静息状态，但凝血酶和胶原蛋白破坏这些复合物并释放活性PRKACA刺激血小板并通过磷酸化VASP导致血小板聚集。激活时，可预防乳腺癌细胞中α-二氟甲基鸟氨酸的抗增殖和抗侵袭作用。 RYR2通道活动通过磷酸化加强管腔Ca（2+）存在，导致幅度减小和增加频率的商店超载诱导经释放（SOICR）的特点是释放率增加释放和传播速度的自发经波，尽管波幅减少和休息胞浆经。通过磷酸化激活PSMC5 / RPT6刺激蛋白酶体。通过CLDN3磷酸化负调节卵巢癌细胞中的紧密连接（TJ）。 NFKB1磷酸化促进NF-kappa-B p50-p50 DNA结合。通过下调决定胚胎模式形成和形态发生的Hedgehog（Hh）信号传导途径参与胚胎发育。通过磷酸化使CDC25B失活，阻止前期捕获的卵母细胞的减数分裂恢复。也可以调节pedunculopontine tegmental（PPT）中的快速眼动（REM）睡眠。磷酸化APOBEC3G和AICDA。异构体2磷酸化并激活精子鞭毛中的ABL1以促进精子获能。磷酸化HSF1;该磷酸化促进热休克时HSF1核定位和转录活性（PubMed：21085490）。<> <>

name: POLD1
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes the 125-kDa catalytic subunit of DNA polymerase delta. DNA polymerase delta possesses both polymerase and 3' to 5' exonuclease activity and plays a critical role in DNA replication and repair. Alternatively spliced transcript variants have been observed for this gene, and a pseudogene of this gene is located on the long arm of chromosome 6. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2012]From UniProt:As the catalytic component of the trimeric (Pol-delta3 complex) and tetrameric DNA polymerase delta complexes (Pol-delta4 complex), plays a crucial role in high fidelity genome replication, including in lagging strand synthesis, and repair. Exhibits both DNA polymerase and 3'- to 5'-exonuclease activities (PubMed:16510448, PubMed:19074196, PubMed:20334433, PubMed:24035200, PubMed:24022480). Requires the presence of accessory proteins POLD2, POLD3 and POLD4 for full activity. Depending upon the absence (Pol-delta3) or the presence of POLD4 (Pol-delta4), displays differences in catalytic activity. Most notably, expresses higher proofreading activity in the context of Pol-delta3 compared with that of Pol-delta4 (PubMed:19074196, PubMed:20334433). Although both Pol-delta3 and Pol-delta4 process Okazaki fragments in vitro, Pol-delta3 may be better suited to fulfill this task, exhibiting near-absence of strand displacement activity compared to Pol-delta4 and stalling on encounter with the 5'-blocking oligonucleotides. Pol-delta3 idling process may avoid the formation of a gap, while maintaining a nick that can be readily ligated (PubMed:24035200). Along with DNA polymerase kappa, DNA polymerase delta carries out approximately half of nucleotide excision repair (NER) synthesis following UV irradiation (PubMed:20227374). Under conditions of DNA replication stress, in the presence of POLD3 and POLD4, may catalyze the repair of broken replication forks through break-induced replication (BIR) (PubMed:24310611). Involved in the translesion synthesis (TLS) of templates carrying O6-methylguanine or abasic sites (PubMed:19074196).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码DNA聚合酶δ的125-kDa催化亚基。 DNA聚合酶δ具有聚合酶和3'至5'核酸外切酶活性，并在DNA复制和修复中起关键作用。已经观察到该基因的剪接转录物变体，该基因的假基因位于染色体6的长臂上。[由RefSeq，2012年3月提供] From UniProt：作为三聚体（Pol-delta3复合体）和四聚DNA聚合酶δ复合物（Pol-delta4复合物）在高保真度基因组复制中发挥重要作用，包括滞后链合成和修复。展示DNA聚合酶和3'-到5'-外切核酸酶活性（PubMed：16510448，PubMed：19074196，PubMed：20334433，PubMed：24035200，PubMed：24022480）。需要辅助蛋白POLD2，POLD3和POLD4的存在才能完成活动。根据不存在（Pol-delta3）或POLD4（Pol-delta4）的存在，显示催化活性的差异。最值得注意的是，与Pol-delta4相比，Pol-delta3表达更高的校对活动（PubMed：19074196，PubMed：20334433）。尽管Pol-delta3和Pol-delta4在体外处理冈崎片段，但Pol-delta3可能更适合于完成这项任务，与Pol-delta4相比，表现出几乎没有链置换活性，并且在遇到5'-阻断寡核苷酸。 Pol-delta3怠速过程可避免形成间隙，同时保持可容易结扎的缺口（PubMed：24035200）。与DNA聚合酶kappa一起，DNA聚合酶delta在紫外线照射后（PubMed：20227374）进行大约一半的核苷酸切除修复（NER）合成。在DNA复制应激条件下，在POLD3和POLD4存在下，可通过断裂诱导的复制（BIR）催化破碎的复制叉的修复（PubMed：24310611）。参与携带O6-甲基鸟嘌呤或无碱基位点（PubMed：19074196）的模板的Translesion合成（TLS）。<> <>

name: PRDM16
eng: From NCBI Gene:The reciprocal translocation t(1;3)(p36;q21) occurs in a subset of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) and acute myeloid leukemia (AML). This gene is located near the 1p36.3 breakpoint and has been shown to be specifically expressed in the t(1:3)(p36,q21)-positive MDS/AML. The protein encoded by this gene is a zinc finger transcription factor and contains an N-terminal PR domain. The translocation results in the overexpression of a truncated version of this protein that lacks the PR domain, which may play an important role in the pathogenesis of MDS and AML. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding distinct isoforms have been reported. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Binds DNA and functions as a transcriptional regulator. Functions in the differentiation of brown adipose tissue (BAT) which is specialized in dissipating chemical energy in the form of heat in response to cold or excess feeding while white adipose tissue (WAT) is specialized in the storage of excess energy and the control of systemic metabolism. Together with CEBPB, regulates the differentiation of myoblastic precursors into brown adipose cells. Functions also as a repressor of TGF-beta signaling. Isoform 4 may regulate granulocytes differentiation.<> <>
chi: 相互易位t（1; 3）（p36; q21）发生在骨髓增生异常综合征（MDS）和急性髓性白血病（AML）的亚组中，该疾病的特征是骨髓三系细胞异常增生，特别是心脏细胞增生，而且预后不良。该基因位于1p36.3断点附近，并已显示在t（1：3）（p36，q21）阳性MDS / AML中特异性表达。该基因编码的蛋白质是锌指转录因子，并含有N-末端PR结构域。该易位导致该蛋白的截短形式的过表达缺乏PR结构域，其可能在MDS和AML的发病机制中起重要作用。已报道了编码不同同种型的剪接转录物变体。

name: PNPLA2
eng: The PNPLA2 gene provides instructions for making an enzyme called adipose triglyceride lipase (ATGL).  The ATGL enzyme plays a role in breaking down fats called triglycerides, which are the main source of stored energy in cells.  Triglycerides are the major component of cell structures called lipid droplets (also called adiposomes).  The ATGL enzyme is found on the surface of lipid droplets. When activated, the ATGL enzyme breaks down triglycerides to provide energy for the body.<> <>
chi: PNPLA2基因提供了制造称为脂肪甘油三酯脂肪酶（ATGL）的酶的说明。 ATGL酶在分解称为甘油三酯的脂肪中起作用，甘油三酯是细胞中储存能量的主要来源。甘油三酯是称为脂滴（也称为脂质体）的细胞结构的主要组分。 ATGL酶在脂滴表面上被发现。激活后，ATGL酶分解甘油三酯，为身体提供能量。“>”>

name: POMC
eng: The POMC gene provides instructions for making a protein called proopiomelanocortin (POMC), which is cut (cleaved) into smaller pieces called peptides that have different functions in the body. The peptides attach (bind) to one of several proteins in different regions of the body, and this binding triggers signaling pathways that control many important functions.One peptide produced from the POMC protein is called adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH). ACTH binds to melanocortin 2 receptor (MC2R), stimulating the release of a hormone called cortisol. This hormone helps maintain blood sugar levels, protects the body from stress, and stops (suppresses) inflammation.Three similar peptides called alpha-, beta-, and gamma-melanocyte stimulating hormones (α-, β-, and γ-MSH) are also cut from the POMC protein. The primary role of α-MSH is in the pigment-producing cells of the skin and hair (melanocytes), where it binds to melanocortin 1 receptor (MC1R). This attachment stimulates the production and release of a pigment called melanin, which is the substance that gives skin and hair their color.The β-MSH peptide plays a role in weight regulation by binding to melanocortin 4 receptor (MC4R). Signaling through this receptor in the brain helps maintain the balance between energy from food taken into the body and energy spent by the body. The correct balance is important to control eating and weight. The α-MSH peptide can also bind to MC4R and help maintain the correct energy balance.Studies show that γ-MSH binds to melanocortin 3 receptor (MC3R). Signaling stimulated by this interaction appears to be involved in regulating the amount of sodium in the body and controlling blood pressure, although the mechanism is unclear.Another peptide produced from POMC is β-endorphin. Attachment of β-endorphin to proteins in the brain called opioid receptors stimulates signaling for pain relief.<> <>
chi: POMC基因提供了制造称为proopiomelanocortin（POMC）的蛋白质的说明，该蛋白质被切割（切割）成更小的片段，称为在体内具有不同功能的肽。肽附着（结合）身体不同区域的几种蛋白质之一，并且这种结合触发控制许多重要功能的信号传导途径。从POMC蛋白产生的一种肽称为促肾上腺皮质激素（ACTH）。 ACTH与黑皮质素2受体（MC2R）结合，刺激称为皮质醇的激素释放。这种激素有助于维持血糖水平，保护身体免受压力，并且停止（抑制）炎症。三种类似的称为α-，β-和γ-黑素细胞刺激激素（α-，β-和γ-MSH）的肽是也从POMC蛋白质中切下。 α-MSH的主要作用是在皮肤和毛发的色素产生细胞（黑素细胞）中，它与黑皮质素1受体（MC1R）结合。这种附着刺激产生和释放称为黑色素的色素，它是赋予皮肤和毛发颜色的物质.β-MSH肽通过结合黑皮质素4受体（MC4R）在体重调节中起作用。通过大脑中的这种受体发出信号有助于维持摄入体内食物的能量与身体消耗的能量之间的平衡。正确的平衡对于控制饮食和体重非常重要。 α-MSH肽还可以结合MC4R并有助于维持正确的能量平衡。研究表明γ-MSH结合黑皮质素3受体（MC3R）。通过这种相互作用刺激的信号似乎涉及调节体内钠的量和控制血压，尽管其机制尚不清楚.POMC产生的另一种肽是β-内啡肽。 β-内啡肽与大脑中被称为阿片受体的蛋白质的连接刺激了缓解疼痛的信号传导。<> <>

name: CAVIN1
eng: The CAVIN1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called cavin-1. This protein is found in cells and tissues throughout the body. It is most abundant in several types of cells: osteoblasts, which are cells that build bones; muscle cells; and adipocytes, which are cells that store fats for energy. Adipocytes make up most of the body's fatty (adipose) tissue.Studies suggest that cavin-1 plays an essential role in forming and stabilizing caveolae, which are small pouches in the membrane that surrounds cells. Caveolae have multiple functions, some of which are not well understood. They are known to be involved in the transport of molecules from the cell membrane to the interior of the cell (endocytosis), processing of molecules on their way into the cell, maintaining the cell structure, and regulating chemical signaling pathways. Caveolae are particularly numerous in adipocytes, where they appear to be essential for the normal transport, processing, and storage of fats.Within cells, cavin-1 is also found in the nucleus and in the fluid that surrounds the nucleus (the cytoplasm). In addition to its role in caveolae, studies suggest that this protein is involved in repairing damage to the outer cell membrane, cell growth and division (proliferation), cell movement, stopping cell division in older cells (senescence), and regulating various chemical signaling pathways. The functions of cavin-1 likely differ depending on the type of cell and the part of the cell where the protein is found.<> <>
chi: CAVIN1基因提供了制作蛋白质cavin-1的说明。这种蛋白质存在于整个身体的细胞和组织中。它在几种类型的细胞中是最丰富的：成骨细胞，它是构建骨骼的细胞;肌细胞;和脂肪细胞，它们是储存脂肪供能的细胞。脂肪细胞构成人体脂肪（脂肪）组织的大部分。研究表明，cavin-1在形成和稳定小窝囊泡中扮演着重要角色，小窝囊膜是细胞周围的膜囊。 Caveolae具有多种功能，其中一些功能尚未得到很好的理解。已知它们参与将分子从细胞膜转运至细胞内部（胞吞作用），分子在进入细胞的过程中处理，维持细胞结构以及调节化学信号传导途径。 Caveolae在脂肪细胞中特别多，它们似乎对脂肪的正常转运，加工和储存至关重要。在细胞中，cavin-1也在细胞核和围绕细胞核（细胞质）的液体中发现。除了它在小窝穴中的作用外，研究还表明这种蛋白质参与修复对外部细胞膜的损伤，细胞生长和分裂（增殖），细胞运动，停止老年细胞中的细胞分裂（衰老）以及调节各种化学信号途径。 cavin-1的功能可能根据细胞类型和发现蛋白质的细胞部分而不同。<> <>

name: PLN
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is found as a pentamer and is a major substrate for the cAMP-dependent protein kinase in cardiac muscle. The encoded protein is an inhibitor of cardiac muscle sarcoplasmic reticulum Ca(2+)-ATPase in the unphosphorylated state, but inhibition is relieved upon phosphorylation of the protein. The subsequent activation of the Ca(2+) pump leads to enhanced muscle relaxation rates, thereby contributing to the inotropic response elicited in heart by beta-agonists. The encoded protein is a key regulator of cardiac diastolic function. Mutations in this gene are a cause of inherited human dilated cardiomyopathy with refractory congestive heart failure, and also familial hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. [provided by RefSeq, Apr 2016]From UniProt:Reversibly inhibits the activity of ATP2A2 in cardiac sarcoplasmic reticulum by decreasing the apparent affinity of the ATPase for Ca(2+). Modulates the contractility of the heart muscle in response to physiological stimuli via its effects on ATP2A2. Modulates calcium re-uptake during muscle relaxation and plays an important role in calcium homeostasis in the heart muscle. The degree of ATP2A2 inhibition depends on the oligomeric state of PLN. ATP2A2 inhibition is alleviated by PLN phosphorylation.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质作为五聚体发现并且是​​心肌中cAMP依赖性蛋白激酶的主要底物。编码的蛋白质是未磷酸化状态下心肌肌浆网Ca（2 +） -  ATP酶的抑制剂，但蛋白质磷酸化后抑制作用减轻。随后的经泵活化导致肌肉松弛率增加，从而有助于β受体激动剂在心脏引起的收缩力反应。编码的蛋白质是心脏舒张功能的关键调节剂。该基因中的突变是导致遗传性人类扩张型心肌病伴顽固性充血性心力衰竭以及家族性肥厚型心肌病的原因。 [由RefSeq提供，2016年4月]来自UniProt：通过降低ATP酶对Ca（2+）的表观亲和力，可逆地抑制心肌肌浆网中ATP2A2的活性。通过对ATP2A2的作用调节心脏肌肉对生理刺激反应的收缩力。调节肌肉松弛期间的钙再摄取，并在心肌中的钙稳态中起重要作用。 ATP2A2抑制的程度取决于PLN的寡聚状态。 PLN磷酸化减轻了ATP2A2的抑制。“>”

name: PLIN1
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene coats lipid storage droplets in adipocytes, thereby protecting them until they can be broken down by hormone-sensitive lipase. The encoded protein is the major cAMP-dependent protein kinase substrate in adipocytes and, when unphosphorylated, may play a role in the inhibition of lipolysis. Alternatively spliced transcript variants varying in the 5' UTR, but encoding the same protein, have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2009]From UniProt:Modulator of adipocyte lipid metabolism. Coats lipid storage droplets to protect them from breakdown by hormone-sensitive lipase (HSL). Its absence may result in leanness. Plays a role in unilocular lipid droplet formation by activating CIDEC. Their interaction promotes lipid droplet enlargement and directional net neutral lipid transfer. May modulate lipolysis and triglyceride levels.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质将脂质储存液滴涂覆在脂肪细胞中，从而保护它们直至它们可以被激素敏感性脂肪酶分解。编码的蛋白质是脂肪细胞中主要的cAMP依赖性蛋白激酶底物，当未磷酸化时，可能在抑制脂解中发挥作用。对于该基因，已经发现了在5'UTR中变化但编码相同蛋白质的剪接转录物变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2009年2月]来自UniProt：脂肪细胞脂质代谢的调节剂。涂上脂质储存液滴以保护它们免受激素敏感性脂肪酶（HSL）的破坏。它的缺席可能导致精益。通过激活CIDEC在单眼脂滴形成中发挥作用。它们的相互作用促进脂滴增大和定向净中性脂质转移。可调节脂肪分解和甘油三酯水平。<> <>

name: PKP2
eng: The PKP2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called plakophilin 2. This protein is found primarily in cells of the myocardium, which is the muscular wall of the heart. Within these cells, plakophilin 2 is one of several proteins that make up structures called desmosomes. These structures form junctions that attach cells to one another. Desmosomes provide strength to the myocardium and are involved in signaling between neighboring cells.<> <>
chi: PKP2基因提供了制造称为plakophilin 2的蛋白质的模板，该蛋白主要存在于心肌细胞中。在这些细胞中，plakophilin 2是构成称为桥粒结构的几种蛋白之一。这些结构形成将细胞相互连接的连接点。桥粒为心肌提供强度，并参与相邻细胞之间的信号传导。

name: PLAGL1
eng: The PLAGL1 gene provides instructions for making a member of a protein family called zinc finger proteins. Zinc finger proteins are involved in many cellular functions. These proteins each contain one or more short regions called zinc finger domains, which include a specific pattern of protein building blocks (amino acids) and one or more charged atoms of zinc (zinc ions).Zinc finger proteins attach (bind) primarily to DNA. In most cases, they attach to regions near certain genes and turn the genes on and off as needed. Proteins that bind to DNA and regulate the activity of particular genes are known as transcription factors. Some zinc finger proteins can also bind to other molecules, including RNA (a chemical cousin of DNA) and proteins.The PLAGL1 protein helps regulate the cell's process for replicating itself in an organized, step-by-step fashion (cell cycle), and is involved in the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis). It is also important in fetal growth. The PLAGL1 protein helps control another protein called the pituitary adenylate cyclase-activating polypeptide receptor (PACAP1). One of the functions of the PACAP1 protein is to stimulate insulin secretion by beta cells in the pancreas. Insulin controls how much glucose (a type of sugar) is passed from the blood into cells for conversion to energy.PLAGL1 is a paternally expressed imprinted gene, which means that normally only the copy of the gene that comes from the father is active. The copy of the gene that comes from the mother is inactivated (silenced) by a mechanism called methylation.<> <>
chi: PLAGL1基因提供了制造称为锌指蛋白质的蛋白质家族成员的说明。锌指蛋白参与许多细胞功能。这些蛋白质每个都含有一个或多个被称为锌指结构域的短区域，其中包含特定模式的蛋白质结构单元（氨基酸）和一个或多个锌原子带电原子（锌离子）。锌指蛋白主要与DNA结合（结合） 。在大多数情况下，它们附着于某些基因附近的区域，并根据需要开启和关闭基因。与DNA结合并调节特定基因活性的蛋白质被称为转录因子。一些锌指蛋白还可以与其他分子结合，包括RNA（DNA的化学表亲）和蛋白质.PLAGL1蛋白有助于调节细胞以有组织，逐步的方式（细胞周期）复制自身的过程，以及参与细胞的自我毁灭（细胞凋亡）。它在胎儿生长中也很重要。 PLAGL1蛋白有助于控制另一种称为垂体腺苷酸环化酶激活多肽受体（PACAP1）的蛋白。 PACAP1蛋白的功能之一是通过胰腺中的β细胞刺激胰岛素分泌。胰岛素控制多少葡萄糖（一种糖）从血液传递到细胞中以转化为能量.PLAGL1是父亲表达的印记基因，这意味着通常只有来自父亲的基因的拷贝是活性的。来自母亲的基因拷贝通过称为甲基化的机制被灭活（沉默）。<> <>

name: PDX1
