Enhances the transcriptional activity of TCF1/HNF1A and FOXO1. Inhibits epithelial cell migration. Mediates colon carcinoma cell survival in mitogen-poor environments. Inhibits the SHH and WNT1 pathways, thereby enhancing adipogenesis. In addition, promotes expression of the gluconeogenic enzyme glucose-6-phosphatase (G6PC).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码核定位蛋白激酶家族的成员。编码的蛋白质参与细胞周期的调节。该基因的表达可能在肿瘤细胞中发生改变，并且发现该基因中的突变引起腹部肥胖 - 代谢综合征3.选择性剪接导致多种转录物变体。 [由RefSeq，2014年6月提供]来自UniProt：具有丝氨酸/苏氨酸和酪氨酸激酶活性的双特异性激酶。增强TCF1 / HNF1A和FOXO1的转录活性。抑制上皮细胞迁移。在有丝分裂原的环境中介导结肠癌细胞的存活。抑制SHH和WNT1途径，从而增强脂肪形成。此外，促进葡糖异生酶葡萄糖-6-磷酸酶（G6PC）的表达。<> <>

name: DSP
eng: The DSP gene provides instructions for making a protein called desmoplakin. This protein is found primarily in cells of the heart and skin, where it is a major component of specialized structures called desmosomes. These structures help hold neighboring cells together, which provides strength and stability to tissues. Desmosomes may also be involved in other critical cell functions, including chemical signaling pathways, the process by which cells mature to perform specific functions (differentiation), and the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis).<> <>
chi: DSP基因提供制造称为desmoplakin的蛋白质的模板。这种蛋白质主要存在于心脏和皮肤的细胞中，它是称为桥粒的特殊结构的主要成分。这些结构有助于将相邻的细胞保持在一起，从而为组织提供强度和稳定性桥粒也可以涉及其他关键的细胞功能，包括化学信号传导途径，细胞成熟以执行特定功能（分化）的过程以及细胞的自我破坏（凋亡）。

name: DSG2
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a member of the desmoglein family and cadherin cell adhesion molecule superfamily of proteins. Desmogleins are calcium-binding transmembrane glycoprotein components of desmosomes, cell-cell junctions between epithelial, myocardial, and other cell types. The encoded preproprotein is proteolytically processed to generate the mature glycoprotein. This gene is present in a gene cluster with other desmoglein gene family members on chromosome 18. Mutations in this gene have been associated with arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 10. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2016]From UniProt:Component of intercellular desmosome junctions. Involved in the interaction of plaque proteins and intermediate filaments mediating cell-cell adhesion.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码桥粒核心家族家族和钙粘蛋白细胞粘附分子蛋白超家族成员。桥粒核心蛋白是桥粒的钙结合跨膜糖蛋白组分，上皮细胞，心肌细胞和其他细胞类型之间的细胞 - 细胞连接。编码的前原蛋白经蛋白水解处理以产生成熟的糖蛋白。该基因与第18号染色体上的其他桥粒核心蛋白基因家族成员存在基因簇中。该基因的突变与致心律失常性右心室发育不良有关，家族性，10. [由RefSeq，2016年1月提供] From UniProt：Intercellular desmosome路口。参与斑块蛋白和介导细胞间粘附的中间丝的相互作用。<> <>

name: DSC2
eng: The DSC2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called desmocollin-2. This protein is found in many tissues, although it appears to be particularly important in the heart muscle and skin. Desmocollin-2 is a major component of specialized structures called desmosomes. These structures help hold neighboring cells together, which provides strength and stability to tissues. Desmosomes may also be involved in other critical cell functions, including chemical signaling pathways, the process by which cells mature to perform specific functions (differentiation), and the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis).<> <>
chi: DSC2基因提供了制造称为桥粒胶蛋白2的蛋白质的说明。这种蛋白质在许多组织中都有发现，尽管它在心肌和皮肤中似乎特别重要。桥粒胶蛋白-2是称为桥粒的特殊结构的主要组分。这些结构有助于将相邻的细胞保持在一起，从而为组织提供强度和稳定性桥粒也可以涉及其他关键的细胞功能，包括化学信号传导途径，细胞成熟以执行特定功能（分化）的过程以及细胞的自我破坏（凋亡）。<> <>

name: DNAJC3
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a protein with multiple tetratricopeptide repeat (TPR) motifs as well as the highly conserved J domain found in DNAJ chaperone family members. It is a member of the tetratricopeptide repeat family of proteins and acts as an inhibitor of the interferon-induced, dsRNA-activated protein kinase (PKR). [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2010]From UniProt:Involved in the unfolded protein response (UPR) during endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress. Acts as a negative regulator of the EIF2AK4/GCN2 kinase activity by preventing the phosphorylation of eIF-2-alpha at 'Ser-52' and hence attenuating general protein synthesis under ER stress, hypothermic and amino acid starving stress conditions (By similarity). Co-chaperone of HSPA8/HSC70, it stimulates its ATPase activity. May inhibit both the autophosphorylation of EIF2AK2/PKR and the ability of EIF2AK2 to catalyze phosphorylation of the EIF2A. May inhibit EIF2AK3/PERK activity.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码具有多个四聚体肽重复（TPR）基序的蛋白质以及在DNAJ伴侣蛋白家族成员中发现的高度保守的J结构域。它是tetratricopeptide重复蛋白质家族的成员，并作为干扰素诱导的dsRNA激活的蛋白激酶（PKR）的抑制剂。 [由RefSeq提供，2010年7月]来自UniProt：涉及内质网（ER）应激过程中的未折叠蛋白应答（UPR）。作为EIF2AK4 / GCN2激酶活性的负调节物，通过阻止'Ser-52'上的eIF-2-α的磷酸化并因此减弱ER应激，低温和氨基酸饥饿胁迫条件下的一般蛋白质合成（通过相似性）。 HSPA8 / HSC70的辅助伴侣，刺激其ATPase活性。可抑制EIF2AK2 / PKR的自磷酸化和EIF2AK2催化EIF2A磷酸化的能力。可能会抑制EIF2AK3 / PERK活性。<> <>

name: DMD
eng: DMD, the largest known human gene, provides instructions for making a protein called dystrophin. This protein is located primarily in muscles used for movement (skeletal muscles) and in heart (cardiac) muscle. Small amounts of dystrophin are present in nerve cells in the brain.In skeletal and cardiac muscles, dystrophin is part of a group of proteins (a protein complex) that work together to strengthen muscle fibers and protect them from injury as muscles contract and relax. The dystrophin complex acts as an anchor, connecting each muscle cell's structural framework (cytoskeleton) with the lattice of proteins and other molecules outside the cell (extracellular matrix). The dystrophin complex may also play a role in cell signaling by interacting with proteins that send and receive chemical signals.Little is known about the function of dystrophin in nerve cells. Research suggests that the protein is important for the normal structure and function of synapses, which are specialized connections between nerve cells where cell-to-cell communication occurs.<> <>
chi: DMD是已知最大的人类基因，提供制造肌萎缩蛋白的模板。这种蛋白质主要位于骨骼肌和心肌。大脑中的神经细胞中存在少量肌萎缩蛋白。在肌肉中，肌萎缩蛋白是一组蛋白质复合体的一部分，它们协同作用以加强肌肉纤维并在肌肉收缩和放松时保护它们免受伤害。肌萎缩蛋白复合体充当锚点，将每个肌肉细胞的细胞骨架与细胞外基质的晶格连接起来。通过与发送和接收化学信号的蛋白质相互作用，肌萎缩蛋白复合体也可以在细胞信号传导中起作用。

name: DES
eng: The DES gene provides instructions for making a protein called desmin. Desmin is found in heart (cardiac) muscle and muscles used for movement (skeletal muscle). Within muscle fibers, desmin proteins are important to help maintain the structure of sarcomeres, which are necessary for muscles to tense (contract). The desmin proteins surround rod-like structures called Z-discs that are located within the sarcomere. Desmin connects the Z-discs to one another, linking neighboring sarcomeres and forming myofibrils, the basic unit of muscle fibers. The connection of sarcomeres to each other to form myofibrils is essential for maintaining muscle fiber strength during repeated cycles of contraction and relaxation.<> <>
chi: DES基因提供了制造称为结蛋白（desmin）的蛋白质的模板。 Desmin存在于心肌和骨骼肌中。在肌纤维内，desmin蛋白质对于帮助维持肌节收缩所必需的结构非常重要。结蛋白包围位于肌小节内的称为Z-盘的棒状结构。 Desmin将Z-盘相互连接起来，连接相邻的肌节并形成肌原纤维（肌纤维的基本单位）。肌节相互连接形成肌原纤维对于在重复的收缩和松弛循环过程中保持肌肉纤维强度是必不可少的。

name: CYP27A1
eng: The CYP27A1 gene is a member of the cytochrome P450 gene family.  Enzymes produced from the cytochrome P450 genes are involved in the formation and breakdown of various molecules and chemicals within cells.  The CYP27A1 gene provides instructions for producing an enzyme called sterol 27-hydroxylase.  This enzyme is located in the energy-producing centers of cells (mitochondria), where it is involved in the pathway that breaks down cholesterol to form acids used to digest fats (bile acids).  Specifically, sterol 27-hydroxylase breaks down cholesterol to form a bile acid called chenodeoxycholic acid.  The formation of bile acids from cholesterol is the body's main pathway for cholesterol removal.  Sterol 27-hydroxylase plays a key role in maintaining normal cholesterol levels in the body.<> <>
chi: CYP27A1基因是细胞色素P450基因家族的成员。由细胞色素P450基因产生的酶参与细胞内各种分子和化学物质的形成和分解。 CYP27A1基因提供了产生称为甾醇27-羟化酶的酶的说明。这种酶位于细胞（线粒体）的能量产生中心，在那里它参与分解胆固醇以形成用于消化脂肪（胆汁酸）的酸的途径。具体而言，甾醇27-羟化酶分解胆固醇以形成称为鹅去氧胆酸的胆汁酸。胆固醇形成胆汁酸是人体去除胆固醇的主要途径。甾醇27-羟化酶在维持体内正常胆固醇水平中起关键作用

name: CYP21A2
eng: The CYP21A2 gene provides instructions for making an enzyme called 21-hydroxylase, which is part of the cytochrome P450 family of enzymes. Cytochrome P450 enzymes are involved in many processes in the body, such as assisting with reactions that break down drugs and helping to produce cholesterol, certain hormones, and fats (lipids).The 21-hydroxylase enzyme is found in the adrenal glands, which are located on top of the kidneys and produce a variety of hormones that regulate many essential functions in the body.  21-hydroxylase plays a role in producing hormones called cortisol and aldosterone.  Cortisol helps maintain blood sugar levels, protects the body from stress, and suppresses inflammation. Aldosterone is sometimes called the salt-retaining hormone because it regulates the amount of salt retained by the kidneys. The retention of salt affects fluid levels in the body and blood pressure.<> <>
chi: CYP21A2基因提供了制造称为21-羟化酶的酶的说明，其是细胞色素P450家族酶的一部分。细胞色素P450酶参与机体的许多过程，例如协助分解药物和帮助产生胆固醇，某些激素和脂肪（脂质）的反应。21-羟化酶在肾上腺中被发现，它们是位于肾脏的顶部，并产生各种激素，调节身体的许多基本功能。 21-羟化酶在产生称为皮质醇和醛固酮的激素中起作用。皮质醇有助于维持血糖水平，保护身体免受压力，并抑制炎症。醛固酮有时被称为盐分保留激素，因为它调节肾脏保留的盐量。盐的滞留影响体内液体水平和血压。“>”>

name: CYP17A1
eng: The CYP17A1 gene provides instructions for making a member of the cytochrome P450 enzyme family. Like other cytochrome P450 enzymes, CYP17A1 is involved in the formation (synthesis) of steroid hormones. This group of hormones includes sex hormones such as testosterone and estrogen, which are needed for normal sexual development and reproduction; mineralocorticoids, which help regulate the body's salt and water balance; and glucocorticoids, which are involved in maintaining blood sugar levels and regulating the body's response to stress.Steroid hormones are synthesized through a series of chemical reactions. The CYP17A1 enzyme performs two important reactions in this process. The enzyme has 17 alpha(α)-hydroxylase activity, converting pregnenalone  to 17-hydroxypregnenolone and progesterone to 17-hydroxyprogesterone. These hormone precursors are further processed to produce glucocorticoids and sex hormones. CYP17A1 also has 17,20-lyase activity, which converts 17-hydroxypregnenolone to dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA). This reaction is integral to the production of sex hormones.<> <>
chi: CYP17A1基因提供了制造细胞色素P450酶家族成员的说明。像其他细胞色素P450酶一样，CYP17A1参与类固醇激素的形成（合成）。这组激素包括睾酮和雌激素等性激素，正常性发育和生殖所需要的;盐皮质激素，帮助调节人体的盐和水平衡;和糖皮质激素，它们参与维持血糖水平和调节机体对压力的反应。类固醇激素通过一系列化学反应合成。 CYP17A1酶在这个过程中执行两个重要的反应。该酶具有17α（α） - 羟化酶活性，将孕烯酮转化为17-羟孕烯醇酮和孕酮转化为17-羟孕酮。这些激素前体进一步加工产生糖皮质激素和性激素。 CYP17A1还具有17,20-裂合酶活性，其将17-羟基孕烯醇酮转化为脱氢表雄酮（DHEA）。这种反应对于性激素的产生是不可或缺的。<> <>

name: CYP11B2
eng: The CYP11B2 gene provides instructions for making an enzyme called aldosterone synthase (previously known as corticosterone methyloxidase). This enzyme is found in the adrenal glands, which are located on top of the kidneys. Aldosterone synthase is a member of the cytochrome P450 family of enzymes. These enzymes are involved in the formation and breakdown of various molecules within cells.Aldosterone synthase helps produce a hormone called aldosterone. Aldosterone helps control blood pressure by maintaining proper salt and fluid levels in the body. The aldosterone synthase enzyme is involved in a series of three chemical reactions that produce aldosterone from other (precursor) molecules: the conversion of 11-deoxycorticosterone to corticosterone, the conversion of corticosterone to 18-hydroxycorticosterone, and the conversion of 18-hydroxycorticosterone to aldosterone.<> <>
chi: CYP11B2基因提供了制造称为醛固酮合酶（以前称为皮质酮甲基氧化酶）的酶的说明。这种酶被发现在位于肾脏顶部的肾上腺。醛固酮合酶是细胞色素P450家族酶的成员。这些酶参与细胞内各种分子的形成和分解。醛固酮合成酶有助于产生称为醛固酮的激素。醛固酮通过保持体内适当的盐和液体水平来帮助控制血压。醛固酮合酶参与一系列三种化学反应，从其他（前体）分子产生醛固酮：将11-脱氧皮质酮转化成皮质酮，将皮质酮转化为18-羟皮质酮，并将18-羟皮质酮转化为醛固酮。<> <>

name: CYP11B1
eng: The CYP11B1 gene provides instructions for making an enzyme called 11-beta-hydroxylase. This enzyme is found in the adrenal glands, which are located on top of the kidneys. The 11-beta-hydroxylase enzyme is a member of the cytochrome P450 family of enzymes. These enzymes are involved in the formation and breakdown of various molecules within cells.The 11-beta-hydroxylase enzyme helps produce hormones called cortisol and corticosterone. Specifically, the enzyme helps convert a molecule called 11-deoxycortisol to cortisol, and helps convert another molecule called 11-deoxycorticosterone to corticosterone. These processes are triggered by the release of a hormone called adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) by the pituitary gland, located at the base of the brain.Cortisol helps maintain blood sugar levels, protects the body from physical stress, and suppresses inflammation. Corticosterone is converted to the hormone aldosterone by the aldosterone synthase enzyme, which is produced from the nearby CYP11B2 gene. Aldosterone helps control blood pressure by maintaining proper salt and fluid levels in the body.<> <>
chi: CYP11B1基因提供了制造称为11-β-羟化酶的酶的说明。这种酶被发现在位于肾脏顶部的肾上腺。 11-β-羟化酶是细胞色素P450家族酶的成员。这些酶参与细胞内各种分子的形成和分解。11-β-羟化酶有助于产生称为皮质醇和皮质酮的激素。具体而言，该酶有助于将称为11-脱氧皮质醇的分子转化为皮质醇，并帮助将另一种称为11-脱氧皮质酮的分子转化为皮质酮。这些过程是由位于大脑底部的脑垂体释放一种叫做促肾上腺皮质激素（ACTH）的激素引起的。皮质醇有助于维持血糖水平，保护身体免受身体压力，并抑制炎症。皮质酮通过由附近CYP11B2基因产生的醛固酮合成酶转化为激素醛固酮。醛固酮通过保持体内适当的盐和液体水平来帮助控制血压。<> <>

name: CUL3
eng: The CUL3 gene provides instructions for making a protein called cullin-3. This protein plays a role in the cell machinery that breaks down (degrades) unwanted proteins, called the ubiquitin-proteasome system.Cullin-3 is a core piece of a complex known as an E3 ubiquitin ligase. E3 ubiquitin ligases function as part of the ubiquitin-proteasome system by tagging damaged and excess proteins with molecules called ubiquitin. Ubiquitin serves as a signal to specialized cell structures known as proteasomes, which attach (bind) to the tagged proteins and degrade them. The ubiquitin-proteasome system acts as the cell's quality control system by disposing of damaged, misshapen, and excess proteins. This system also regulates the level of proteins involved in several critical cell activities such as the timing of cell division and growth.E3 ubiquitin ligases containing the cullin-3 protein tag proteins called WNK1 and WNK4 with ubiquitin. These proteins are involved in controlling blood pressure in the body. By regulating the amount of WNK1 and WNK4 available, cullin-3 plays a role in blood pressure control.<> <>
chi: CUL3基因提供了制作蛋白质cullin-3的说明。这种蛋白质在分解（降解）不需要的蛋白质的细胞机制中发挥作用，称为泛素 - 蛋白酶体系统.Cullin-3是被称为E3泛素连接酶的复合物的核心片段。 E3泛素连接酶通过用被称为遍在蛋白的分子标记受损和过量的蛋白质而作为泛素 - 蛋白酶体系统的一部分起作用。泛素作为信号传递给专门的细胞结构，称为蛋白酶体，它与标记的蛋白质连接（结合）并降解它们。泛素 - 蛋白酶体系统通过处理受损，畸形和过量蛋白质，起细胞质量控制系统的作用。该系统还调节涉及几种关键细胞活性的蛋白质水平，例如细胞分裂和生长的时间。包含cullin-3蛋白标签蛋白的E3泛素连接酶称为WNK1和WNK4与泛素。这些蛋白质参与控制人体内的血压。通过调节可用的WNK1和WNK4的量，cullin-3在血压控制中起作用。<> <>

name: CTNNA3
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a protein that belongs to the vinculin/alpha-catenin family. The encoded protein plays a role in cell-cell adhesion in muscle cells. Mutations in this gene are associated with arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial 13. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2014]From UniProt:May be involved in formation of stretch-resistant cell-cell adhesion complexes.<> <>
chi: 该基因编码的蛋白属于纽蛋白/α-连环蛋白家族。该蛋白质在肌细胞中的细胞-细胞粘附中起作用。该基因突变与致心律失常性右心室发育不良13型相关。选择性剪接导致多种转录本变异。

name: CTLA4
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene is a member of the immunoglobulin superfamily and encodes a protein which transmits an inhibitory signal to T cells. The protein contains a V domain, a transmembrane domain, and a cytoplasmic tail. Alternate transcriptional splice variants, encoding different isoforms, have been characterized. The membrane-bound isoform functions as a homodimer interconnected by a disulfide bond, while the soluble isoform functions as a monomer. Mutations in this gene have been associated with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus, Graves disease, Hashimoto thyroiditis, celiac disease, systemic lupus erythematosus, thyroid-associated orbitopathy, and other autoimmune diseases. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Inhibitory receptor acting as a major negative regulator of T-cell responses. The affinity of CTLA4 for its natural B7 family ligands, CD80 and CD86, is considerably stronger than the affinity of their cognate stimulatory coreceptor CD28.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因是免疫球蛋白超家族的成员，并编码向T细胞传递抑制信号的蛋白质。该蛋白含有V结构域，跨膜结构域和细胞质尾部。已经表征了编码不同同种型的备选转录剪接变体。膜结合同种型作为通过二硫键相互连接的同型二聚体起作用，而可溶性同种型作为单体起作用。该基因的突变与胰岛素依赖性糖尿病，格雷夫斯病，桥本甲状腺炎，乳糜泻，系统性红斑狼疮，甲状腺相关眼病和其他自身免疫性疾病有关。 [由RefSeq，2008年7月提供]来自UniProt：作为T细胞应答的主要负调节剂的抑制性受体。 CTLA4对其天然B7家族配体CD80和CD86的亲和力比其同源刺激性共同受体CD28的亲和力强得多。<> <>

name: CSRP3
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a member of the CSRP family of LIM domain proteins, which may be involved in regulatory processes important for development and cellular differentiation. The LIM/double zinc-finger motif found in this protein is found in a group of proteins with critical functions in gene regulation, cell growth, and somatic differentiation. Mutations in this gene are thought to cause heritable forms of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) in humans. Alternatively spliced transcript variants with different 5' UTR, but encoding the same protein, have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Positive regulator of myogenesis. Acts as cofactor for myogenic bHLH transcription factors such as MYOD1, and probably MYOG and MYF6. Enhances the DNA-binding activity of the MYOD1:TCF3 isoform E47 complex and may promote formation of a functional MYOD1:TCF3 isoform E47:MEF2A complex involved in myogenesis (By similarity). Plays a crucial and specific role in the organization of cytosolic structures in cardiomyocytes. Could play a role in mechanical stretch sensing. May be a scaffold protein that promotes the assembly of interacting proteins at Z-line structures. It is essential for calcineurin anchorage to the Z line. Required for stress-induced calcineurin-NFAT activation (By similarity). The role in regulation of cytoskeleton dynamics by association with CFL2 is reported conflictingly: Shown to enhance CFL2-mediated F-actin depolymerization dependent on the CSRP3:CFL2 molecular ratio, and also shown to reduce the ability of CLF1 and CFL2 to enhance actin depolymerization (PubMed:19752190, PubMed:24934443). Proposed to contribute to the maintenance of muscle cell integerity through an actin-based mechanism. Can directly bind to actin filaments, cross-link actin filaments into bundles without polarity selectivity and protect them from dilution- and cofilin-mediated depolymerization; the function seems to involve its self-association (PubMed:24934443). In vitro can inhibit PKC/PRKCA activity (PubMed:27353086). Proposed to be involved in cardiac stress signaling by down-regulating excessive PKC/PRKCA signaling.Isoform 2: May play a role in early sarcomere organization. Overexpression in myotubes negatively regulates myotube differentiation. By association with isoform 1 and thus changing the CSRP3 isoform 1:CFL2 stoichiometry is proposed to down-regulate CFL2-mediated F-actin depolymerization.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码LIM结构域蛋白的CSRP家族的成员，其可能参与对于发育和细胞分化重要的调节过程。在这种蛋白质中发现的LIM /双锌指基序存在于一组具有基因调控，细胞生长和体细胞分化中的关键功能的蛋白质中。认为该基因中的突变导致人类可遗传的肥厚型心肌病（HCM）和扩张型心肌病（DCM）。已经发现具有不同5'UTR但编码相同蛋白质的剪接转录物变体用于该基因。 [由RefSeq提供，2008年7月]来自UniProt：肌肉发生的正调控因子。充当肌源性bHLH转录因子如MYOD1的辅助因子，可能是MYOG和MYF6。增强MYOD1：TCF3亚型E47复合物的DNA结合活性，并可能促进参与肌生成的功能性MYOD1：TCF3亚型E47：MEF2A复合物的形成（通过相似性）。在组织心肌细胞中的胞质结构中发挥重要和特定的作用。可以在机械拉伸感测中发挥作用。可能是一种支架蛋白，促进Z线结构中相互作用蛋白的组装。钙调磷酸酶锚定在Z线上是必不可少的。对应激诱导的钙调磷酸酶-NFAT活化所需（通过相似性）。通过与CFL2相关的调节细胞骨架动力学的作用有矛盾地报道：显示出增强依赖于CSRP3：CFL2分子比的CFL2介导的F-肌动蛋白解聚，并且还显示出降低CLF1和CFL2增强肌动蛋白解聚的能力（ PubMed：19752190，PubMed：24934443）。建议通过基于肌动蛋白的机制来维持肌肉细胞的整体性。可以直接结合肌动蛋白丝，交联肌动蛋白丝成束没有极性选择性，并保护他们免受稀释和cofilin介导的解聚;该功能似乎涉及其自我关联（PubMed：24934443）。体外可抑制PKC / PRKCA活性（PubMed：27353086）。建议通过下调过度的PKC / PRKCA信号参与心脏压力信号传导。Isoform 2：可能在早期肌节组织中发挥作用。肌管中的过度表达负调节肌管分化。通过与亚型1缔合并由此改变CSRP3同种型1：CFL2化学计量来提出下调CFL2介导的F-肌动蛋白解聚。<> <>

name: CPS1
eng: The CPS1 gene provides instructions for making the enzyme carbamoyl phosphate synthetase I. This enzyme participates in the urea cycle, a series of reactions that occurs in liver cells. The urea cycle processes excess nitrogen, generated when protein is used by the body, into a compound called urea that is excreted by the kidneys. Excreting the excess nitrogen prevents it from accumulating in the form of ammonia, which is toxic.The specific role of carbamoyl phosphate synthetase I is to control the first step of the urea cycle, a reaction in which excess nitrogen compounds are incorporated into the cycle to be processed.<> <>
chi: CPS1基因提供了制备氨甲酰磷酸合成酶I的说明。该酶参与尿素循环，这是一系列在肝细胞中发生的反应。尿素循环将体内使用蛋白质时产生的过量氮转化为由肾脏排出的称为尿素的化合物。排出过量的氮可防止其以有毒的氨的形式积累。氨甲酰磷酸合成酶I的特定作用是控制尿素循环的第一步，在该循环中过量的氮化合物被并入循环至被处理。<> <>

name: CRYAB
eng: From NCBI Gene:Mammalian lens crystallins are divided into alpha, beta, and gamma families. Alpha crystallins are composed of two gene products: alpha-A and alpha-B, for acidic and basic, respectively. Alpha crystallins can be induced by heat shock and are members of the small heat shock protein (HSP20) family. They act as molecular chaperones although they do not renature proteins and release them in the fashion of a true chaperone; instead they hold them in large soluble aggregates. Post-translational modifications decrease the ability to chaperone. These heterogeneous aggregates consist of 30-40 subunits; the alpha-A and alpha-B subunits have a 3:1 ratio, respectively. Two additional functions of alpha crystallins are an autokinase activity and participation in the intracellular architecture. The encoded protein has been identified as a moonlighting protein based on its ability to perform mechanistically distinct functions. Alpha-A and alpha-B gene products are differentially expressed; alpha-A is preferentially restricted to the lens and alpha-B is expressed widely in many tissues and organs. Elevated expression of alpha-B crystallin occurs in many neurological diseases; a missense mutation cosegregated in a family with a desmin-related myopathy. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2014]From UniProt:May contribute to the transparency and refractive index of the lens. Has chaperone-like activity, preventing aggregation of various proteins under a wide range of stress conditions.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：哺乳动物晶状体晶状体分为α，β和γ家族。 α-晶体蛋白由两种基因产物组成：分别为酸性和碱性的α-A和α-B。 α-晶体蛋白可以通过热休克诱导并且是小热休克蛋白（HSP20）家族的成员。它们作为分子伴侣，虽然它们不会复制蛋白质并以真正的伴侣的方式释放它们;相反，他们把它们放在大量可溶性聚集体中。翻译后修饰降低伴侣蛋白的能力。这些非均质聚集体由30-40个亚基组成; α-A和α-B亚基分别具有3：1的比例。 α晶体蛋白的另外两个功能是自激酶活性和参与细胞内结构。编码的蛋白质已经被鉴定为基于其执行机制不同功能的能力的月光蛋白质。 α-A和α-B基因产物是差异表达的; α-A优先限制于晶状体，并且α-B在许多组织和器官中广泛表达。在许多神经疾病中发生α-B晶体蛋白的升高表达;在与desmin相关的肌病家族中共同错义突变。选择性剪接产生多种转录本变体。 [由RefSeq，2014年1月提供]来自UniProt：可能有助于透镜的透明度和折射率。具有分子伴侣样活性，可以在各种压力条件下防止各种蛋白质的聚集。<> <>

name: CLCNKB
eng: The CLCNKB gene belongs to the CLC family of genes, which provide instructions for making chloride channels. These channels, which transport negatively charged chlorine atoms (chloride ions), play a key role in a cell's ability to generate and transmit electrical signals. Some CLC channels regulate the flow of chloride ions across cell membranes, while others transport chloride ions within cells.The CLCNKB gene provides instructions for making a chloride channel called ClC-Kb. These channels are found predominantly in the kidneys. ClC-Kb is one of several proteins that work together to regulate the movement of ions into and out of kidney cells. The transport of chloride ions by ClC-Kb channels is part of the mechanism by which the kidneys reabsorb salt (sodium chloride or NaCl) from the urine back into the bloodstream. The retention of salt affects the body's fluid levels and helps maintain blood pressure.ClC-Kb channels are also located in the inner ear, where they play a role in normal hearing.<> <>
chi: CLCNKB基因属于CLC基因家族，提供制造氯化物通道的指导。这些传输负电荷氯原子（氯离子）的通道在细胞产生和传输电信号的能力中起着关键作用。一些CLC通道调节氯离子穿过细胞膜的流动，而另一些CLC通道则在细胞内转运氯离子.CLCNKB基因提供了制造称为ClC-Kb的氯通道的说明。这些通道主要在肾脏中找到。 ClC-Kb是协同工作来调节离子进出肾​​细胞运动的几种蛋白之一。 ClC-Kb通道对氯离子的转运是肾脏从尿液中重新吸收盐分（氯化钠或氯化钠）到血液中的机制的一部分。盐的滞留影响人体的液体水平，并有助于维持血压.ClC-Kb通道也位于内耳，在正常听力中它们起作用。<> <>

name: CITED2
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene inhibits transactivation of HIF1A-induced genes by competing with binding of hypoxia-inducible factor 1-alpha to p300-CH1. Mutations in this gene are a cause of cardiac septal defects. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding multiple isoforms have been observed for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, May 2012]From UniProt:Transcriptional coactivator of the p300/CBP-mediated transcription complex. Acts as a bridge, linking TFAP2 transcription factors and the p300/CBP transcriptional coactivator complex in order to stimulate TFAP2-mediated transcriptional activation. Positively regulates TGF-beta signaling through its association with the SMAD/p300/CBP-mediated transcriptional coactivator complex. Stimulates the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptors PPARA transcriptional activity. Enhances estrogen-dependent transactivation mediated by estrogen receptors. Acts also as a transcriptional corepressor; interferes with the binding of the transcription factors HIF1A or STAT2 and the p300/CBP transcriptional coactivator complex. Participates in sex determination and early gonad development by stimulating transcription activation of SRY. Plays a role in controlling left-right patterning during embryogenesis; potentiates transcriptional activation of NODAL-mediated gene transcription in the left lateral plate mesoderm (LPM). Plays an essential role in differentiation of the adrenal cortex from the adrenogonadal primordium (AGP); stimulates WT1-mediated transcription activation thereby up-regulating the nuclear hormone receptor NR5A1 promoter activity. Associates with chromatin to the PITX2 P1 promoter region.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质通过与低氧诱导因子1-α与p300-CH1的结合竞争来抑制HIF1A诱导的基因的反式激活。该基因突变是心脏中隔缺陷的原因。已经观察到该基因的编码多种同种型的剪接转录物变体。 [由RefSeq，2012年5月提供]来自UniProt：p300 / CBP介导的转录复合物的转录共激活剂。作为桥梁，连接TFAP2转录因子和p300 / CBP转录共激活因子复合物，以刺激TFAP2介导的转录激活。通过与SMAD / p300 / CBP介导的转录共激活剂复合物的结合，积极调节TGF-β信号传导。刺激过氧化物酶体增殖物激活受体PPARA转录活性。增强雌激素受体介导的雌激素依赖性反式激活作用。也作为转录共抑制剂行事;干扰转录因子HIF1A或STAT2与p300 / CBP转录共激活剂复合物的结合。通过刺激SRY的转录激活参与性别决定和早期生殖腺发育。在胚胎发生过程中控制左右模式的作用;增强左外侧板中胚层（LPM）中NODAL介导的基因转录的转录激活。在从肾上腺胚原基（AGP）分化肾上腺皮质中发挥重要作用;刺激WT1介导的转录激活，从而上调核激素受体NR5A1启动子活性。与染色质结合到PITX2 P1启动子区域。<> <>

name: CLCNKA
eng: The CLCNKA gene belongs to the CLC family of genes, which provide instructions for making chloride channels. These channels, which transport negatively charged chlorine atoms (chloride ions), play a key role in a cell's ability to generate and transmit electrical signals. Some CLC channels regulate the flow of chloride ions across cell membranes, while others transport chloride ions within cells.The CLCNKA gene provides instructions for making a chloride channel called ClC-Ka. These channels are found predominantly in the kidneys. ClC-Ka is one of several proteins that work together to regulate the movement of ions into and out of kidney cells. The transport of chloride ions by ClC-Ka channels is part of the mechanism by which the kidneys reabsorb salt (sodium chloride or NaCl) from the urine back into the bloodstream. The retention of salt affects the body's fluid levels and helps maintain blood pressure.ClC-Ka channels are also located in the inner ear, where they play a role in normal hearing.<> <>
chi: CLCNKA基因属于CLC家族基因，提供制造氯化物通道的说明。这些传输负电荷氯原子（氯离子）的通道在细胞产生和传输电信号的能力中起着关键作用。一些CLC通道调节氯离子通过细胞膜的流动，而另一些CLC通道则在细胞内转运氯离子.CLCNKA基因提供了制造称为ClC-Ka的氯通道的说明。这些通道主要在肾脏中找到。 ClC-Ka是几种蛋白质之一，它们共同作用以调节离子进出肾​​细胞的运动。通过ClC-Ka通道转运氯离子是肾脏从尿液中重吸收盐（氯化钠或氯化钠）回到血液中的机制的一部分。盐的滞留影响人体的液体水平并有助于维持血压.CCl-Ka通道也位于内耳，在正常听力中它们起着作用。<> <>

name: CEP290
eng: The CEP290 gene provides instructions for making a protein that is present in many types of cells. Although this protein's function is not well understood, studies suggest that it plays an important role in cell structures called centrosomes and cilia. Centrosomes are involved in cell division and the assembly of microtubules, which are proteins that transport materials in cells and help the cell maintain its shape. Cilia are microscopic, finger-like projections that stick out from the surface of cells. Cilia are involved in cell movement and many different chemical signaling pathways. They are also necessary for the perception of sensory input (such as vision, hearing, and smell).<> <>
chi: CEP290基因提供了制造存在于许多类型的细胞中的蛋白质的说明。虽然这种蛋白质的功能尚未得到很好的理解，但研究表明它在称为中心体和纤毛的细胞结构中起着重要作用。中心体参与细胞分裂和微管的组装，微管是在细胞中运输材料并帮助细胞保持其形状的蛋白质。纤毛是从细胞表面伸出的微观指状突起。纤毛参与细胞运动和许多不同的化学信号传导途径。它们对感觉输入（如视觉，听觉和嗅觉）的感知也是必需的。<> <>

name: COL3A1
eng: The COL3A1 gene provides instructions for making type III collagen. Collagens are a family of proteins that strengthen and support many tissues in the body. Type III collagen is found in the skin, lungs, intestinal walls, and the walls of blood vessels.The components of type III collagen, called pro-α1(III) chains, are produced from the COL3A1 gene. Each molecule of type III procollagen is made up of three copies of this chain.The triple-stranded, rope-like procollagen molecules are processed by enzymes outside the cell to create mature type III collagen. The collagen molecules then arrange themselves into long, thin fibrils that form stable interactions (cross-links) with one another and with other types of collagen in the spaces between cells. The cross-links result in the formation of very strong collagen fibers.<> <>
chi: COL3A1基因提供制造III型胶原蛋白的说明。胶原蛋白是增强和支持身体中许多组织的蛋白质家族。 III型胶原蛋白存在于皮肤，肺，肠壁和血管壁中.III型胶原蛋白的成分称为pro-α1（III）链，由COL3A1基因产生。每种III型前胶原分子都由三条链组成。三链，绳状原胶原分子通过细胞外的酶加工成为成熟的III型胶原蛋白。然后胶原蛋白分子排列成长而薄的原纤维，彼此之间形成稳定的相互作用（交联），并与细胞间空间中的其他类型的胶原蛋白形成稳定的相互作用（交联）。交联导致形成非常强的胶原纤维。<> <>

name: CETP
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is found in plasma, where it is involved in the transfer of cholesteryl ester from high density lipoprotein (HDL) to other lipoproteins. Defects in this gene are a cause of hyperalphalipoproteinemia 1 (HALP1). Two transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2013]From UniProt:Involved in the transfer of neutral lipids, including cholesteryl ester and triglyceride, among lipoprotein particles. Allows the net movement of cholesteryl ester from high density lipoproteins/HDL to triglyceride-rich very low density lipoproteins/VLDL, and the equimolar transport of triglyceride from VLDL to HDL (PubMed:3600759, PubMed:24293641). Regulates the reverse cholesterol transport, by which excess cholesterol is removed from peripheral tissues and returned to the liver for elimination (PubMed:17237796).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质在血浆中发现，其涉及将胆固醇酯从高密度脂蛋白（HDL）转移至其他脂蛋白。该基因中的缺陷是过度磷脂蛋白血症1（HALP1）的原因。已经发现编码不同同种型的两种转录物变体用于该基因。 [由RefSeq，2013年10月提供]来自UniProt：涉及脂蛋白颗粒中的中性脂质（包括胆固醇酯和甘油三酯）的转移。允许胆固醇酯从高密度脂蛋白/ HDL到富含甘油三酯的极低密度脂蛋白/ VLDL的净移动，以及甘油三酯从VLDL到HDL的等摩尔转运（PubMed：3600759，PubMed：24293641）。调节反向胆固醇转运，通过这种转运，多余的胆固醇从外周组织中除去并返回肝脏进行消除（PubMed：17237796）。<> <>

name: CDKN1B
eng: The CDKN1B gene provides instructions for making a protein called p27. This protein is found in cells and tissues throughout the body. Within cells, p27 is located primarily in the nucleus, where it plays a critical role in controlling cell growth and division. It helps regulate the cell cycle, which is the cell's way of replicating itself in an organized, step-by-step fashion. Specifically, p27 normally blocks cells from entering the phase of the cell cycle when DNA is copied (replicated) in preparation for cell division. By blocking cell cycle progression, p27 prevents cells from dividing too quickly or at the wrong time. Based on this function, p27 is described as a tumor suppressor protein. Studies suggest that p27 is also involved in controlling cell differentiation, which is the process by which cells mature to carry out specific functions.Because p27 plays such a key role in controlling cell division, its activity is tightly regulated. Regulation can occur through modification of the p27 protein's structure, its interaction with other proteins, or its localization within the cell. For example, when p27 is held (sequestered) in the fluid that surrounds the nucleus (the cytoplasm) instead of being transported into the nucleus, the protein is unavailable to block cell cycle progression. Researchers believe that p27 may have other functions in the cytoplasm, but these functions have not been well described.<> <>
chi: CDKN1B基因提供了制作蛋白质p27的说明。这种蛋白质存在于整个身体的细胞和组织中。在细胞内，p27主要位于细胞核内，它在控制细胞生长和分裂方面发挥着关键作用。它有助于调节细胞周期，这是细胞以有组织，循序渐进的方式复制自身的方式。具体而言，当DNA被复制（复制）以准备细胞分裂时，p27通常阻止细胞进入细胞周期的阶段。通过阻断细胞周期进程，p27阻止细胞分裂得太快或在错误的时间。基于此功能，p27被描述为肿瘤抑制蛋白。研究表明p27还参与调控细胞分化，这是细胞成熟发挥特定功能的过程。由于p27在控制细胞分裂中起着关键作用，其活性受到严格调控。调节可以通过修饰p27蛋白质的结构，与其他蛋白质的相互作用或其在细胞内的定位发生。例如，当p27在围绕细胞核（细胞质）的液体中被保持（隔离）而不是被运输到细胞核中时，蛋白质不能阻断细胞周期进展。研究人员认为p27可能在细胞质中具有其他功能，但这些功能尚未得到很好的描述。<> <>

name: CEL
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is a glycoprotein secreted from the pancreas into the digestive tract and from the lactating mammary gland into human milk. The physiological role of this protein is in cholesterol and lipid-soluble vitamin ester hydrolysis and absorption. This encoded protein promotes large chylomicron production in the intestine. Also its presence in plasma suggests its interactions with cholesterol and oxidized lipoproteins to modulate the progression of atherosclerosis. In pancreatic tumoral cells, this encoded protein is thought to be sequestrated within the Golgi compartment and is probably not secreted. This gene contains a variable number of tandem repeat (VNTR) polymorphism in the coding region that may influence the function of the encoded protein. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008] <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质是从胰腺分泌进入消化道和从哺乳期乳腺分泌到人乳中的糖蛋白。这种蛋白质的生理作用是在胆固醇和脂溶性维生素酯的水解和吸收中。这种编码的蛋白质促进肠中的大乳糜微粒生成。它在血浆中的存在提示它与胆固醇和氧化脂蛋白的相互作用来调节动脉粥样硬化的进展。在胰腺肿瘤细胞中，这种编码的蛋白质被认为是在高尔基体内隔离并且可能不分泌。该基因在编码区含有可变数目的串联重复（VNTR）多态性，其可能影响编码蛋白质的功能。 [RefSeq，2008年7月提供] <>

name: CDC73
eng: The CDC73 gene (also known as HRPT2) provides instructions for making a protein called parafibromin. This protein is found primarily in the nucleus of cells and is likely involved in regulating gene transcription, which is the first step in protein production. Parafibromin functions as a tumor suppressor, which means it keeps cells from growing and dividing (proliferating) too rapidly or in an uncontrolled way. When parafibromin is found outside the nucleus, it appears to be involved in the organization of the cell's structural framework (the cytoskeleton).<> <>
chi: CDC73基因（也称为HRPT2）提供了制造称为parafibromin的蛋白质的说明。这种蛋白质主要存在于细胞核中，可能参与调节基因转录，这是蛋白质生产的第一步。 Parafibromin具有肿瘤抑制剂的功能，这意味着它可以防止细胞生长和分裂（增殖）过快或不受控制的方式。当parafibromin在细胞核外发现时，似乎参与细胞结构框架（细胞骨架）的组织。<> <>

name: CIDEC
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a member of the cell death-inducing DNA fragmentation factor-like effector family. Members of this family play important roles in apoptosis. The encoded protein promotes lipid droplet formation in adipocytes and may mediate adipocyte apoptosis. This gene is regulated by insulin and its expression is positively correlated with insulin sensitivity. Mutations in this gene may contribute to insulin resistant diabetes. A pseudogene of this gene is located on the short arm of chromosome 3. Alternatively spliced transcript variants that encode different isoforms have been observed for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Dec 2010]From UniProt:Binds to lipid droplets and regulates their enlargement, thereby restricting lipolysis and favoring storage. At focal contact sites between lipid droplets, promotes directional net neutral lipid transfer from the smaller to larger lipid droplets. The transfer direction may be driven by the internal pressure difference between the contacting lipid droplet pair. Its role in neutral lipid transfer and lipid droplet enlargement is activated by the interaction with PLIN1. May act as a CEBPB coactivator in the white adipose tissue to control the expression of a subset of CEBPB downstream target genes, including SOCS1, SOCS3, TGFB1, TGFBR1, ID2 and XDH. When overexpressed in preadipocytes, induces apoptosis or increases cell susceptibility to apoptosis induced by serum deprivation or TGFB treatment. As mature adipocytes, that express high CIDEC levels, are quite resistant to apoptotic stimuli, the physiological significance of its role in apoptosis is unclear. May play a role in the modulation of the response to osmotic stress by preventing NFAT5 to translocate into the nucleus and activate its target genes expression.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码细胞死亡诱导DNA片段化因子样效应物家族的成员。这个家族的成员在细胞凋亡中发挥重要作用。编码的蛋白质促进脂肪细胞中的脂滴形成并可以介导脂肪细胞凋亡。该基因受胰岛素调节，其表达与胰岛素敏感性呈正相关。该基因突变可能导致胰岛素抵抗性糖尿病。该基因的假基因位于染色体3的短臂上。已经观察到编码不同同种型的剪接转录物变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2010年12月]来自UniProt：与脂滴结合并调节它们的扩大，从而限制脂肪分解并有利于储存。在脂滴之间的焦点接触位点处，促进从较小到较大的脂滴的定向净中性脂质转移。传输方向可以由接触的脂滴对之间的内部压力差驱动。其在中性脂质转移和脂滴增大中的作用通过与PLIN1的相互作用而被激活。可以充当在白色脂肪组织中CEBPB共活化剂，以控制CEBPB下游靶基因，包括SOCS1，SOCS3，TGFB1，TGFBR1，ID2和XDH的一个子集的表达。当在前脂肪细胞中过表达时，诱导凋亡或增加细胞对由血清剥夺或TGFB处理诱导的细胞凋亡的易感性。由于表达高CIDEC水平的成熟脂肪细胞对凋亡刺激具有很强的抗性，其在凋亡中作用的生理学意义尚不清楚。可能通过阻止NFAT5转位进入核并激活其靶基因表达而在调节对渗透压的响应中起作用。<> <>

name: CCDC28B
eng: From NCBI Gene:The product of this gene localizes to centrosomes and basal bodies. The protein colocalizes with several proteins associated with Bardet-Biedl syndrome (BBS) and participates in the regulation of cilia development. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2014]From UniProt:Involved in ciliogenesis. Regulates cilia length through its interaction with MAPKAP1/SIN1 but independently of mTORC2 complex. Modulates mTORC2 complex assembly and function, possibly enhances AKT1 phosphorylation. Does not seem to modulate assembly and function of mTORC1 complex.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因的产物定位于中心体和基底体。该蛋白质与几种与Bardet-Biedl综合征（BBS）相关的蛋白质共同定位并参与纤毛发育的调节。选择性剪接产生多种转录本变体。 [由RefSeq，2014年7月提供]来自UniProt：参与纤毛发生。通过与MAPKAP1 / SIN1的相互作用来调节纤毛长度，但与mTORC2复合物无关。调节mTORC2复杂的装配和功能，可能增强AKT1磷酸化。似乎没有调节mTORC1复合体的装配和功能。<> <>

name: CCR5
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a member of the beta chemokine receptor family, which is predicted to be a seven transmembrane protein similar to G protein-coupled receptors. This protein is expressed by T cells and macrophages, and is known to be an important co-receptor for macrophage-tropic virus, including HIV, to enter host cells. Defective alleles of this gene have been associated with the HIV infection resistance. The ligands of this receptor include monocyte chemoattractant protein 2 (MCP-2), macrophage inflammatory protein 1 alpha (MIP-1 alpha), macrophage inflammatory protein 1 beta (MIP-1 beta) and regulated on activation normal T expressed and secreted protein (RANTES). Expression of this gene was also detected in a promyeloblastic cell line, suggesting that this protein may play a role in granulocyte lineage proliferation and differentiation. This gene is located at the chemokine receptor gene cluster region. An allelic polymorphism in this gene results in both functional and non-functional alleles; the reference genome represents the functional allele. Two transcript variants encoding the same protein have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2015]From UniProt:Receptor for a number of inflammatory CC-chemokines including MIP-1-alpha, MIP-1-beta and RANTES and subsequently transduces a signal by increasing the intracellular calcium ion level. May play a role in the control of granulocytic lineage proliferation or differentiation. Acts as a coreceptor (CD4 being the primary receptor) for HIV-1 R5 isolates.(Microbial infection) Acts as a receptor for human immunodeficiency virus-1/HIV-1.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码β趋化因子受体家族的成员，预测其为与G蛋白偶联受体相似的七跨膜蛋白。该蛋白由T细胞和巨噬细胞表达，并且已知是包括HIV在内的巨噬细胞嗜性病毒的重要辅助受体，以进入宿主细胞。该基因的有缺陷的等位基因与HIV感染抗性有关。该受体的配体包括单核细胞趋化蛋白2（MCP-2），巨噬细胞炎症蛋白1α（MIP-1α），巨噬细胞炎症蛋白1β（MIP-1β），并调节激活正常T表达和分泌蛋白RANTES）。该基因的表达也在早幼粒细胞系中检测到，表明该蛋白可能在粒细胞谱系增殖和分化中起作用。该基因位于趋化因子受体基因簇区域。该基因中的等位基因多态性导致功能性和非功能性等位基因;参考基因组代表功能性等位基因。已经发现编码相同蛋白质的两种转录物变体用于该基因。 [由RefSeq，2015年7月提供]来自UniProt：包括MIP-1-α，MIP-1-β和RANTES在内的许多炎症性CC-趋化因子的受体，随后通过增加细胞内钙离子水平来转导信号。可能在控制粒细胞谱系增殖或分化方面发挥作用。作为HIV-1 R5分离物的辅助受体（CD4是主要受体）的作用（微生物感染）作为人类免疫缺陷病毒-1 / HIV-1的受体起作用。<> <>

name: CBL
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene is a proto-oncogene that encodes a RING finger E3 ubiquitin ligase. The encoded protein is one of the enzymes required for targeting substrates for degradation by the proteasome. This protein mediates the transfer of ubiquitin from ubiquitin conjugating enzymes (E2) to specific substrates. This protein also contains an N-terminal phosphotyrosine binding domain that allows it to interact with numerous tyrosine-phosphorylated substrates and target them for proteasome degradation. As such it functions as a negative regulator of many signal transduction pathways. This gene has been found to be mutated or translocated in many cancers including acute myeloid leukaemia, and expansion of CGG repeats in the 5' UTR has been associated with Jacobsen syndrome. Mutations in this gene are also the cause of Noonan syndrome-like disorder. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2016]From UniProt:Adapter protein that functions as a negative regulator of many signaling pathways that are triggered by activation of cell surface receptors. Acts as an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase, which accepts ubiquitin from specific E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzymes, and then transfers it to substrates promoting their degradation by the proteasome. Recognizes activated receptor tyrosine kinases, including KIT, FLT1, FGFR1, FGFR2, PDGFRA, PDGFRB, EGFR, CSF1R, EPHA8 and KDR and terminates signaling. Recognizes membrane-bound HCK, SRC and other kinases of the SRC family and mediates their ubiquitination and degradation. Participates in signal transduction in hematopoietic cells. Plays an important role in the regulation of osteoblast differentiation and apoptosis. Essential for osteoclastic bone resorption. The 'Tyr-731' phosphorylated form induces the activation and recruitment of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase to the cell membrane in a signaling pathway that is critical for osteoclast function. May be functionally coupled with the E2 ubiquitin-protein ligase UB2D3.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因是编码环指E3泛素连接酶的原癌基因。编码的蛋白质是靶向底物以供蛋白酶体降解所需的酶之一。该蛋白介导遍在蛋白从泛素结合酶（E2）向特定底物的转移。这种蛋白质还含有一个N末端磷酸酪氨酸结合结构域，使其能够与众多酪氨酸磷酸化底物相互作用，并将它们靶向蛋白酶体降解。因此，它起许多信号转导途径的负调节剂的作用。已发现该基因在许多癌症（包括急性骨髓性白血病）中发生突变或易位，并且在5'UTR中CGG重复的扩增已与Jacobsen综合征相关联。该基因中的突变也是Noonan综合征样疾病的原因。 [由RefSeq提供，2016年7月]来自UniProt：适配蛋白，作为细胞表面受体激活触发的许多信号传导途径的负调节器。作为E3泛素蛋白连接酶起作用，其接受来自特定E2泛素缀合酶的泛素，然后将其转移至促进蛋白酶体降解的底物。识别活化的受体酪氨酸激酶，包括KIT，FLT1，FGFR1，FGFR2，PDGFRA，PDGFRB，EGFR，CSF1R，EPHA8和KDR并终止信号传导。识别膜结合的HCK，SRC和SRC家族的其他激酶并介导它们的泛素化和降解。参与造血细胞的信号转导。在调节成骨细胞分化和凋亡中发挥重要作用。对于破骨细胞骨吸收非常重要。 'Tyr-731'磷酸化形式诱导磷脂酰肌醇3-激酶向细胞膜上的激活和募集，该信号通路对破骨细胞功能至关重要。可能在功能上与E2泛素 - 蛋白连接酶UB2D3偶联。“>”

name: CAV3
eng: The CAV3 gene provides instructions for making a protein called caveolin-3, which is found in the membrane surrounding muscle cells. This protein is the main component of caveolae, which are small pouches in the muscle cell membrane. Within the caveolae, the caveolin-3 protein acts as a scaffold to organize other molecules that are important for cell signaling and maintenance of the cell structure. These molecules include the proteins that make up sodium channels, which transport positively charged sodium atoms (sodium ions) into cells. Sodium channels play a key role in a cell's ability to generate and transmit electrical signals. In cardiac muscle, sodium channels are involved in maintaining the heart's normal rhythm. Caveolin-3 may also help regulate calcium levels in the muscle cell, which control muscle contraction and relaxation.<> <>
chi: CAV3基因提供了制造称为窖蛋白-3的蛋白质的说明，该蛋白质存在于肌细胞周围的膜中。这种蛋白质是小窝的主要成分，它是肌肉细胞膜中的小囊。在小窝内，小窝蛋白-3蛋白作为支架来组织对细胞信号传导和细胞结构维持非常重要的其他分子。这些分子包括构成钠通道的蛋白质，其将带正电荷的钠原子（钠离子）转运到细胞中。钠通道在细胞产生和传输电信号的能力中起着关键作用。在心肌中，钠通道参与维持心脏的正常节律。窖蛋白-3也可能有助于调节肌肉细胞中的钙水平，从而控制肌肉收缩和松弛。<> <>

name: CAV1
eng: The CAV1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called caveolin-1. This protein appears to have diverse functions in cells and tissues throughout the body.Caveolin-1 is the major component of caveolae, which are small pouches in the membrane that surrounds cells. Caveolae have multiple functions, some of which are not well understood. They are known to be involved in the transport of molecules from the cell membrane to the interior of the cell (endocytosis), processing of molecules on their way into the cell, maintaining the cell structure, and regulating chemical signaling pathways. Studies suggest that caveolae are particularly numerous in adipocytes, which are cells that store fats for energy. Adipocytes make up most of the body's fatty (adipose) tissue. In these cells, caveolae appear to be essential for the normal transport, processing, and storage of fats.Caveolin-1 is also found in many other parts of cells, where it regulates various chemical signaling pathways. Through these pathways, caveolin-1 is involved in regulating cell growth and division (proliferation), the process by which cells mature to perform specific functions (differentiation), cell survival and the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis), and cell movement. The functions of caveolin-1 likely differ depending on the type of cell and the part of the cell where the protein is found.<> <>
chi: CAV1基因提供了制造称为小窝蛋白-1的蛋白质的说明。这种蛋白质在整个身体的细胞和组织中似乎具有不同的功能。小窝蛋白-1是小窝的主要成分，它是包围细胞的膜中的小囊。 Caveolae具有多种功能，其中一些功能尚未得到很好的理解。已知它们参与将分子从细胞膜转运至细胞内部（胞吞作用），分子在进入细胞的过程中处理，维持细胞结构以及调节化学信号传导途径。研究表明，穴居细胞在脂肪细胞中特别多，它们是储存能量的脂肪细胞。脂肪细胞构成人体的大部分脂肪（脂肪）组织。在这些细胞中，小窝穴对于脂肪的正常运输，加工和储存来说似乎是必不可少的。小窝蛋白-1也在细胞的许多其他部分中发现，其中它调节各种化学信号传导途径。通过这些途径，窖蛋白-1参与调节细胞生长和分裂（增殖），这是细胞成熟以执行特定功能（分化），细胞存活和细胞自我破坏（细胞凋亡）以及细胞运动的过程。小窝蛋白-1的功能可能根据细胞类型和发现蛋白质的细胞部分而不同。<> <>

name: CASR
eng: The CASR gene provides instructions for making a protein called the calcium-sensing receptor (CaSR). Calcium molecules attach (bind) to CaSR, which allows this protein to monitor and regulate the amount of calcium in the blood. The receptor is turned on (activated) when a certain concentration of calcium is reached, and the activated receptor sends signals to block processes that increase the amount of calcium in the blood.The CaSR protein is found in abundance in cells of the parathyroid glands. The parathyroid glands produce and release a hormone called parathyroid hormone that works to increase the levels of calcium in the blood. When large amounts of calcium bind to CaSR in the parathyroid glands, the production of parathyroid hormone is blocked, which prevents the release of more calcium into the blood. CaSR signaling also blocks the growth and division (proliferation) of cells that make up the parathyroid glands.The CaSR protein is also found in kidney cells. Kidneys filter fluid and waste products in the body and can reabsorb needed nutrients and release them back into the blood. Increased calcium binding to CaSR in kidney cells blocks the reabsorption of calcium from the filtered fluids.<> <>
chi: CASR基因提供了制造称为钙敏感受体（CaSR）的蛋白质的说明。钙分子附着（结合）CaSR，这允许这种蛋白质监测和调节血液中钙的量。当达到一定浓度的钙时，受体被打开（激活），并且活化的受体发送信号以阻断增加血液中钙量的过程.CaSR蛋白在甲状旁腺细胞中存在丰度。甲状旁腺产生并释放称为甲状旁腺激素的激素，其用于增加血液中钙的水平。当大量钙与甲状旁腺中的CaSR结合时，甲状旁腺激素的产生被阻断，这阻止了更多钙释放到血液中。 CaSR信号还阻断组成甲状旁腺的细胞的生长和分裂（增殖）。CaSR蛋白也在肾细胞中发现。肾脏在体内过滤流体和废物，并且可以重新吸收所需的营养物质并将它们释放回血液中。在肾细胞中钙结合CaSR的增加阻断了钙从过滤流体中的重吸收

name: CASQ2
eng: The CASQ2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called calsequestrin 2. This protein is found in heart (cardiac) muscle cells called myocytes, where it is involved in the storage and transport of positively charged calcium atoms (calcium ions).Within myocytes, calsequestrin 2 is located in a cell structure called the sarcoplasmic reticulum, which acts as a storage center for calcium ions. Most of these ions are stored by attaching (binding) to calsequestrin 2. This protein also helps regulate a protein called the RYR2 channel, which controls the flow of calcium ions out of the sarcoplasmic reticulum.For the heart to beat normally, the cardiac muscle must tense (contract) and relax in a coordinated way. This cycle of muscle contraction and relaxation results from the precise control of calcium ions within myocytes. In response to certain signals, calcium ions stored by calsequestrin 2 in the sarcoplasmic reticulum are released into the surrounding cell fluid (the cytoplasm). The resulting increase in calcium ion concentration triggers the cardiac muscle to contract, which pumps blood out of the heart. Calcium ions are then transported back into the sarcoplasmic reticulum, and the cardiac muscle relaxes. In this way, the release and reuptake of calcium ions in myocytes produces a regular heart rhythm.<> <>
chi: CASQ2基因提供了制造蛋白质Calsequestrin 2的说明。这种蛋白质在称为肌细胞的心脏（心脏）肌肉细胞中被发现，它参与储存和运输带正电的钙原子（钙离子）。在肌细胞中，calsequestrin 2位于称为肌质网的细胞结构中，其作为钙离子的储存中心。大多数这些离子通过附着（结合）到calsequestrin 2来储存。该蛋白质还有助于调节称为RYR2通道的蛋白质，其控制钙离子流出肌质网。对于心脏正常跳动，心肌必须以一种协调的方式紧张（合同）并放松。肌肉收缩和松弛的这个循环由精确控制心肌细胞内的钙离子引起。响应某些信号，calsequestrin 2储存在肌质网中的钙离子释放到周围的细胞液（细胞质）中。由此导致的钙离子浓度增加引发心肌收缩，从而将血液泵出心脏。钙离子然后被运回肌浆网，并且心肌松弛。这样，心肌细胞中钙离子的释放和再摄取就会产生规律的心律。“>”>

name: CALR3
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene belongs to the calreticulin family, members of which are calcium-binding chaperones localized mainly in the endoplasmic reticulum. This protein is also localized to the endoplasmic reticulum lumen, however, its capacity for calcium-binding may be absent or much lower than other family members. This gene is specifically expressed in the testis, and may be required for sperm fertility. Mutation in this gene has been associated with familial hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. [provided by RefSeq, Dec 2011]From UniProt:During spermatogenesis, may act as a lectin-independent chaperone for specific client proteins such as ADAM3. Required for sperm fertility (By similarity). CALR3 capacity for calcium-binding may be absent or much lower than that of CALR.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质属于钙网蛋白家族，其成员是主要定位于内质网的钙结合伴侣蛋白。这种蛋白质也定位于内质网腔，然而，它的钙结合能力可能不存在或比其他家族成员低得多。该基因在睾丸中特异性表达，可能是精子生育所必需的。该基因的突变与家族性肥厚型心肌病有关。 [由RefSeq，2011年12月提供]来自UniProt：在精子发生过程中，可能作为特定客户蛋白（如ADAM3）的不依赖凝集素的伴侣蛋白。精子生育所需（按相似性）。 CALR3与钙结合的能力可能不存在或比CALR的能力低得多。<> <>

name: CAPN10
eng: From NCBI Gene:Calpains represent a ubiquitous, well-conserved family of calcium-dependent cysteine proteases. The calpain proteins are heterodimers consisting of an invariant small subunit and variable large subunits. The large catalytic subunit has four domains: domain I, the N-terminal regulatory domain that is processed upon calpain activation; domain II, the protease domain; domain III, a linker domain of unknown function; and domain IV, the calmodulin-like calcium-binding domain. This gene encodes a large subunit. It is an atypical calpain in that it lacks the calmodulin-like calcium-binding domain and instead has a divergent C-terminal domain. It is similar in organization to calpains 5 and 6. This gene is associated with type 2 or non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (NIDDM), and is located within the NIDDM1 region. Multiple alternative transcript variants have been described for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Sep 2010]From UniProt:Calcium-regulated non-lysosomal thiol-protease which catalyzes limited proteolysis of substrates involved in cytoskeletal remodeling and signal transduction. May play a role in insulin-stimulated glucose uptake.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：钙蛋白酶代表一种普遍存在的钙依赖性半胱氨酸蛋白酶保守保守家族。钙蛋白酶蛋白质是由不变小亚基和可变大亚基组成的异二聚体。大催化亚基具有四个结构域：结构域I，在钙蛋白酶激活时加工的N端调节结构域;结构域II，蛋白酶结构域;结构域III，功能未知的接头结构域;和结构域IV，钙调蛋白样钙结合结构域。该基因编码一个大亚基。它是一种非典型钙蛋白酶，因为它缺少钙调蛋白样钙结合结构域，而是具有不同的C末端结构域。它在组织上与钙蛋白酶5和6类似。该基因与2型或非胰岛素依赖性糖尿病（NIDDM）相关，位于NIDDM1区域内。已经描述了该基因的多种可选转录物变体。 [由RefSeq，2010年9月提供]来自UniProt：钙调节的非溶酶体巯基蛋白酶，其催化参与细胞骨架重塑和信号转导的底物的有限蛋白水解。可能在胰岛素刺激的葡萄糖摄取中起作用。<> <>

name: CALM1
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a member of the EF-hand calcium-binding protein family. It is one of three genes which encode an identical calcium binding protein which is one of the four subunits of phosphorylase kinase. Two pseudogenes have been identified on chromosome 7 and X. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene.[provided by RefSeq, Oct 2009]From UniProt: CALM2_HUMAN:Calmodulin mediates the control of a large number of enzymes, ion channels, aquaporins and other proteins through calcium-binding. Among the enzymes to be stimulated by the calmodulin-calcium complex are a number of protein kinases and phosphatases. Together with CCP110 and centrin, is involved in a genetic pathway that regulates the centrosome cycle and progression through cytokinesis (PubMed:16760425). Mediates calcium-dependent inactivation of CACNA1C (PubMed:26969752). Positively regulates calcium-activated potassium channel activity of KCNN2 (PubMed:27165696).<>From UniProt: CALM1_HUMAN:Calmodulin mediates the control of a large number of enzymes, ion channels, aquaporins and other proteins through calcium-binding. Among the enzymes to be stimulated by the calmodulin-calcium complex are a number of protein kinases and phosphatases. Together with CCP110 and centrin, is involved in a genetic pathway that regulates the centrosome cycle and progression through cytokinesis (PubMed:16760425). Mediates calcium-dependent inactivation of CACNA1C (PubMed:26969752). Positively regulates calcium-activated potassium channel activity of KCNN2 (PubMed:27165696).<>From UniProt: CALM3_HUMAN:Calmodulin mediates the control of a large number of enzymes, ion channels, aquaporins and other proteins through calcium-binding. Among the enzymes to be stimulated by the calmodulin-calcium complex are a number of protein kinases and phosphatases. Together with CCP110 and centrin, is involved in a genetic pathway that regulates the centrosome cycle and progression through cytokinesis.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码EF-手钙结合蛋白家族的成员。它是编码磷酸化酶激酶的四个亚基之一的相同钙结合蛋白的三种基因之一。在第7号染色体和第X号染色体上已鉴定出两个假基因。已发现编码不同同种型的多种转录本变体[由RefSeq，Oct 2009提供] From UniProt：CALM2_HUMAN：钙调蛋白介导控制大量酶，离子通道，水通道蛋白和其他蛋白质通过钙结合。在钙调蛋白 - 钙复合物刺激的酶中有许多蛋白激酶和磷酸酶。与CCP110和中心蛋白一起参与调节中心体循环和通过胞质分裂进展的遗传途径（PubMed：16760425）。介导CACNA1C的钙依赖性失活（PubMed：26969752）。积极调节KCNN2的钙激活钾通道活性（PubMed：27165696）。<>来自UniProt：CALM1_HUMAN：钙调蛋白通过钙结合介导了大量酶，离子通道，水通道蛋白和其他蛋白的控制。在钙调蛋白 - 钙复合物刺激的酶中有许多蛋白激酶和磷酸酶。与CCP110和中心蛋白一起参与调节中心体循环和通过胞质分裂进展的遗传途径（PubMed：16760425）。介导CACNA1C的钙依赖性失活（PubMed：26969752）。正向调节KCNN2的钙激活钾通道活性（PubMed：27165696）。<>来自UniProt：CALM3_HUMAN：钙调蛋白通过钙结合介导控制大量酶，离子通道，水通道蛋白和其他蛋白。在钙调蛋白 - 钙复合物刺激的酶中有许多蛋白激酶和磷酸酶。与CCP110和中心蛋白一起参与调节中心体循环和细胞分裂过程的基因途径。<> <>

name: CACNB2
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a subunit of a voltage-dependent calcium channel protein that is a member of the voltage-gated calcium channel superfamily. The gene product was originally identified as an antigen target in Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome, an autoimmune disorder. Mutations in this gene are associated with Brugada syndrome. Alternatively spliced variants encoding different isoforms have been described. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2013]From UniProt:The beta subunit of voltage-dependent calcium channels contributes to the function of the calcium channel by increasing peak calcium current, shifting the voltage dependencies of activation and inactivation, modulating G protein inhibition and controlling the alpha-1 subunit membrane targeting.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码电压依赖性钙通道蛋白的亚基，其是电压门控钙通道超家族的成员。该基因产物最初在Lambert-Eaton肌无力综合征（自身免疫性疾病）中被确定为抗原靶标。该基因突变与Brugada综合征有关。已经描述了编码不同同种型的剪接变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2013年2月]来自UniProt：电压依赖性钙通道的β亚基通过增加峰值钙电流，改变激活和失活的电压依赖性，调节G蛋白抑制和控制α-1亚基膜靶向。<> <>

name: CACNA2D1
eng: From NCBI Gene:The preproprotein encoded by this gene is cleaved into multiple chains that comprise the alpha-2 and delta subunits of the voltage-dependent calcium channel complex. Calcium channels mediate the influx of calcium ions into the cell upon membrane polarization. Mutations in this gene can cause cardiac deficiencies, including Brugada syndrome and short QT syndrome. Alternate splicing results in multiple transcript variants, some of which may lack the delta subunit portion. [provided by RefSeq, Nov 2014]From UniProt:The alpha-2/delta subunit of voltage-dependent calcium channels regulates calcium current density and activation/inactivation kinetics of the calcium channel. Plays an important role in excitation-contraction coupling.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的前原蛋白被切割成包含电压依赖性钙通道复合物的α-2和δ亚基的多条链。在膜极化时，钙通道介导钙离子向细胞内的流入。该基因突变可导致心脏缺陷，包括Brugada综合征和短QT综合征。交替剪接产生多种转录物变体，其中一些可能缺乏δ亚基部分。 [由RefSeq，2014年11月提供]来自UniProt：电压依赖性钙通道的α-2 /δ亚基调节钙通道的钙电流密度和活化/失活动力学。在兴奋 - 收缩耦合中发挥重要作用。<> <>

name: CALM2
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene is a member of the calmodulin gene family. There are three distinct calmodulin genes dispersed throughout the genome that encode the identical protein, but differ at the nucleotide level. Calmodulin is a calcium binding protein that plays a role in signaling pathways, cell cycle progression and proliferation. Several infants with severe forms of long-QT syndrome (LQTS) who displayed life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias together with delayed neurodevelopment and epilepsy were found to have mutations in either this gene or another member of the calmodulin gene family (PMID:23388215). Mutations in this gene have also been identified in patients with less severe forms of LQTS (PMID:24917665), while mutations in another calmodulin gene family member have been associated with catecholaminergic polymorphic ventricular tachycardia (CPVT)(PMID:23040497), a rare disorder thought to be the cause of a significant fraction of sudden cardiac deaths in young individuals. Pseudogenes of this gene are found on chromosomes 10, 13, and 17. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2015]From UniProt: CALM2_HUMAN:Calmodulin mediates the control of a large number of enzymes, ion channels, aquaporins and other proteins through calcium-binding. Among the enzymes to be stimulated by the calmodulin-calcium complex are a number of protein kinases and phosphatases. Together with CCP110 and centrin, is involved in a genetic pathway that regulates the centrosome cycle and progression through cytokinesis (PubMed:16760425). Mediates calcium-dependent inactivation of CACNA1C (PubMed:26969752). Positively regulates calcium-activated potassium channel activity of KCNN2 (PubMed:27165696).<>From UniProt: CALM1_HUMAN:Calmodulin mediates the control of a large number of enzymes, ion channels, aquaporins and other proteins through calcium-binding. Among the enzymes to be stimulated by the calmodulin-calcium complex are a number of protein kinases and phosphatases. Together with CCP110 and centrin, is involved in a genetic pathway that regulates the centrosome cycle and progression through cytokinesis (PubMed:16760425). Mediates calcium-dependent inactivation of CACNA1C (PubMed:26969752). Positively regulates calcium-activated potassium channel activity of KCNN2 (PubMed:27165696).<>From UniProt: CALM3_HUMAN:Calmodulin mediates the control of a large number of enzymes, ion channels, aquaporins and other proteins through calcium-binding. Among the enzymes to be stimulated by the calmodulin-calcium complex are a number of protein kinases and phosphatases. Together with CCP110 and centrin, is involved in a genetic pathway that regulates the centrosome cycle and progression through cytokinesis.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因是钙调蛋白基因家族的成员。有三种不同的钙调蛋白基因分散在整个基因组中，编码相同的蛋白质，但在核苷酸水平上不同。钙调蛋白是钙信号传导通路，细胞周期进程和增殖中发挥作用的钙结合蛋白。发现几种严重形式的长QT综合征（LQTS）的婴儿表现出危及生命的室性心律失常以及延迟的神经发育和癫痫，这些基因或钙调蛋白基因家族的另一成员（PMID：23388215）具有突变。此基因的突变也在LQTS较轻症患者中发现（PMID：24917665），而另一种钙调蛋白基因家族成员的突变与儿茶酚胺能多形性室性心动过速（CPVT）（PMID：23040497）相关（罕见疾病被认为是年轻人心脏骤然死亡的重要原因。该基因的假基因位于染色体10,13和17上。选择性剪接产生编码不同同种型的多种转录物变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2015年3月]来自UniProt：CALM2_HUMAN：钙调蛋白通过钙结合介导了大量酶，离子通道，水通道蛋白和其他蛋白的控制。在钙调蛋白 - 钙复合物刺激的酶中有许多蛋白激酶和磷酸酶。与CCP110和中心蛋白一起参与调节中心体循环和通过胞质分裂进展的遗传途径（PubMed：16760425）。介导CACNA1C的钙依赖性失活（PubMed：26969752）。积极调节KCNN2的钙激活钾通道活性（PubMed：27165696）。<>来自UniProt：CALM1_HUMAN：钙调蛋白通过钙结合介导了大量酶，离子通道，水通道蛋白和其他蛋白的控制。在钙调蛋白 - 钙复合物刺激的酶中有许多蛋白激酶和磷酸酶。与CCP110和中心蛋白一起参与调节中心体循环和通过胞质分裂进展的遗传途径（PubMed：16760425）。介导CACNA1C的钙依赖性失活（PubMed：26969752）。正向调节KCNN2的钙激活钾通道活性（PubMed：27165696）。<>来自UniProt：CALM3_HUMAN：钙调蛋白通过钙结合介导控制大量酶，离子通道，水通道蛋白和其他蛋白。在钙调蛋白 - 钙复合物刺激的酶中有许多蛋白激酶和磷酸酶。与CCP110和中心蛋白一起参与调节中心体循环和细胞分裂过程的基因途径。<> <>

name: CACNA1C
eng: The CACNA1C gene belongs to a family of genes that provide instructions for making calcium channels.  These channels, which transport positively charged calcium atoms (calcium ions) into cells, play a key role in a cell's ability to generate and transmit electrical signals.  Calcium ions are involved in many different cellular functions, including cell-to-cell communication, the tensing of muscle fibers (muscle contraction), and the regulation of certain genes.The calcium channel produced from the CACNA1C gene is known as CaV1.2.  These channels are found in many types of cells, although they appear to be particularly important for the normal function of heart and brain cells.  In the heart, CaV1.2 channels open and close at specific times to control the flow of calcium ions into cardiac muscle cells.  By changing the electrical properties of these cells, calcium channels signal the cardiac muscle to contract and help maintain the heart's normal rhythm.  The channels' role in the brain and in other tissues is less clear.Researchers have discovered that many different versions of the CaV1.2 channel can be produced from the CACNA1C gene by a mechanism called alternative splicing.  This mechanism produces different versions of the channel by cutting and rearranging the genetic instructions in different ways.  Some versions of the CaV1.2 channel are more common than others in certain parts of the body.  For example, in the heart and brain, about 80 percent of CaV1.2 channels are made with a particular segment known as exon 8.  The other 20 percent of CaV1.2 channels contain a slightly different version of this segment, known as exon 8A.  This difference becomes important when researchers are studying the effects of CACNA1C mutations in various tissues.<> <>
chi: CACNA1C基因属于提供制造钙通道的说明的基因家族。这些将带正电荷的钙原子（钙离子）输送到细胞中的通道在细胞产生和传输电信号的能力中起着关键作用。钙离子参与许多不同的细胞功能，包括细胞间通讯，肌肉纤维紧张（肌肉收缩）以及某些基因的调节.CACNA1C基因产生的钙通道被称为CaV1.2。这些通道存在于许多类型的细胞中，尽管它们对于心脏和脑细胞的正常功能似乎特别重要。在心脏中，CaV1.2通道在特定时间打开和关闭，以控制钙离子流入心肌细胞。通过改变这些细胞的电特性，钙通道发出信号使心肌收缩并帮助维持心脏的正常节律。这些通道在大脑和其他组织中的作用不太清楚。研究人员已经发现，通过称为选择性剪接的机制，可以从CACNA1C基因产生许多不同版本的CaV1.2通道。该机制通过以不同方式切割和重新排列基因指令来产生不同版本的通道。 CaV1.2通道的某些版本比身体某些部位的其他版本更为常见。例如，在心脏和大脑中，约80％的CaV1.2通道是由称为外显子8的特定片段制成的。另外20％的CaV1.2通道包含该片段的略微不同的形式，称为外显子8A 。当研究人员研究CACNA1C突变在各种组织中的作用时，这种差异就变得很重要

name: CACNA1D
eng: The CACNA1D gene belongs to a family of genes that provide instructions for making calcium channels. These channels transport positively charged calcium atoms (calcium ions) across cell membranes. The CACNA1D gene provides instructions for making one part (the alpha-1 subunit) of a calcium channel called CaV1.3. This subunit forms the hole (pore) through which calcium ions can flow. CaV1.3 channels are found in many types of cells, although they play a particularly important role in the adrenal glands, which are small hormone-producing glands located on top of each kidney. In the adrenal glands, the flow of calcium through CaV1.3 channels appears to help regulate the production of the hormone aldosterone, which helps control blood pressure by maintaining proper salt and fluid levels in the body. CaV1.3 channels are also found in the brain, heart, and inner ear, although their roles in these tissues are not well understood.<> <>
chi: CACNA1D所属的基因家族提供制造钙通道的模板，这些通道使钙离子能穿过细胞膜。 CACNA1D对应的蛋白称为α-1亚基，这个亚基形成钙离子可以流过的通道。 该通道存在于许多类型的细胞中，同时在肾上腺中扮演着特别重要的角色。在肾上腺中，通过该通道的钙流动似乎有助于调节激素醛固酮的产生，这有助于通过保持体内合适的盐和液体水平来控制血压。 该通道也存在于大脑，心脏和内耳中，尽管它们在这些组织中的作用尚未得到很好的理解。

name: BSND
eng: The BSND gene provides instructions for making a protein called barttin. This protein is found primarily in the kidneys, where it attaches (binds) to two specific chloride channels: ClC-Ka (produced from the CLCNKA gene) and ClC-Kb (produced from the CLCNKB gene). The ClC-Ka and ClC-Kb channels transport charged atoms of chlorine (chloride ions) out of kidney cells.Barttin is essential for the normal placement of ClC-Ka and ClC-Kb channels in the cell membrane. It also regulates the channels' stability and function. The transport of chloride ions is part of the mechanism by which the kidneys reabsorb salt (sodium chloride or NaCl) from the urine back into the bloodstream. The retention of salt affects the body's fluid levels and helps maintain blood pressure.Barttin, ClC-Ka, and ClC-Kb are also found in the inner ear, where they play a role in normal hearing.<> <>
chi: BSND基因提供了制造蛋白质的说明。这种蛋白主要存在于肾脏中，在肾脏附着（结合）两种特定的氯离子通道：ClC-Ka（由CLCNKA基因产生）和ClC-Kb（由CLCNKB基因产生）。 ClC-Ka和ClC-Kb通道将氯的带电原子（氯离子）从肾细胞中转移出来。巴丁酮对于正常放置细胞膜中的ClC-Ka和ClC-Kb通道至关重要。它还调节渠道的稳定性和功能。氯离子的转运是肾脏从尿液中重吸收盐（氯化钠或氯化钠）返回血液的机制的一部分。盐的滞留会影响人体的体液水平并有助于维持血压。巴丁，ClC-Ka和ClC-Kb也可在内耳中发现，它们在正常听力中发挥作用。<> <>

name: BRAF
eng: The BRAF gene provides instructions for making a protein that helps transmit chemical signals from outside the cell to the cell's nucleus.  This protein is part of a signaling pathway known as the RAS/MAPK pathway, which controls several important cell functions. Specifically, the RAS/MAPK pathway regulates the growth and division (proliferation) of cells, the process by which cells mature to carry out specific functions (differentiation), cell movement (migration), and the self-destruction of cells (apoptosis). Chemical signaling through this pathway is essential for normal development before birth.The BRAF gene belongs to a class of genes known as oncogenes. When mutated, oncogenes have the potential to cause normal cells to become cancerous.<> <>
chi: BRAF基因提供制造蛋白质的指导，帮助从细胞外传递化学信号到细胞核。该蛋白质是被称为RAS / MAPK途径的信号传导途径的一部分，其控制几种重要的细胞功能。具体而言，RAS / MAPK途径调节细胞的生长和分裂（增殖），细胞成熟以执行特定功能（分化），细胞移动（迁移）和细胞自我毁坏（细胞凋亡）的过程。通过该途径的化学信号传导对出生前正常发育是必不可少的。BRAF基因属于一类称为癌基因的基因。当发生突变时，癌基因有可能导致正常细胞发生癌变。<> <>

name: BMPR2
eng: The BMPR2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called bone morphogenetic protein receptor type 2. The BMPR2 gene belongs to a family of genes originally identified for its role in regulating the growth and maturation (differentiation) of bone and cartilage. Recently, researchers have found that this gene family plays a broader role in regulating the growth and differentiation of numerous types of cells.Bone morphogenetic protein receptor type 2 spans the cell membrane, so that one end of the protein is on the outer surface of the cell and the other end remains inside the cell. This positioning allows the protein to receive and transmit signals that help the cell respond to its environment by growing and dividing (cell proliferation) or by undergoing controlled cell death (apoptosis). This balance of cell proliferation and apoptosis regulates the number of cells in tissues.<> <>
chi: BMPR2基因提供了制造称为骨形态发生蛋白受体2型的蛋白质的说明。BMPR2基因属于最初由于其在调节骨和软骨的生长和成熟（分化）中的作用而鉴定的基因家族。最近，研究人员发现，这个基因家族在调节众多细胞类型的生长和分化方面发挥着更广泛的作用。骨形态发生蛋白2型受体跨越细胞膜，使蛋白质的一端位于细胞外表面细胞，另一端留在细胞内。这种定位允许蛋白质通过生长和分裂（细胞增殖）或受控制的细胞死亡（细胞凋亡）来接收和传递信号，以帮助细胞对其环境作出反应。细胞增殖和凋亡的这种平衡调节组织中细胞的数量

name: BLK
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a nonreceptor tyrosine-kinase of the src family of proto-oncogenes that are typically involved in cell proliferation and differentiation. The protein has a role in B-cell receptor signaling and B-cell development. The protein also stimulates insulin synthesis and secretion in response to glucose and enhances the expression of several pancreatic beta-cell transcription factors. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2010]From UniProt:Non-receptor tyrosine kinase involved in B-lymphocyte development, differentiation and signaling. B-cell receptor (BCR) signaling requires a tight regulation of several protein tyrosine kinases and phosphatases, and associated coreceptors. Binding of antigen to the B-cell antigen receptor (BCR) triggers signaling that ultimately leads to B-cell activation. Signaling through BLK plays an important role in transmitting signals through surface immunoglobulins and supports the pro-B to pre-B transition, as well as the signaling for growth arrest and apoptosis downstream of B-cell receptor. Specifically binds and phosphorylates CD79A at 'Tyr-188'and 'Tyr-199', as well as CD79B at 'Tyr-196' and 'Tyr-207'. Phosphorylates also the immunoglobulin G receptors FCGR2A, FCGR2B and FCGR2C. With FYN and LYN, plays an essential role in pre-B-cell receptor (pre-BCR)-mediated NF-kappa-B activation. Contributes also to BTK activation by indirectly stimulating BTK intramolecular autophosphorylation. In pancreatic islets, acts as a modulator of beta-cells function through the up-regulation of PDX1 and NKX6-1 and consequent stimulation of insulin secretion in response to glucose.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码通常参与细胞增殖和分化的原癌基因src家族的非受体酪氨酸激酶。该蛋白在B细胞受体信号传导和B细胞发育中起作用。该蛋白质还响应于葡萄糖刺激胰岛素合成和分泌，并增强几种胰腺β-细胞转录因子的表达。 [由RefSeq，2010年8月提供]来自UniProt：涉及B淋巴细胞发育，分化和信号传导的非受体酪氨酸激酶。 B细胞受体（BCR）信号需要严格调控几种蛋白酪氨酸激酶和磷酸酶以及相关的共同受体。抗原与B细胞抗原受体（BCR）的结合触发最终导致B细胞活化的信号传导。通过BLK传导信号在通过表面免疫球蛋白传递信号方面发挥重要作用，并且支持前B至前B转换，以及B细胞受体下游的生长停滞和细胞凋亡的信号传导。 'Tyr-188'和'Tyr-199'处的CD79A以及'Tyr-196'和'Tyr-207'处的CD79B特异性结合并磷酸化。还磷酸化免疫球蛋白G受体FCGR2A，FCGR2B和FCGR2C。 FYN和LYN在前B细胞受体（pre-BCR）介导的NF-kappa-B活化中发挥重要作用。还通过间接刺激BTK分子内自磷酸化作用来促进BTK活化。在胰岛中，通过上调PDX1和NKX6-1以及随后对葡萄糖响应的胰岛素分泌的刺激作为β细胞调节剂起作用。<> <>

name: BBS9
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene is downregulated by parathyroid hormone in osteoblastic cells, and therefore is thought to be involved in parathyroid hormone action in bones. The exact function of this gene has not yet been determined. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been identified. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2017]From UniProt:The BBSome complex is thought to function as a coat complex required for sorting of specific membrane proteins to the primary cilia. The BBSome complex is required for ciliogenesis but is dispensable for centriolar satellite function. This ciliogenic function is mediated in part by the Rab8 GDP/GTP exchange factor, which localizes to the basal body and contacts the BBSome. Rab8(GTP) enters the primary cilium and promotes extension of the ciliary membrane. Firstly the BBSome associates with the ciliary membrane and binds to RAB3IP/Rabin8, the guanosyl exchange factor (GEF) for Rab8 and then the Rab8-GTP localizes to the cilium and promotes docking and fusion of carrier vesicles to the base of the ciliary membrane. Required for proper BBSome complex assembly and its ciliary localization.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因在成骨细胞中被甲状旁腺激素下调，因此被认为与骨骼中的甲状旁腺激素作用有关。该基因的确切功能尚未确定。已经鉴定了编码不同同种型的剪接转录物变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2017年1月]来自UniProt：BBSome复合物被认为是将特定膜蛋白分选至初级纤毛所需的外壳复合物。 BBSome复合体是纤维发生所必需的，但对于中心卫星功能是不必要的。这种致纤维化功能部分由Rab8 GDP / GTP交换因子介导，该交换因子定位于基底体并与BBSome接触。 Rab8（GTP）进入初级纤毛并促进睫状膜的延伸。首先，BBSome与睫状膜结合并结合RAB3IP / Rabin8，Rab8的鸟苷基交换因子（GEF），然后Rab8-GTP定位于纤毛并促进载体囊泡与睫状膜基底的对接和融合。正确BBSome复杂的装配和它的纤维定位所需的<> <>

name: BBS7
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes one of eight proteins that form the BBSome complex containing BBS1, BBS2, BBS4, BBS5, BBS7, BBS8, BBS9 and BBIP10. The BBSome complex is believed to recruit Rab8(GTP) to the primary cilium and promote ciliogenesis. The BBSome complex assembly is mediated by a complex composed of three chaperonin-like BBS proteins (BBS6, BBS10, and BBS12) and CCT/TRiC family chaperonins. Mutations in this gene are implicated in Bardet-Biedl syndrome, a genetic disorder whose symptoms include obesity, retinal degeneration, polydactyly and nephropathy; however, mutations in this gene and the BBS8 gene are thought to play a minor role and mutations in chaperonin-like BBS genes are found to be a major contributor to disease development in a multiethnic Bardet-Biedl syndrome patient population. Two transcript variants encoding distinct isoforms have been identified for this gene.[provided by RefSeq, Oct 2014]From UniProt:The BBSome complex is thought to function as a coat complex required for sorting of specific membrane proteins to the primary cilia. The BBSome complex is required for ciliogenesis but is dispensable for centriolar satellite function. This ciliogenic function is mediated in part by the Rab8 GDP/GTP exchange factor, which localizes to the basal body and contacts the BBSome. Rab8(GTP) enters the primary cilium and promotes extension of the ciliary membrane. Firstly the BBSome associates with the ciliary membrane and binds to RAB3IP/Rabin8, the guanosyl exchange factor (GEF) for Rab8 and then the Rab8-GTP localizes to the cilium and promotes docking and fusion of carrier vesicles to the base of the ciliary membrane. The BBSome complex, together with the LTZL1, controls SMO ciliary trafficking and contributes to the sonic hedgehog (SHH) pathway regulation. Required for proper BBSome complex assembly and its ciliary localization.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码八种形成BBS1，BBS2，BBS4，BBS5，BBS7，BBS8，BBS9和BBIP10的BBSome复合物的蛋白之一。 BBSome复合物据信招募Rab8（GTP）主要纤毛并促进纤维发生。 BBSome复合体装配由三种伴侣蛋白样BBS蛋白（BBS6，BBS10和BBS12）和CCT / TRiC家族伴侣蛋白组成的复合物介导。 Bardet-Biedl综合征是一种遗传性疾病，其症状包括肥胖，视网膜变性，多指和肾病;然而，该基因和BBS8基因中的突变被认为起了次要作用，发现伴侣蛋白样BBS基因中的突变是多种族Bardet-Biedl综合征患者群中疾病发展的主要促成因素。已经鉴定出编码此基因的不同同种型的两种转录物变体[由RefSeq，Oct 2014提供] From UniProt：BBSome复合物被认为是将特定膜蛋白分选至初级纤毛所需的外壳复合物。 BBSome复合体是纤维发生所必需的，但对于中心卫星功能是不必要的。这种致纤维化功能部分由Rab8 GDP / GTP交换因子介导，该交换因子定位于基底体并与BBSome接触。 Rab8（GTP）进入初级纤毛并促进睫状膜的延伸。首先，BBSome与睫状膜结合并结合RAB3IP / Rabin8，Rab8的鸟苷基交换因子（GEF），然后Rab8-GTP定位于纤毛并促进载体囊泡与睫状膜基底的对接和融合。 BBSome复合物与LTZL1一起控制SMO纤毛运输并促成声刺猬（SHH）通路调节。正确BBSome复杂的装配和它的纤维定位所需的<> <>

name: BBS5
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a protein that has been directly linked to Bardet-Biedl syndrome. The primary features of this syndrome include retinal dystrophy, obesity, polydactyly, renal abnormalities and learning disabilities. Experimentation in non-human eukaryotes suggests that this gene is expressed in ciliated cells and that it is required for the formation of cilia. Alternate transcriptional splice variants have been observed but have not been fully characterized. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:The BBSome complex is thought to function as a coat complex required for sorting of specific membrane proteins to the primary cilia. The BBSome complex is required for ciliogenesis but is dispensable for centriolar satellite function. This ciliogenic function is mediated in part by the Rab8 GDP/GTP exchange factor, which localizes to the basal body and contacts the BBSome. Rab8(GTP) enters the primary cilium and promotes extension of the ciliary membrane. Firstly the BBSome associates with the ciliary membrane and binds to RAB3IP/Rabin8, the guanosyl exchange factor (GEF) for Rab8 and then the Rab8-GTP localizes to the cilium and promotes docking and fusion of carrier vesicles to the base of the ciliary membrane. The BBSome complex, together with the LTZL1, controls SMO ciliary trafficking and contributes to the sonic hedgehog (SHH) pathway regulation. Required for BBSome complex ciliary localization but not for the proper complex assembly.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码与Bardet-Biedl综合征直接相关的蛋白质。这种综合症的主要特征包括视网膜营养不良，肥胖，多指，肾脏异常和学习障碍。在非人类真核生物中的实验表明，该基因在纤毛细胞中表达，并且它是形成纤毛所必需的。已观察到备选的转录剪接变体，但尚未完全表征。 [由RefSeq提供，2008年7月]来自UniProt：BBSome复合体被认为是将特定膜蛋白分选至初级纤毛所需的外壳复合体。 BBSome复合体是纤维发生所必需的，但对于中心卫星功能是不必要的。这种致纤维化功能部分由Rab8 GDP / GTP交换因子介导，该交换因子定位于基底体并与BBSome接触。 Rab8（GTP）进入初级纤毛并促进睫状膜的延伸。首先，BBSome与睫状膜结合并结合RAB3IP / Rabin8，Rab8的鸟苷基交换因子（GEF），然后Rab8-GTP定位于纤毛并促进载体囊泡与睫状膜基底的对接和融合。 BBSome复合物与LTZL1一起控制SMO纤毛运输并促成声刺猬（SHH）通路调节。 BBS有一些复杂的纤毛定位需要，但不适合复杂的组装。<> <>

name: BBS4
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene is a member of the Bardet-Biedl syndrome (BBS) gene family. Bardet-Biedl syndrome is an autosomal recessive disorder characterized by severe pigmentary retinopathy, obesity, polydactyly, renal malformation and cognitive disability. The proteins encoded by BBS gene family members are structurally diverse. The similar phenotypes exhibited by mutations in BBS gene family members are likely due to the protein's shared roles in cilia formation and function. Many BBS proteins localize to the basal bodies, ciliary axonemes, and pericentriolar regions of cells. BBS proteins may also be involved in intracellular trafficking via microtubule-related transport. The protein encoded by this gene has sequence similarity to O-linked N-acetylglucosamine (O-GlcNAc) transferases in plants and archaebacteria and in human forms a multi-protein "BBSome" complex with seven other BBS proteins. Alternate splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2016]From UniProt:The BBSome complex is thought to function as a coat complex required for sorting of specific membrane proteins to the primary cilia. The BBSome complex is required for ciliogenesis but is dispensable for centriolar satellite function. This ciliogenic function is mediated in part by the Rab8 GDP/GTP exchange factor, which localizes to the basal body and contacts the BBSome. Rab8(GTP) enters the primary cilium and promotes extension of the ciliary membrane. Firstly the BBSome associates with the ciliary membrane and binds to RAB3IP/Rabin8, the guanosyl exchange factor (GEF) for Rab8 and then the Rab8-GTP localizes to the cilium and promotes docking and fusion of carrier vesicles to the base of the ciliary membrane. The BBSome complex, together with the LTZL1, controls SMO ciliary trafficking and contributes to the sonic hedgehog (SHH) pathway regulation. Required for proper BBSome complex assembly and its ciliary localization. Required for microtubule anchoring at the centrosome but not for microtubule nucleation. May be required for the dynein-mediated transport of pericentriolar proteins to the centrosome.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因是Bardet-Biedl综合征（BBS）基因家族的成员。 Bardet-Biedl综合征是一种常染色体隐性遗传疾病，其特征为严重的色素性视网膜病，肥胖，多指，肾畸形和认知功能障碍。由BBS基因家族成员编码的蛋白质在结构上是多样的。 BBS基因家族成员突变表现出类似的表型可能是由于蛋白质在纤毛形成和功能中的共同作用。许多BBS蛋白定位于细胞的基底体，睫状轴索和周围区域。 BBS蛋白也可能通过微管相关转运参与细胞内运输。由该基因编码的蛋白质与植物和古细菌中的O-连接的N-乙酰葡糖胺（O-GlcNAc）转移酶具有序列相似性，并且与人类形成具有七种其他BBS蛋白质的多蛋白质“BBSome”复合物。交替剪接产生多个转录物变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2016年3月]来自UniProt：BBSome复合物被认为是将特定膜蛋白分选至初级纤毛所需的外壳复合物。 BBSome复合体是纤维发生所必需的，但对于中心卫星功能是不必要的。这种致纤维化功能部分由Rab8 GDP / GTP交换因子介导，该交换因子定位于基底体并与BBSome接触。 Rab8（GTP）进入初级纤毛并促进睫状膜的延伸。首先，BBSome与睫状膜结合并结合RAB3IP / Rabin8，Rab8的鸟苷基交换因子（GEF），然后Rab8-GTP定位于纤毛并促进载体囊泡与睫状膜基底的对接和融合。 BBSome复合物与LTZL1一起控制SMO纤毛运输并促成声刺猬（SHH）通路调节。正确BBSome复杂装配和它的纤维定位需要。微管锚定在中心体而不是微管成核所需的。可能需要动力蛋白介导的pericentriolar蛋白质运输到中心体。<> <>

name: BBS2
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene is a member of the Bardet-Biedl syndrome (BBS) gene family. Bardet-Biedl syndrome is an autosomal recessive disorder characterized by severe pigmentary retinopathy, obesity, polydactyly, renal malformation and cognitive disability. The proteins encoded by BBS gene family members are structurally diverse and the similar phenotypes exhibited by mutations in BBS gene family members is likely due to their shared roles in cilia formation and function. Many BBS proteins localize to the basal bodies, ciliary axonemes, and pericentriolar regions of cells. BBS proteins may also be involved in intracellular trafficking via microtubule-related transport. The protein encoded by this gene forms a multiprotein BBSome complex with seven other BBS proteins.[provided by RefSeq, Oct 2014]From UniProt:The BBSome complex is thought to function as a coat complex required for sorting of specific membrane proteins to the primary cilia. The BBSome complex is required for ciliogenesis but is dispensable for centriolar satellite function. This ciliogenic function is mediated in part by the Rab8 GDP/GTP exchange factor, which localizes to the basal body and contacts the BBSome. Rab8(GTP) enters the primary cilium and promotes extension of the ciliary membrane. Firstly the BBSome associates with the ciliary membrane and binds to RAB3IP/Rabin8, the guanosyl exchange factor (GEF) for Rab8 and then the Rab8-GTP localizes to the cilium and promotes docking and fusion of carrier vesicles to the base of the ciliary membrane. The BBSome complex, together with the LTZL1, controls SMO ciliary trafficking and contributes to the sonic hedgehog (SHH) pathway regulation.
