Required for proper BBSome complex assembly and its ciliary localization.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因是Bardet-Biedl综合征（BBS）基因家族的成员。 Bardet-Biedl综合征是一种常染色体隐性遗传疾病，其特征为严重的色素性视网膜病，肥胖，多指，肾畸形和认知功能障碍。由BBS基因家族成员编码的蛋白质在结构上是多样的，并且由BBS基因家族成员中的突变表现出的相似表型可能归因于它们在纤毛形成和功能中的共同作用。许多BBS蛋白定位于细胞的基底体，睫状轴索和周围区域。 BBS蛋白也可能通过微管相关转运参与细胞内运输。该基因编码的蛋白质与其他七种BBS蛋白形成多蛋白BBSome复合物[由RefSeq，2014年10月提供] From UniProt：BBSome复合物被认为是将特定膜蛋白分选至初级纤毛所需的外壳复合物。 BBSome复合体是纤维发生所必需的，但对于中心卫星功能是不必要的。这种致纤维化功能部分由Rab8 GDP / GTP交换因子介导，该交换因子定位于基底体并与BBSome接触。 Rab8（GTP）进入初级纤毛并促进睫状膜的延伸。首先，BBSome与睫状膜结合并结合RAB3IP / Rabin8，Rab8的鸟苷基交换因子（GEF），然后Rab8-GTP定位于纤毛并促进载体囊泡与睫状膜基底的对接和融合。 BBSome复合物与LTZL1一起控制SMO纤毛运输并促成声刺猬（SHH）通路调节。正确BBSome复杂的装配和它的纤维定位所需的<> <>

name: BBS12
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is part of a complex that is involved in membrane trafficking. The encoded protein is a molecular chaperone that aids in protein folding upon ATP hydrolysis. This protein also plays a role in adipocyte differentiation. Defects in this gene are a cause of Bardet-Biedl syndrome type 12. Two transcript variants encoding the same protein have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, May 2010]From UniProt:Probable molecular chaperone. Assists the folding of proteins upon ATP hydrolysis. As part of the BBS/CCT complex may play a role in the assembly of BBSome, a complex involved in ciliogenesis regulating transports vesicles to the cilia. Involved in adipogenic differentiation.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质是参与膜运输的复合物的一部分。编码的蛋白质是一种分子伴侣，有助于ATP水解后的蛋白质折叠。这种蛋白质在脂肪细胞分化中也起作用。该基因中的缺陷是Bardet-Biedl综合征12型的原因。已发现编码相同蛋白质的两种转录本变体用于该基因。 [由RefSeq，2010年5月提供]来自UniProt：可能的分子伴侣。辅助ATP水解时蛋白质的折叠。由于BBS / CCT复合体的一部分可能在BBSome的组装中发挥作用，参与调节纤毛生成的复合体将囊泡运输至纤毛。参与脂肪形成分化。<> <>

name: BBS10
eng: The BBS10 gene provides instructions for making a protein that is found in many types of cells. The BBS10 protein is part of a group (complex) of proteins that functions as a chaperonin. Chaperonins help fold other proteins into their correct 3-dimensional shapes so they can perform their usual functions in the body.Studies suggest that the BBS10 protein helps fold or stabilize certain proteins that are necessary for the normal formation of cilia. Cilia are microscopic, finger-like projections that stick out from the surface of many types of cells. They are involved in cell movement and many different chemical signaling pathways. Cilia are also necessary for the perception of sensory input (such as sight, hearing, and smell).<> <>
chi: BBS10基因提供了制造在许多类型的细胞中发现的蛋白质的说明。 BBS10蛋白是作为伴侣蛋白起作用的蛋白质组（复合体）的一部分。伴侣蛋白帮助将其他蛋白质折叠成其正确的三维形状，以便它们可以在体内执行其通常的功能。研究表明BBS10蛋白质有助于折叠或稳定正常形成纤毛所必需的某些蛋白质。纤毛是微观的，指状突起，从多种细胞表面伸出。他们参与细胞运动和许多不同的化学信号传导途径。纤毛对感觉输入（例如视觉，听觉和嗅觉）的感知也是必需的。<> <>

name: BBS1
eng: The BBS1 gene provides instructions for making a protein found in cells throughout the body. The BBS1 protein is part of a group (complex) of proteins that plays a critical role in the formation of cell structures called cilia. Cilia are microscopic, finger-like projections that stick out from the surface of many types of cells. They are involved in cell movement and many different chemical signaling pathways. Cilia are also necessary for the perception of sensory input (such as sight, hearing, and smell).<> <>
chi: BBS1基因提供了制造在整个身体细胞中发现的蛋白质的说明。 BBS1蛋白是蛋白质组（复合体）的一部分，在称为纤毛的细胞结构的形成中起关键作用。纤毛是微观的，指状突起，从多种细胞表面伸出。他们参与细胞运动和许多不同的化学信号传导途径。纤毛对感觉输入（例如视觉，听觉和嗅觉）的感知也是必需的。<> <>

name: BBIP1
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes one of eight proteins that form the BBSome complex and is essential for its assembly. The BBSome complex is involved in trafficking signal receptors to and from the cilia. Mutations in this gene result in Bardet-Biedl syndrome 18. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2014]From UniProt:The BBSome complex is thought to function as a coat complex required for sorting of specific membrane proteins to the primary cilia. The BBSome complex is required for ciliogenesis but is dispensable for centriolar satellite function. This ciliogenic function is mediated in part by the Rab8 GDP/GTP exchange factor, which localizes to the basal body and contacts the BBSome. Rab8(GTP) enters the primary cilium and promotes extension of the ciliary membrane. Firstly the BBSome associates with the ciliary membrane and binds to RAB3IP/Rabin8, the guanosyl exchange factor (GEF) for Rab8 and then the Rab8-GTP localizes to the cilium and promotes docking and fusion of carrier vesicles to the base of the ciliary membrane. Required for primary cilia assembly and BBSome stability. Regulates cytoplasmic microtubule stability and acetylation.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码八种形成BBSome复合物的蛋白质之一，并且是其装配所必需的。 BBSome复合体涉及向纤毛传递信号和从纤毛传递信号。该基因中的突变导致Bardet-Biedl综合征18.选择性剪接导致多种转录物变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2014年10月]来自UniProt：BBSome复合体被认为是将特定膜蛋白分选至初级纤毛所需的外壳复合体。 BBSome复合体是纤维发生所必需的，但对于中心卫星功能是不必要的。这种致纤维化功能部分由Rab8 GDP / GTP交换因子介导，该交换因子定位于基底体并与BBSome接触。 Rab8（GTP）进入初级纤毛并促进睫状膜的延伸。首先，BBSome与睫状膜结合并结合RAB3IP / Rabin8，Rab8的鸟苷基交换因子（GEF），然后Rab8-GTP定位于纤毛并促进载体囊泡与睫状膜基底的对接和融合。初级纤毛组装和BBSome稳定性需要。调节细胞质微管稳定性和乙酰化。<> <>

name: BAG3
eng: From NCBI Gene:BAG proteins compete with Hip for binding to the Hsc70/Hsp70 ATPase domain and promote substrate release. All the BAG proteins have an approximately 45-amino acid BAG domain near the C terminus but differ markedly in their N-terminal regions. The protein encoded by this gene contains a WW domain in the N-terminal region and a BAG domain in the C-terminal region. The BAG domains of BAG1, BAG2, and BAG3 interact specifically with the Hsc70 ATPase domain in vitro and in mammalian cells. All 3 proteins bind with high affinity to the ATPase domain of Hsc70 and inhibit its chaperone activity in a Hip-repressible manner. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Co-chaperone for HSP70 and HSC70 chaperone proteins. Acts as a nucleotide-exchange factor (NEF) promoting the release of ADP from the HSP70 and HSC70 proteins thereby triggering client/substrate protein release. Nucleotide release is mediated via its binding to the nucleotide-binding domain (NBD) of HSPA8/HSC70 where as the substrate release is mediated via its binding to the substrate-binding domain (SBD) of HSPA8/HSC70 (PubMed:9873016, PubMed:27474739). Has anti-apoptotic activity (PubMed:10597216). Plays a role in the HSF1 nucleocytoplasmic transport (PubMed:26159920).<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：BAG蛋白与Hip竞争结合Hsc70 / Hsp70 ATPase结构域并促进底物释放。所有BAG蛋白在C末端附近具有约45个氨基酸的BAG结构域，但在其N-末端区域中显着不同。由该基因编码的蛋白质在N-末端区域含有WW结构域，在C-末端区域含有BAG结构域。 BAG1，BAG2和BAG3的BAG结构域在体外和哺乳动物细胞中与Hsc70 ATPase结构域特异性相互作用。所有3种蛋白以高亲和力与Hsc70的ATP酶结构域结合并以Hip抑制方式抑制其分子伴侣活性。 [由RefSeq，2008年7月提供]来自UniProt：HSP70和HSC70伴侣蛋白的伴侣蛋白。作为核苷酸交换因子（NEF）起作用，促进ADP从HSP70和HSC70蛋白释放，从而触发客户/底物蛋白释放。核苷酸释放通过其与HSPA8 / HSC70的核苷酸结合结构域（NBD）的结合而介导，其中底物释放通过其与HSPA8 / HSC70的底物结合结构域（SBD）的结合而介导（PubMed：9873016，PubMed： 27474739）。具有抗凋亡活性（PubMed：10597216）。在HSF1核浆胞质转运中发挥作用（PubMed：26159920）。<> <>

name: AVP
eng: The AVP gene provides instructions for making a hormone called vasopressin or antidiuretic hormone (ADH). ADH starts out as a larger molecule called a preprohormone, which is cut (cleaved) and modified to produce the active hormone and several related proteins. The preprohormone is made in a region of the brain called the hypothalamus. It is then transported to the nearby pituitary gland, where active ADH is stored until it is needed.The major function of ADH is to help control the body's water balance by determining how much water is excreted in urine. Normally, when a person's fluid intake is low or when a lot of fluid is lost (for example, through sweating), the pituitary gland releases more ADH into the bloodstream. High levels of this hormone direct the kidneys to reabsorb more water and to make less urine. When fluid intake is adequate, the pituitary gland releases less ADH. Lower levels of this hormone cause the kidneys to reabsorb less water and to make more urine.<> <>
chi: AVP基因提供了制造称为加压素或抗利尿激素（ADH）的激素的说明。 ADH起初是一种称为前激素的较大分子，它被切割（切割）并被修饰以产生活性激素和几种相关蛋白。前激素是在称为下丘脑的大脑区域制造的。然后它被运送到附近的脑下垂体，在那里储存活性ADH直到需要。ADH的主要功能是通过确定尿液中有多少水分排出体外，帮助控制身体的水分平衡。正常情况下，当一个人的液体摄入量低或流失很多时（例如，通过出汗），脑下垂体会释放更多的ADH进入血液。这种激素的高水平指导肾脏重新吸收更多的水分并减少尿量。当液体摄入量充足时，垂体腺释放较少的ADH。这种激素水平降低会导致肾脏重新吸收更少的水分并制造更多的尿液。“>”>

name: AQP2
eng: The AQP2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called aquaporin 2. This protein forms a channel that carries water molecules across cell membranes. It is found in the kidneys in structures called collecting ducts, which are a series of small tubes that reabsorb water from the kidneys into the bloodstream.The aquaporin 2 water channel plays an essential role in maintaining the body's water balance. The placement of these channels is controlled by a hormone called vasopressin or antidiuretic hormone (ADH). When a person's fluid intake is low or when a lot of fluid is lost (for example, through sweating), the body produces more ADH. This hormone triggers chemical reactions that ultimately insert aquaporin 2 water channels into the membrane of collecting duct cells. These channels allow water to be reabsorbed into the bloodstream, which makes the urine more concentrated. When fluid intake is adequate, less ADH is produced. Without signals from ADH, aquaporin 2 water channels are removed from the membrane of collecting duct cells. At these times, less water is reabsorbed into the bloodstream and the urine is more dilute.<> <>
chi: AQP2基因提供了制造称为水通道蛋白2的蛋白质的说明。该蛋白质形成通过细胞膜携带水分子的通道。它被发现在肾脏中，称为收集管道，它是一系列将肾脏中的水重新吸收到血液中的小管道。水通道蛋白2水通道在维持人体水分平衡方面发挥着重要作用。这些通道的位置由一种称为血管加压素或抗利尿激素（ADH）的激素控制。当一个人的液体摄入量低或大量液体流失时（例如，通过出汗），身体会产生更多的ADH。这种激素触发化学反应，最终将水通道蛋白2水通道插入集合管细胞膜。这些通道允许水重新吸收到血液中，这使得尿液更加浓缩。当液体摄入量充足时，会产生较少的ADH。没有来自ADH的信号，水通道蛋白2水通道从集合管细胞的膜上去除。在这些时候，更少的水被重新吸收到血流中，尿液更稀薄。“>”>

name: AVPR2
eng: The AVPR2 gene provides instructions for making a protein known as the vasopressin V2 receptor. This receptor works together with a hormone called vasopressin or antidiuretic hormone (ADH) in the kidneys. The vasopressin V2 receptor is found in structures called collecting ducts, which are a series of small tubes that reabsorb water from the kidneys into the bloodstream.The interaction between ADH and the vasopressin V2 receptor triggers chemical reactions that control the body's water balance. When a person's fluid intake is low or when a lot of fluid is lost (for example, through sweating), the body produces more ADH. This hormone attaches (binds) to the vasopressin V2 receptor and directs the kidneys to concentrate urine by reabsorbing some of the water back into the bloodstream. When fluid intake is adequate, less ADH is available to interact with the vasopressin V2 receptor. At these times, less water is reabsorbed into the bloodstream and the urine is more dilute.<> <>
chi: AVPR2基因提供了制造被称为血管加压素V2受体的蛋白质的说明。这种受体在肾脏中与称为加压素或抗利尿激素（ADH）的激素一起起作用。加压素V2受体存在于被称为收集导管的结构中，所述结构是一系列将肾脏的水重新吸收到血液中的小管。ADH和加压素V2受体之间的相互作用触发控制人体水平衡的化学反应。当一个人的液体摄入量低或大量液体流失时（例如，通过出汗），身体会产生更多的ADH。该激素附着（结合）加压素V2受体，并通过将一些水重新吸收回血流而指导肾脏浓缩尿液。当液体摄入量足够时，可以减少ADH与加压素V2受体相互作用。在这些时候，更少的水被重新吸收到血流中，尿液更稀薄。“>”>

name: APPL1
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene has been shown to be involved in the regulation of cell proliferation, and in the crosstalk between the adiponectin signalling and insulin signalling pathways. The encoded protein binds many other proteins, including RAB5A, DCC, AKT2, PIK3CA, adiponectin receptors, and proteins of the NuRD/MeCP1 complex. This protein is found associated with endosomal membranes, but can be released by EGF and translocated to the nucleus. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Adapter protein that interacts with proteins involved in different cellular signaling pathways. Required for the regulation of cell proliferation in response to extracellular signals from an early endosomal compartment. Links Rab5 to nuclear signal transduction. Involved in the regulation of the insulin receptor signaling pathway.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白已被证明参与调节细胞增殖，以及在脂联素信号传导和胰岛素信号传导途径之间的相互作用。编码的蛋白质结合许多其他蛋白质，包括RAB5A，DCC，AKT2，PIK3CA，脂联素受体以及NuRD / MeCP1复合物的蛋白质。发现这种蛋白质与内体膜相关，但可以通过EGF释放并转位至细胞核。 [由RefSeq提供，2008年7月]来自UniProt：与参与不同细胞信号传导途径的蛋白相互作用的衔接蛋白。为了响应来自早期内体腔室的细胞外信号而调节细胞增殖所需的。将Rab5连接至核信号转导。参与调节胰岛素受体信号通路。“>”

name: APOA5
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene is an apolipoprotein that plays an important role in regulating the plasma triglyceride levels, a major risk factor for coronary artery disease. It is a component of high density lipoprotein and is highly similar to a rat protein that is upregulated in response to liver injury. Mutations in this gene have been associated with hypertriglyceridemia and hyperlipoproteinemia type 5. This gene is located proximal to the apolipoprotein gene cluster on chromosome 11q23. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding the same protein have been identified. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2009]From UniProt:Minor apolipoprotein mainly associated with HDL and to a lesser extent with VLDL. May also be associated with chylomicrons. Important determinant of plasma triglyceride (TG) levels by both being a potent stimulator of apo-CII lipoprotein lipase (LPL) TG hydrolysis and a inhibitor of the hepatic VLDL-TG production rate (without affecting the VLDL-apoB production rate) (By similarity). Activates poorly lecithin:cholesterol acyltransferase (LCAT) and does not enhance efflux of cholesterol from macrophages.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质是载脂蛋白，其在调节血浆甘油三酯水平中起重要作用，血浆甘油三酯水平是冠状动脉疾病的主要危险因素。它是高密度脂蛋白的组分，并且与响应肝损伤而上调的大鼠蛋白高度相似。该基因中的突变与高甘油三酯血症和5型高脂蛋白血症有关。该基因位于染色体11q23上的载脂蛋白基因簇附近。已经鉴定出编码相同蛋白质的剪接转录物变体。 [由RefSeq，2009年10月提供]来自UniProt：主要与HDL相关的轻度载脂蛋白，以及VLDL程度较轻。也可能与乳糜微粒有关。血浆甘油三酯（TG）水平的重要决定因素是apo-CII脂蛋白脂肪酶（LPL）TG水解和肝VLDL-TG生成速率的抑制剂（不影响VLDL-apoB生成速率）的有效刺激物（通过相似性）。激活卵磷脂质量不佳：胆固醇酰基转移酶（LCAT），不会增强巨噬细胞胆固醇流出。<> <>

name: ARL6
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene belongs to the ARF-like (ADP ribosylation factor-like) sub-family of the ARF family of GTP-binding proteins which are involved in regulation of intracellular traffic. Mutations in this gene are associated with Bardet-Biedl syndrome (BBS). A vision-specific transcript, encoding long isoform BBS3L, has been described (PMID: 20333246). [provided by RefSeq, Apr 2016]From UniProt:Involved in membrane protein trafficking at the base of the ciliary organelle. Mediates recruitment onto plasma membrane of the BBSome complex which would constitute a coat complex required for sorting of specific membrane proteins to the primary cilia (PubMed:20603001). Together with BBS1, is necessary for correct trafficking of PKD1 to primary cilia (By similarity). Together with the BBSome complex and LTZL1, controls SMO ciliary trafficking and contributes to the sonic hedgehog (SHH) pathway regulation (PubMed:22072986). May regulate cilia assembly and disassembly and subsequent ciliary signaling events such as the Wnt signaling cascade (PubMed:20207729). Isoform 2 may be required for proper retinal function and organization.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质属于涉及调节细胞内交通的GTP结合蛋白的ARF家族的ARF样（ADP核糖基化因子样）亚家族。该基因突变与Bardet-Biedl综合征（BBS）有关。已经描述了编码长同种型BBS3L的视觉特异性转录物（PMID：20333246）。 [由RefSeq提供，2016年4月]来自UniProt：涉及睫状细胞器底部的膜蛋白运输。将募集到BBSome复合物的质膜上，这将构成将特定膜蛋白分选至初级纤毛所需的外套复合物（PubMed：20603001）。与BBS1一起，正确将PKD1转运至原发性纤毛是必需的（按相似性）。与BBSome复合物和LTZL1一起，控制SMO睫状体运输并促成声刺猬（SHH）通路调节（PubMed：22072986）。可以调节纤毛组装和拆卸以及随后的纤毛信号事件，例如Wnt信号级联（PubMed：20207729）。亚型2可能是正确的视网膜功能和组织需要的。<> <>

name: APOE
eng: The APOE gene provides instructions for making a protein called apolipoprotein E. This protein combines with fats (lipids) in the body to form molecules called lipoproteins. Lipoproteins are responsible for packaging cholesterol and other fats and carrying them through the bloodstream. Maintaining normal levels of cholesterol is essential for the prevention of disorders that affect the heart and blood vessels (cardiovascular diseases), including heart attack and stroke.There are at least three slightly different versions (alleles) of the APOE gene. The major alleles are called e2, e3, and e4. The most common allele is e3, which is found in more than half of the general population.<> <>
chi: APOE基因提供了制造称为载脂蛋白E的蛋白质的说明。该蛋白质与体内的脂肪（脂质）结合形成称为脂蛋白的分子。脂蛋白负责包装胆固醇和其他脂肪，并通过血液携带它们。维持正常水平的胆固醇对预防影响心脏和血管的疾病（心血管疾病）至关重要，包括心脏病发作和卒中。APOE基因至少有三种略有不同的版本（等位基因）。主要等位基因称为e2，e3和e4。最常见的等位基因是e3，其在一半以上的普通人群中发现。<> <>

name: APOA1
eng: The APOA1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called apolipoprotein A-I (apoA-I). ApoA-I is a component of high-density lipoprotein (HDL). HDL is a molecule that transports cholesterol and certain fats called phospholipids through the bloodstream from the body's tissues to the liver. Once in the liver, cholesterol and phospholipids are redistributed to other tissues or removed from the body.ApoA-I attaches to cell membranes and promotes the movement of cholesterol and phospholipids from inside the cell to the outer surface. Once outside the cell, these substances combine with apoA-I to form HDL. ApoA-I also triggers a reaction called cholesterol esterification that converts cholesterol to a form that can be fully integrated into HDL and transported through the bloodstream.HDL is often referred to as "good cholesterol" because high levels of this substance reduce the chances of developing heart and blood vessel (cardiovascular) disease. The process of removing excess cholesterol from cells is extremely important for balancing cholesterol levels and maintaining cardiovascular health.<> <>
chi: APOA1基因提供了制造称为载脂蛋白A-I（apoA-I）的蛋白质的说明。 ApoA-I是高密度脂蛋白（HDL）的组分。 HDL是一种将胆固醇和某些脂肪（称为磷脂）从人体组织传输到肝脏的分子。一旦进入肝脏，胆固醇和磷脂被重新分配到其他组织或从体内去除.ApoA-I附着于细胞膜并促进胆固醇和磷脂从细胞内部移动到外表面。一旦在细胞外，这些物质与apoA-I结合形成HDL。 ApoA-I还引发了一种称为胆固醇酯化反应的反应，将胆固醇转化为可以完全整合到HDL并通过血流运输的形式.HDL通常被称为“好胆固醇”，因为高含量的这种物质降低了发展的机会心脏和血管（心血管）疾病。从细胞中去除多余的胆固醇对于平衡胆固醇水平和维持心血管健康非常重要。“>”>

name: ANK2
eng: The ANK2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called ankyrin-B. Ankyrin-B is part of a family of ankyrin proteins, which interact with many other types of proteins in cells throughout the body. Ankyrins help organize the cell's structural framework (the cytoskeleton) and link certain proteins that span the cell membrane to this framework. Additionally, ankyrins play key roles in important functions including cell movement (migration) and cell growth and division (proliferation).The ankyrin-B protein is active in many cell types, particularly in the brain and in heart (cardiac) muscle. This protein mainly interacts with ion channels and ion transporters, which are complexes of proteins that move charged atoms (ions) across cell membranes. In the heart, the flow of ions (such as sodium, potassium, and calcium) through ion channels and ion transporters generates the electrical signals that control the heartbeat and maintain a normal heart rhythm. Ankyrin-B ensures these channels and transporters are in their proper locations in the cell membrane so they can regulate the flow of ions into and out of cardiac muscle cells. In addition, ankyrin-B helps ensure that signaling molecules that regulate the activity of ion channels and ion transporters are in the proper location.<> <>
chi: ANK2基因提供了制造称为锚蛋白-B的蛋白质的说明。锚蛋白-B是锚蛋白家族的一部分，锚蛋白与整个身体细胞中的许多其他类型的蛋白质相互作用。 Ankyrins帮助组织细胞的结构框架（细胞骨架）并将跨越细胞膜的某些蛋白质连接到该框架。此外，ankyrins在包括细胞运动（迁移）和细胞生长和分裂（增殖）等重要功能中发挥关键作用。锚蛋白-B蛋白在许多细胞类型中都有活性，特别是在大脑和心脏（心脏）肌肉中。这种蛋白质主要与离子通道和离子转运蛋白相互作用，离子转运蛋白是将电荷原子（离子）移动穿过细胞膜的蛋白质复合物。在心脏中，通过离子通道和离子转运蛋白的离子（如钠，钾和钙）的流动产生控制心跳并保持正常心律的电信号。 Ankyrin-B确保这些通道和转运蛋白位于细胞膜的适当位置，因此它们可以调节进出心肌细胞的离子流。此外，锚蛋白-B有助于确保调控离子通道和离子转运蛋白活性的信号分子处于适当的位置。<> <>

name: ANGPTL3
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a member of a family of secreted proteins that function in angiogenesis. The encoded protein, which is expressed predominantly in the liver, is further processed into an N-terminal coiled-coil domain-containing chain and a C-terminal fibrinogen chain. The N-terminal chain is important for lipid metabolism, while the C-terminal chain may be involved in angiogenesis. Mutations in this gene cause familial hypobetalipoproteinemia type 2. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2015]From UniProt:Acts in part as a hepatokine that is involved in regulation of lipid and glucose metabolism (PubMed:11788823, PubMed:12909640, PubMed:23661675, PubMed:25495645). Proposed to play a role in the trafficking of energy substrates to either storage or oxidative tissues in response to food intake (By similarity). Has a stimulatory effect on plasma triglycerides (TG), which is achieved by suppressing plasma TG clearance via inhibition of LPL activity. The inhibition of LPL activity appears to be an indirect mechanism involving recruitment of proprotein convertases PCSK6 and FURIN to LPL leading to cleavage and dissociation of LPL from the cell surface; the function does not require ANGPTL3 proteolytic cleavage but seems to be mediated by the N-terminal domain, and is not inhibited by GPIHBP1 (PubMed:12097324, PubMed:19318355, PubMed:20581395). Can inhibit endothelial lipase, causing increased plasma levels of high density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol and phospholipids (PubMed:17110602, PubMed:19028676). Can bind to adipocytes to activate lipolysis, releasing free fatty acids and glycerol (PubMed:12565906). Suppresses LPL specifically in oxidative tissues which is required to route very low density lipoprotein (VLDL)-TG to white adipose tissue (WAT) for storage in response to food; the function may involve cooperation with circulating, liver-derived ANGPTL8 and ANGPTL4 expression in WAT (By similarity). Contributes to lower plasma levels of low density lipoprotein (LDL)-cholesterol by a mechanism that is independent of the canonical pathway implicating APOE and LDLR. May stimulate hypothalamic LPL activity.Involved in angiogenesis. Binds to endothelial cells via integrin alpha-V/beta-3 (ITGAV:ITGB3), activates FAK, MAPK and Akt signaling pathways and induces cell adhesion and cell migration (PubMed:11877390). Secreted from podocytes, may modulate properties of glomerular endothelial cells involving integrin alpha-V/beta-3 and Akt signaling (PubMed:18535744). May increase the motility of podocytes. May induce actin filament rearrangements in podocytes implicating integrin alpha-V/beta-3 and Rac1 activation. Binds to hematopoietic stem cells (HSC) and is involved in the regulation of HSC activity probably implicating down-regulation of IKZF1/IKAROS.ANGPTL3(17-221): In vitro inhibits LPL activity; not effective on GPIHBP1-stabilized LPL.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码在血管生成中起作用的分泌蛋白家族的成员。主要在肝脏中表达的编码蛋白被进一步加工成含N末端卷曲螺旋结构域链和C末端纤维蛋白原链。 N端链对于脂质代谢是重要的，而C端链可能参与血管生成。 [来自RefSeq，2015年8月提供]来自UniProt：部分作为参与调节脂质和糖代谢的肝细胞因子（PubMed：11788823，PubMed：12909640，PubMed：23661675，考研：25495645）。建议在向食物摄入量反应时向储存或氧化组织贩卖能量基质方面发挥作用（相似性）。对血浆甘油三酯（TG）具有刺激作用，通过抑制LPL活性来抑制血浆TG清除。 LPL活性的抑制似乎是间接机制，其涉及将前体蛋白转化酶PCSK6和FURIN募集至LPL，从而导致LPL从细胞表面裂解和解离;该功能不需要ANGPTL3蛋白水解切割但似乎由N端结构域介导，并且不受GPIHBP1（PubMed：12097324，PubMed：19318355，PubMed：20581395）的抑制。可抑制内皮脂肪酶，引起血浆高密度脂蛋白（HDL）胆固醇和磷脂水平升高（PubMed：17110602，PubMed：19028676）。可以结合脂肪细胞来激活脂肪分解，释放游离脂肪酸和甘油（PubMed：12565906）。特别是在需要将极低密度脂蛋白（VLDL）-TG传递至白色脂肪组织（WAT）以响应食物储存的氧化组织中抑制LPL;该功能可能涉及与WAT中循环的，肝源ANGPTL8和ANGPTL4表达的合作（通过相似性）。通过独立于涉及APOE和LDLR的规范途径的机制，有助于降低血浆低密度脂蛋白（LDL） - 胆固醇水平。可能刺激下丘脑LPL活性。参与血管生成。通过整合素α-V /β-3（ITGAV：ITGB3）与内皮细胞结合，激活FAK，MAPK和Akt信号通路并诱导细胞粘附和细胞迁移（PubMed：11877390）。从足细胞分泌，可调节涉及整合素α-V /β-3和Akt信号传导的肾小球内皮细胞的特性（PubMed：18535744）。可能会增加足细胞的运动性。可能会诱导足细胞肌动蛋白丝重排，牵连整合素α-V /β-3和Rac1激活。与造血干细胞（HSC）结合，参与调节HSC活性，可能牵涉IKZF1 / IKAROS的下调.ANGPTL3（17-221）：体外抑制LPL活性;对GPIHBP1稳定的LPL无效。“>”

name: ANGPTL4
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a glycosylated, secreted protein containing a C-terminal fibrinogen domain. The encoded protein is induced by peroxisome proliferation activators and functions as a serum hormone that regulates glucose homeostasis, lipid metabolism, and insulin sensitivity. This protein can also act as an apoptosis survival factor for vascular endothelial cells and can prevent metastasis by inhibiting vascular growth and tumor cell invasion. The C-terminal domain may be proteolytically-cleaved from the full-length secreted protein. Decreased expression of this gene has been associated with type 2 diabetes. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. This gene was previously referred to as ANGPTL2 but has been renamed ANGPTL4. [provided by RefSeq, Sep 2013]From UniProt:Protein with hypoxia-induced expression in endothelial cells. May act as a regulator of angiogenesis and modulate tumorigenesis. Inhibits proliferation, migration, and tubule formation of endothelial cells and reduces vascular leakage. May exert a protective function on endothelial cells through an endocrine action. It is directly involved in regulating glucose homeostasis, lipid metabolism, and insulin sensitivity. In response to hypoxia, the unprocessed form of the protein accumulates in the subendothelial extracellular matrix (ECM). The matrix-associated and immobilized unprocessed form limits the formation of actin stress fibers and focal contacts in the adhering endothelial cells and inhibits their adhesion. It also decreases motility of endothelial cells and inhibits the sprouting and tube formation.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码含有C-末端纤维蛋白原结构域的糖基化分泌蛋白。编码的蛋白由过氧化物酶体增殖激活剂诱导，并作为调节葡萄糖体内平衡，脂质代谢和胰岛素敏感性的血清激素起作用。该蛋白还可以作为血管内皮细胞的细胞凋亡存活因子，并且可以通过抑制血管生长和肿瘤细胞侵袭来预防转移。 C-末端结构域可以从全长分泌蛋白中蛋白水解切割。该基因的表达下降与2型糖尿病有关。选择性剪接产生多种转录本变体。该基因以前称为ANGPTL2，但已被重命名为ANGPTL4。 [由RefSeq提供，2013年9月]来自UniProt：在内皮细胞中缺氧诱导表达的蛋白质。可能充当血管生成调节剂并调节肿瘤发生。抑制内皮细胞的增殖，迁移和小管形成并减少血管渗漏。可通过内分泌作用对内皮细胞发挥保护作用。它直接参与调节葡萄糖体内平衡，脂质代谢和胰岛素敏感性。响应缺氧，蛋白质的未加工形式积聚在内皮下细胞外基质（ECM）中。基质相关的和固定化的未加工形式限制了粘附内皮细胞中肌动蛋白应力纤维和局灶性接触的形成并抑制它们的粘附。它还降低内皮细胞的运动性并抑制萌芽和管形成。“>”>

name: IER3IP1
eng: From NCBI Gene:This gene encodes a small protein that is localized to the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) and may play a role in the ER stress response by mediating cell differentiation and apoptosis. Transcription of this gene is regulated by tumor necrosis factor alpha and specificity protein 1 (Sp1). Mutations in this gene may play a role in microcephaly, epilepsy, and diabetes syndrome (MEDS), and a pseudogene of this gene is located on the long arm of chromosome 12. [provided by RefSeq, Dec 2011]From UniProt:May be implicated in the regulation of apoptosis. May be involved in protein transport between endoplasmic reticulum and Golgi apparatus.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：该基因编码一种定位于内质网（ER）的小蛋白，可能通过介导细胞分化和凋亡在内质网应激反应中发挥作用。该基因的转录受肿瘤坏死因子α和特异性蛋白1（Sp1）调控。该基因突变可能在小头畸形，癫痫和糖尿病综合征（MEDS）中发挥作用，该基因的假基因位于染色体12的长臂上。[由RefSeq提供，2011年12月]来自UniProt：可能牵连在调控细胞凋亡。可能参与内质网与高尔基体之间的蛋白质转运。<> <>

name: NOS3
eng: From NCBI Gene:Nitric oxide is a reactive free radical which acts as a biologic mediator in several processes, including neurotransmission and antimicrobial and antitumoral activities. Nitric oxide is synthesized from L-arginine by nitric oxide synthases. Variations in this gene are associated with susceptibility to coronary spasm. Alternative splicing and the use of alternative promoters results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2016]From UniProt:Produces nitric oxide (NO) which is implicated in vascular smooth muscle relaxation through a cGMP-mediated signal transduction pathway. NO mediates vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF)-induced angiogenesis in coronary vessels and promotes blood clotting through the activation of platelets.Isoform eNOS13C: Lacks eNOS activity, dominant-negative form that may down-regulate eNOS activity by forming heterodimers with isoform 1.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：一氧化氮是一种反应性自由基，在几个过程中起着生物介质的作用，包括神经传递，抗菌和抗肿瘤活性。一氧化氮由L-精氨酸通过一氧化氮合成酶合成。该基因的变异与冠状动脉痉挛的易感性有关。选择性剪接和替代启动子的使用导致多个转录本变体。 [由RefSeq提供，2016年10月]来自UniProt：通过cGMP介导的信号转导途径产生一氧化氮（NO），其涉及血管平滑肌松弛。 NO介导血管内皮生长因子（VEGF）诱导的冠状血管血管生成，并通过血小板激活促进血液凝固。亚型eNOS13C：缺乏eNOS活性，显性失活形式可能通过与异构体1形成异二聚体而下调eNOS活性。 <> <>

name: PRKAG2
eng: The PRKAG2 gene provides instructions for making one part (the gamma-2 subunit) of a larger enzyme called AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK). This enzyme helps sense and respond to energy demands within cells.  It is active in many different tissues, including heart (cardiac) muscle and muscles used for movement (skeletal muscles).  AMP-activated protein kinase is likely involved in the development of the heart before birth, although its role in this process is unknown.AMP-activated protein kinase regulates chemical pathways involving the cell's main energy source, a molecule called adenosine triphosphate (ATP).  The breakdown of ATP releases energy to drive many types of chemical reactions.  AMP-activated protein kinase is activated during times of cellular stress (such as low oxygen levels or muscle exercise), when ATP is broken down rapidly to produce energy.  If ATP levels become too low, the enzyme restores the balance of energy by limiting chemical reactions that require ATP and stimulating pathways that generate ATP.Studies suggest that AMP-activated protein kinase may play a role in controlling the activity of other genes, although many of these genes have not been identified.  The enzyme may also regulate the activity of certain ion channels in the heart.  These channels, which transport positively charged atoms (ions) into and out of heart  muscle cells, play critical roles in maintaining the heart's normal rhythm.<> <>
chi: PRKAG2基因提供了制造称为AMP-活化蛋白激酶（AMPK）的较大酶的一部分（γ-2亚基）的模板。这种酶有助于感知和响应细胞内的能量需求。它在许多不同的组织中都很活跃，包括心肌和骨骼肌。 AMP激活的蛋白激酶可能参与了出生前心脏的发育，尽管它在这个过程中的作用尚不清楚。AMP激活的蛋白激酶调节涉及细胞主要能量来源的化学途径，一种叫做三磷酸腺苷（ATP）的分子。 ATP的分解释放出能量以驱动许多类型的化学反应。当ATP被快速分解以产生能量时，AMP激活的蛋白激酶在细胞应激时（例如低氧水平或肌肉锻炼）被激活。如果ATP水平过低，酶通过限制需要ATP的化学反应和刺激产生ATP的途径来恢复能量平衡。研究表明AMP激活的蛋白激酶可能在控制其他基因的活性方面发挥作用，尽管许多这些基因尚未确定。该酶还可以调节心脏中某些离子通道的活性。这些将离子输入和输出心肌细胞的通道在维持心脏正常节律方面起着关键作用。

name: STAR
eng: From NCBI Gene:The protein encoded by this gene plays a key role in the acute regulation of steroid hormone synthesis by enhancing the conversion of cholesterol into pregnenolone. This protein permits the cleavage of cholesterol into pregnenolone by mediating the transport of cholesterol from the outer mitochondrial membrane to the inner mitochondrial membrane. Mutations in this gene are a cause of congenital lipoid adrenal hyperplasia (CLAH), also called lipoid CAH. A pseudogene of this gene is located on chromosome 13. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]From UniProt:Plays a key role in steroid hormone synthesis by enhancing the metabolism of cholesterol into pregnenolone. Mediates the transfer of cholesterol from the outer mitochondrial membrane to the inner mitochondrial membrane where it is cleaved to pregnenolone.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：由该基因编码的蛋白质通过增强胆固醇向孕烯醇酮的转化而在急性调节类固醇激素合成中起关键作用。该蛋白质通过介导胆固醇从外线粒体膜向内线粒体膜的转运而允许胆固醇裂解为孕烯醇酮。该基因突变是先天性脂质肾上腺增生（CLAH）的原因，也称为类脂质CAH。该基因的假基因位于13号染色体上[由RefSeq，2008年7月提供] From UniProt：通过增强胆固醇代谢成孕烯醇酮，在类固醇激素合成中发挥关键作用。介导胆固醇从线粒体外膜向线粒体内膜的转移，在线粒体膜被切割成孕烯醇酮。<> <>

name: PSEN2
eng: The PSEN2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called presenilin 2. Presenilin 2 helps process proteins that transmit chemical signals from the cell membrane into the nucleus. Once in the nucleus, these signals turn on (activate) genes that are important for cell growth and maturation.Presenilin 2 is best known for its role in processing amyloid precursor protein, which is found in the brain and other tissues. Research suggests that presenilin 2 works together with other enzymes to cut amyloid precursor protein into smaller segments (peptides). One of these peptides is called soluble amyloid precursor protein (sAPP), and another is called amyloid beta peptide. Recent evidence suggests that sAPP has growth-promoting properties and may play a role in the formation of neurons in the brain both before and after birth.  Other functions of sAPP and amyloid beta peptide are under investigation.<> <>
chi: PSEN2基因提供制造称为早老素2的蛋白质的说明。早老素2帮助处理将化学信号从细胞膜传递到细胞核中的蛋白质。一旦进入细胞核，这些信号就开启（激活）对细胞生长和成熟至关重要的基因。早老素2以其在处理脑和其他组织中发现的淀粉样前体蛋白中的作用而闻名。研究表明早老素2与其他酶一起将淀粉样蛋白前体蛋白切割成更小的片段（肽）。其中一种肽称为可溶性淀粉样蛋白前体蛋白（sAPP），另一种称为淀粉状蛋白β肽。最近的证据表明，sAPP具有促进生长的特性，并可能在出生前后在大脑中形成神经元。 sAPP和β淀粉样肽的其他功能正在研究中。<> <>

name: BSCL2
eng: The BSCL2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called seipin, whose function is unknown.  Within cells, seipin is located in the membrane of a structure called the endoplasmic reticulum. The endoplasmic reticulum modifies newly produced proteins and also helps transport proteins, fats, and other molecules to specific sites either inside or outside the cell.The BSCL2 gene is active in cells and tissues throughout the body, particularly in nerve cells that control muscle movement (motor neurons) and in the brain. The gene is also active in fat-storing cells called adipocytes, which are the major component of fatty (adipose) tissue. Studies suggest that seipin plays a critical role in the development and function of adipocytes. In particular, seipin is involved in the development of lipid droplets, which are structures within these cells that store fat molecules.<> <>
chi: BSCL2基因提供了制造称为seipin的蛋白质的说明，其功能未知。在细胞内，seipin位于称为内质网的结构的膜中。内质网修饰新产生的蛋白质，并帮助将蛋白质，脂肪和其他分子转运到细胞内外的特定位点。BSCL2基因在整个身体细胞和组织中有活性，特别是在控制肌肉运动的神经细胞中运动神经元）和大脑中。该基因还在称为脂肪细胞的脂肪储存细胞中有活性，脂肪细胞是脂肪（脂肪）组织的主要成分。研究表明seipin在脂肪细胞的发育和功能中起着关键作用。特别是，seipin参与了脂滴的形成，脂滴是这些细胞内存储脂肪分子的结构。<> <>

name: HSD11B2
eng: From NCBI Gene:There are at least two isozymes of the corticosteroid 11-beta-dehydrogenase, a microsomal enzyme complex responsible for the interconversion of cortisol and cortisone. The type I isozyme has both 11-beta-dehydrogenase (cortisol to cortisone) and 11-oxoreductase (cortisone to cortisol) activities. The type II isozyme, encoded by this gene, has only 11-beta-dehydrogenase activity. In aldosterone-selective epithelial tissues such as the kidney, the type II isozyme catalyzes the glucocorticoid cortisol to the inactive metabolite cortisone, thus preventing illicit activation of the mineralocorticoid receptor. In tissues that do not express the mineralocorticoid receptor, such as the placenta and testis, it protects cells from the growth-inhibiting and/or pro-apoptotic effects of cortisol, particularly during embryonic development. Mutations in this gene cause the syndrome of apparent mineralocorticoid excess and hypertension. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2010]From UniProt:Catalyzes the conversion of cortisol to the inactive metabolite cortisone. Modulates intracellular glucocorticoid levels, thus protecting the nonselective mineralocorticoid receptor from occupation by glucocorticoids.<> <>
chi: 来自NCBI基因：至少有两种皮质类固醇11-β-脱氢酶的同工酶，一种负责皮质醇和可的松相互转换的微粒体酶复合物。 I型同功酶同时具有11-β-脱氢酶（皮质醇与可的松）和11-氧化还原酶（可的松与皮质醇）的活性。由该基因编码的II型同功酶仅具有11-β-脱氢酶活性。在醛固酮选择性上皮组织如肾中，II型同功酶将糖皮质激素皮质醇催化为无活性代谢物可的松，从而防止盐皮质激素受体的非法活化。在不表达盐皮质激素受体的组织中，如胎盘和睾丸，它可以保护细胞免受皮质醇的生长抑制和/或促凋亡作用，特别是在胚胎发育过程中。该基因突变导致明显盐皮质激素过多和高血压综合征。 [由RefSeq，2010年2月提供]来自UniProt：催化皮质醇向无活性代谢物可的松的转化。调节细胞内糖皮质激素水平，从而保护非选择性盐皮质激素受体免受糖皮质激素的占用。<> <>

name: LAMP2
eng: The LAMP2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called lysosomal associated membrane protein-2 (LAMP-2), which, as its name suggests, is found in the membrane of cellular structures called lysosomes. Lysosomes are compartments in the cell that digest and recycle materials. The role the LAMP-2 protein plays in the lysosome is unclear. Some researchers think the LAMP-2 protein may help transport cellular materials or digestive enzymes into the lysosome. The transport of cellular materials into lysosomes requires the formation of cellular structures called autophagic vacuoles (or autophagosomes). Cellular material that will be degraded in a lysosome is first enclosed in an autophagic vacuole inside the cell. The autophagic vacuole attaches (fuses) to a lysosome to transfer the cellular material into the lysosome where it can be broken down. The LAMP-2 protein may be involved in the fusion between autophagic vacuoles and lysosomes.Slightly different versions (isoforms) of the LAMP-2 protein are produced: LAMP-2A, LAMP-2B, and LAMP-2C. These isoforms are found in different tissues throughout the body. LAMP-2B is the main isoform found in the heart and the muscles used for movement (skeletal muscles).
chi: LAMP2基因提供了制造溶酶体相关膜蛋白-2（LAMP-2）蛋白质的模板。该蛋白质在溶酶体的膜中发现。溶酶体是细胞中消化和回收材料的细胞器。 LAMP-2蛋白在溶酶体中的作用尚不清楚。一些研究人员认为LAMP-2蛋白可能有助于将细胞物质或消化酶转运到溶酶体中。将细胞物质转运到溶酶体中需要形成称为自噬体的细胞结构。在溶酶体中降解的细胞物质首先被封闭在细胞内的自噬体中。自噬体连接到溶酶体，将细胞物质转移到溶酶体中，在那里进行分解。 LAMP-2蛋白可能参与自噬体和溶酶体之间的融合。

name: COL5A1
eng: wait to add
chi: COL5A1基因提供制备V型胶原蛋白成分的模板。 胶原蛋白是一类蛋白质，可以加强和支持身体中的许多组织，包括皮肤，韧带，骨骼，肌腱和肌肉。胶原蛋白起始于绳状的前胶原分子，每个分子由三条链组成。 两种链的组合可产生V型胶原：三种pro-α1（V）链或两种pro-α1（V）链和一种pro-α2（V）链（其由COL5A2基因产生）。三链前胶原分子由细胞外的酶处理以产生成熟的胶原。 然后，胶原蛋白分子将自身排列成长而细的原纤维，具有另一种形式的胶原蛋白，I型.V型胶原调节这些原纤维的直径。研究表明，V型胶原蛋白还控制其他类型胶原蛋白在几种组织中组装成原纤维。

name: SYNE2
eng: wait to add
chi: 由该基因编码的蛋白质是结合细胞质F-肌动蛋白的核外膜蛋白。这种结合将细胞核束缚在细胞骨架上，有助于维持细胞核的结构完整性。具体而言，SYNE2和SUN2组装成跨膜肌动蛋白相关核（TAN）系列，其与F-肌动蛋白结合，并在肌动蛋白依赖性运动期间将细胞核耦合至逆行肌动蛋白流。

name: DNAAF3
eng: The protein encoded by this gene is required for the assembly of axonemal inner and outer dynein arms and plays a role in assembling dynein complexes for transport into cilia. Defects in this gene are a cause of primary ciliary dyskinesia type 2 (CILD2). Several transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene.
chi: 由该基因编码的蛋白质是轴向内部和外部动力蛋白臂的组装所必需的，并且在组装动力蛋白复合物转运到纤毛中起作用。已经发现了几种编码不同同种型的转录物变体用于该基因。

name: SYNE1
eng: The SYNE1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called Syne-1 that is found in many tissues, but it seems to be especially critical in the brain. The Syne-1 protein plays a role in the maintenance of the part of the brain that coordinates movement (the cerebellum). The Syne-1 protein is active (expressed) in Purkinje cells, which are located in the cerebellum and are involved in chemical signaling between nerve cells (neurons). The protein is thought to attach the membrane of Purkinje cells to the actin cytoskeleton, which is a network of fibers that make up the cell's structural framework. It is not clear what role this attachment plays in Purkinje cell function.
chi: SYNE1基因提供Syne-1蛋白质的模板，这种蛋白质存在于许多组织中，但它似乎在大脑中尤其重要。 Syne-1蛋白在维持协调运动的小脑部分中起作用。 Syne-1蛋白在浦肯野细胞中有活性，其位于小脑中并参与神经元之间的化学信号传导。 该蛋白被认为将浦肯野细胞膜附着在肌动蛋白细胞骨架上，肌动蛋白细胞骨架是构成细胞结构框架的纤维网络。 目前尚不清楚这种附着在浦肯野细胞功能中起什么作用。

name: FLNC
eng: wait to add
chi: 该基因编码三个相关丝状蛋白基因中的一个，特别是γ-丝状蛋白。这些丝状蛋白将肌动蛋白丝交联成皮质细胞质中的正交网络，参与肌动蛋白细胞骨架的膜蛋白锚定。在丝状蛋白中存在三个功能域：N-末端丝状肌动蛋白结合结构域、C-末端自结合结构域和膜糖蛋白结合结构域。肌特异性丝状蛋白，在肌肉细胞中起着中心作用，可能是作为一种大肌动蛋白交联蛋白发挥作用。可能参与重组肌动蛋白细胞骨架响应于信号事件，以及肌肉细胞中的Z线的结构功能。对于正常肌肉发育和维持肌肉纤维的结构完整性至关重要

name: ACTA1
eng: wait to add
chi: ACTA1基因提供了制造称为骨骼α-肌动蛋白的蛋白质的模板，该蛋白质是肌动蛋白家族的一员。肌动蛋白对细胞运动和肌纤维的收缩很重要。这些蛋白质也有助于维持细胞骨架，细胞骨架是决定细胞形状和内容物的结构框架。骨骼肌α-肌动蛋白在骨骼肌中起重要作用，在骨骼肌细胞中，骨骼α-肌动蛋白是称为肌节的结构的重要组成部分。 重叠的细长细丝的结合和释放允许它们相对于彼此移动，使得肌肉可以收缩。
